She is very happy with this loan being granted and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric and for maintenance of her sewing machine

loans.name: Jennifer Kalekye

texts.en:
Jeniffer is 47 years old.  She is married to Joshua, who also works to contribute to the family income. She has six children.

Jeniffer has been practicing mix farming and operating a grocery store for a period of one year.  From these activities, she earns an income of about KES. 30,000 per  month.

This is Jeniffer's fourth loan from KADET LTD.  She successfully repaid the previous ones well and in good time.  Jeniffer will use the loan to buy a dairy goat, fertilizer, and onions seedlings.   She hopes to expand her business, give her children a quality education, and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy a dairy goat, fertilizer and onions seedlings.

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Pon C. is a 54 year-old woman who lives in the Kompong Tom province. She is a married woman and blessed with two children. All of them are employed in various occupations and they always share their earnings every month with her in order to meet the daily household expenses. She was married but her husband died many years ago. Pon C. earns her living by raising piglets to sell as well as growing cashew nuts on her land which was given to her by her grandparents in 2006. 
Recently, her cashew crop has not been growing well because there is a lot grass in and around her crop. Because of this, Pon C. has decided to seek a loan to hire a few local laborers to clear the field so that her cashew crop can grow well.

loans.use: To hire a few local laborers to clear the field so her cashew crop can grow well.

loans.name: María Victoria

texts.es: La señora María Victoria se dedica a la actividad D. venta D. comida hace varios años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio lo cual es propio. Vive con su esposo que es jubilado ambos se ayudan en los gastos familiares, sus hijos son independientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para la preparación D. sus comidas. Se propone otorgarle el crédito por tener experiencia crediticia y buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en: Señora María Victoria has been selling meals for several years. Her business is located in her house, which she owns. She lives with her husband who is retired. They share household expenses. Their children are independent. She applies for a loan to buy ingredients for her dishes. The microfinance institution Caja Rural Señor D. Luren suggests granting the loan thanks to her good credit history and her personal and work references.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dry Fish Sellers Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Dry Fish Sellers” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Aminata L..  Aminata was born in Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone.  However, she is currently residing in Waterloo together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a soldier and her children are attending primary school. For twenty-two years now, Aminata has been selling palm-oil, margi (flavoring), onions, ogeri, etc. With this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale prices to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy palm-oil, margi, onions, ogeri, etc. at wholesale prices

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena K. is a producer of palm oil at Abura, near Frami. She also sells cosmetics and underwear.  Abena has attained a senior high level of education. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a petty trader. As a way of supporting her husband, she pays the school fees of her children. She wants to expand her cosmetics and underwear business. So she is requesting a loan to buy these items in larger quantities for resale. The increase in her capital as a result of the loan will be used to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of cosmetics and underwear for resale

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with two children who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past eight years, Lucy has operated a retail business, selling to her local neighbors. She also operates real estate houses which contribute to her income. Lucy faces major challenges of delayed payments and low sales in her business.

Lucy plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase one sack of sugar, wheat flour and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es: Alberta y su esposo son una pareja muy trabajadora que esta dispuesta a ofrecer a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. La casa que ellos tienen es muy pequeña por lo que necesitaba que realizar la construcción de un cuarto mas para tener mayor espacio, su proyecto lo empezaron con ahorros propios pero no les fue suficiente para terminarlo. Ellos solicitan un préstamo para comprar material de construcción y pagar mano de obra para colocar la losa y dar por terminado su proyecto y así vivir cómodamente.
texts.en: Alberta and her husband are a very hard-working couple who are ready to offer their son a better quality of life. The house that they have is very small, so they needed to build an additional room to have more space. They began their project with their own savings, but it was not enough to finish the work. They are requesting a loan to buy construction material and pay for labor to lay the slabs and finish up their project so they can live comfortably.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Roaldo

texts.es: Don Roaldo: es de 44 años casado tiene una hija que estudia el se dedica a vender productos de usos domesticos como ponchos,chamarras,cortinas,etc el nombre de su comercial es KENDY el nos cuenta que solo vende por las mañanas porque por las tardes ocupa su tiempo en cobrar el sueño de el es ampliar su negocio y abrir otro local para aumentar sus ventas para darle un mejor futuro a su esposa y a su hija, el credito lo solicita para la compra de productos de usos domesticos para la venta.
texts.en:
Roaldo is 44 years old and married.  He has a daughter who goes to school.

He sells domestic products like ponchos, jackets, and curtains, etc.  The name of his business is Kendy.  He tells us that he only sells in the mornings.  In the afternoons he uses his time to achieve his dream of expanding his business and opening another location.  He will do this to increase sales in order to give his wife and daughter a better future.

He will use the requested loan to buy domestic products to sell.

loans.use: to buy domestic use products.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: Maria Margarita tiene 56 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 25 años en este negocio, por lo que ha demostrado ser una persona capaz y responsable disfruta mucho de su trabajo y de sacar adelante su negocio. El financiamiento es para la compra de calzado, ropa en general, cosméticos, toallas, sabanas y ropa interior. Maria desea mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Margarita is 56 years old and sells general merchandise.  She has been in this business for more than 25 years and has shown herself to be a capable and responsible person who enjoys her work a lot and enjoys getting ahead in her business. 

María will use her loan to buy footwear, clothes, cosmetics, towels, sheets and underwear.  She would like to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy footwear, clothes, cosmetics, towels, sheets and underwear

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with 5 children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. 

For the past 9 years, Margaret has been operating a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in competition from other retail shop operators. She dreams of becoming self-reliant in the future.

With this loan for 60,000 Kshs, Margaret wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, sacks of rice, sugar and wheat flour for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Edilia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, Edilia abre las puertas de su negocio, una tienda de productos propios de la canasta familiar ubicada en Medellín, el negocio aunque fue heredado de su padre es la única fuente de sustento de esta emprendedora quien sabe que aunque son largas horas las que debe trabajar para sacar adelante su negocio, es la manera como obtiene los ingresos para cubrir sus gastos personales. 
 
Edilia necesita de un préstamo para realizar algunas adecuaciones locativas y comprar mayor variedad de surtido para mejorar sus ingresos. En el futuro espera crecer su tienda para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Edilia has a store in Medellín where she sells household products. The doors of her business are open from 6am to 10pm. She inherited this business from her father and it is her only source of income. Despite having to work long hours, Edilia knows that it is necessary in order to get ahead in her business. This allows her to generate revenue so that she can cover her personal expenses.

Edilia needs a loan to make a few improvements to her store and purchase a variety of merchandise in bulk so that she can improve her earnings. In the future, she hopes to expand her store in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to make a few improvements to her store and to purchase a wide variety of merchandise in bulk.

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.en:
Jefferson is 31 years of age.  He is married and is blessed with 2 children. He has been growing rice for almost 5 years.  From his last crop, his net income was 30,000 PHP. 

Jefferson is asking for a loan of 28,000 PHP to purchase additional farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers. He hopes that KIVA lenders will continue assisting him in the business so that he can further improve it and support his family with enough basic necessities.

loans.use: buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with one son who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business for the past year, her potential customers being neighbors and passersby. In addition, she sells herbal medicine and beauty products which provide her with another source of income. 

With the 80,000 Kshs, she plans to purchase another motorcycle for her transport business. She decided to join Yehu because of its good customer service.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle for her transport business.

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es:
Maria Josefa tiene 65 años D. edad, ella es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Nueva Esperanza del Distrito D. TambogranD.. Su comunidad es zona rural  D. este distrito por lo que aún no cuenta  con servicios básicos.

María Josefa se dedica a la comercialización D. ganado ovino, además cría aves D. corral como gallinas y patos los cuales cría y engorda y cuando estos se encuentran en un peso y tamaño apropiado los comercializa en el mercado local  o con sus vecinos y amigos, esta actividad la desarrolla desD. hace mas D. 5 años, en la parte posterior D. su domicilio, 

María Josefa esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1500 para que pueda comprar alimentos balanceados para el engorD. D. su ganado y aves para que D. esta manera pueda venderlos a un mejor precio y así seguir creciendo en su negocio lo cual le permite mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Maria Josefa is 65, married, and has 3 children. She lives in her own home, which is located in the hamlet of Nueva Esperanza, in the TambogranD. district. Her community is a rural zone of this district, and for this reason she does not have basic services.

Maria Josefa sells sheep, and also raises barnyard birds such as hens and ducks, which she raises and fattens. When they reach an appropriate weight and size, she sells them in the local market or to neighbours and friends. She has had this business for over five years, and runs it in the back of her home.

Maria Josefa is requesting a loan of 1500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can purchase balanced feed for fattening her livestock and birds, so that she can sell them at a better price and thus continue expanding her business. This will allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for fattening her livestock.

loans.name: Urunani Group

texts.fr:
Félicité est une commerçante  âgée de 41 ans . Elle habite à la Colline Mugutu en province de Gitega.  Elle vend la farine de manioc depuis 10 ans. Elle a fait les études jusqu’au niveau du primaire. Elle est mariée  à Joseph qui est chauffeur et  ils ont 6 enfants dont 5 étudient. 
Le crédit de Kiva de 120000 Fbu va lui permettre  d’augmenter  le capital  afin d’acheter beaucoup  de stock de farine à revendre pour réaliser  de grands bénefices. 
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire  “URUNANI”
texts.en:
Félicité is a 41-year-old merchant living on Mugutu Hill in the province of Gitega. She has been selling cassava flour for ten years. She attended elementary school. She is married to Joseph, a driver, and they have six children, with five of them attending school. Félicité will use her loan of 120,000 Burundi francs provided through Kiva to buy large quantities of flour for resale. She expects to make a good profit.

Félicité is a member of Urunani Community Group.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy large quantities of cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Cristal

texts.en:
Cristal, 19 and single, lives in Ilagan. She is a very good daughter who, wanting to help her family cover household expenses, three years ago started a small business. She has a small, home-based grocery store where she sells all sorts of products like: rice, sugar, oil and detergent, among others. She works daily from 6am until 8pm and sometimes even later. Her parents help her when they can. With help from the loans she hopes to gradually improve the business over time.

She will use this loan to stock her store more. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cured meats and other basic-need items. Her goals are to stay in business and that her store grows more every day and also to invest and save for her future.

loans.use: to buy oil, drinks and sugar for her store.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Las señora Teresa, vive en un barrio lejano  que para bajar a la ciudad  se  tiene que caminar hasta la carretera y de ahí trasladarse en transporte colectivo. Ella es casada con el señor Orbelin y con quien procreo  dos hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad.

   Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en al compra de ropas para damas y caballero, en donde lleva practicando cinco años y comenta que le va bien  pues ha visto un buen resultado.

   Lo que lo motivo a esta actividad  fue su  esposo quien le dijo que le daría unos ahorros para que pusiera un negocio y ella solicito el préstamo  para apoyarse y compra algo de mejor calidad.

  Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña  actividad pueda ir mejorando  día con día y tener sus propios ahorros para sacar adelante a sus  hijos.
texts.en:
Teresa lives in an outlying neighborhood - in order to go down into the city she has to walk to the highway and take collective transportation from there. She is married to Orbelin and they have 2 children who are still in her care.

She asks for a loan to invest in the purchase of clothes for women and men. She has been doing this for 5 years and says that it's going well and she has seen good results. She started this activity because her husband gave her some savings to put into a business and she took out a loan to support her and buy better quality goods.

What she wants most from this small business is to improve daily and to have her own savings to help her children get ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Savoeun (in the photo) is 41 years old and his wife, Vannary, is 32 years old. They have been married since 2000 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Three of the children are in school and the other one is still too young for school. The family lives in a village, along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Savoeun is a farmer, while his wife is a garment worker. He hopes to earn extra income to better support his family. He will be launching a new business driving a Tuk Tuk taxi, when he is free from farming. So, he has decided to apply for his first loan, in the amount of $1,200, to buy a Tuk Tuk.

loans.use: To buy a Tuk Tuk taxi to drive.

loans.name: Rhona

texts.en: Rhona lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children who both go to school. She has additional family members. She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 20 years. She has requested for a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major challenges are seasonality and the ever-increasing price of charcoal. Her inspiration and goal is to build rental houses in the future. Rhona lives in her own house and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expense includes school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia is married with 8 children. Concordia is 55 years of age and she lives in Pulang Yuta,Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. Concordia has a stall lin their barangay market and she sells variety of products and had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000.00 to purchase goods additional for her  business.
 
Concordia has been a member of GDMPC for 1 year.  In the future, Concordia hopes that with the help of GDMPC she can have her own stall and not to rent anymore.

loans.use: to purchase goods additional to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 47 years old, a married woman with five children, all five of whom are in school. She has a business as a clothes sewer in Buluk, South Sudan. She has been in this business for seven years. Her husband works as a civil servant.

Grace requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase a sewing machine. She will use her profits from this loan to build a permanent house in future.

loans.use: to purchase  more cloth to sew.

loans.name: Nsuari

texts.en:
Nsuari has operated a weaved items (mats and coconut roof thatches) selling business for the past ten years; she sells her products from home and her potential clients are her neighbors and the village residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where sometimes there is low demand especially during the dry seasons. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase more coconut dry leaves and sisal for weaving her products. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to acquire financial assistance to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more coconut dry leaves and sisal for weaving her products.

loans.name: Javier Wilfredo

texts.es: El cliente comenzó siendo solo chofer de un vehículo al que le entregaba renta, ahorro poco a poco y con la ayuda de las financieras se compro su auto con el trabaja actualmente, su esposa se dedica a la servicio de comidas rápida, ambos cuentan con solvencia y ganas de desarrollarse en sus actividades como en su familia. Ahora su hija menor esta con problemas de salud y la madre la esta atendiendo la hija aparte de estar embarazada, tiene retraso mental, ella tiene 16 años, y por el problema de retraso mental tiene el carácter de un niño de 4 años, pese así enfermedad los padres sobrellevan junto a su hija la cotidianidad del día a día para ellos tener una actividad se torna en una distracción con el esfuerzo de la crianza de su hija, pero de todas formas le tienen un gran afecto y siempre le están ayudando en sus quehaceres. La ayuda que significara el préstamo Kiva hará efecto en toda la familia ya que se verán aliviados apaliando los gastos en los que incurran en la intervención de su hija y asi la famlia estara mejor.
texts.en:
Javier started out working as a driver with a rented car. Little by little, he saved some money and, with the help of the microfinance institution, was able to buy a car which he now uses at work. His wife works selling fast food. Both are solvent and want to make progress in their businesses, as well as growing as a family.

Now, their youngest daughter is having some health problems. His wife is taking care of their daughter who, apart from being pregnant, is developmentally disabled. Their daughter is 16 years old, and, due to her disability, acts like a 4-year-old. Despite her disability, their parents live a normal day-to-day life. Having a business is a distraction from the hard work they do raising their daughter. No matter what, they love her very much and they are always helping her out. 

This loan would relieve the whole family since it will be used to cover some costs of their daughter's care. The family will feel better.

loans.use: To buy medicine for his daughter.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo de 38 años vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en las edades de 3 a 17 años en uno de los barrios más alegres y populares del sur de la ciudad. Allí se dedica a ofrecer servicios de decoraciones y pinturas para fiestas y cumpleaños y también diseños para adornar motocicletas. Para la puesta en marcha de esta idea emprendedora, Ricardo trabajó en un taller, donde obtuvo su mayor experiencia y posteriormente con su liquidación se independizó y compró lo necesario paraa quienes  en sus tiempos libres complacía con sus hermosos diseños, esto hizo más fácil el lograr emprender su propia aventura de negocios, la cual   inició en patio de su casa, como hasta hoy lo tiene.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su quinto financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que tiene 7 años de estar vinculado. Con sus anteriores créditos ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo, sacar adelante a su familia y aumentar su bienestar. Su meta más adelante es tener su casa propia y lograr el crecimiento de su negocio y generar empleos.  Con su credikiva, al que está aplicando, comprará materiales como pintura, icopor, pinceles, lápiz, borradores, cintas, para aprovechar la temporada navideña, época en la cual Ricardo usualmente hace su máxima venta.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 38 years old, and he lives with his wife and 3 children aged 3 to 17. He lives in one of the prettiest and most popular neighborhoods south of the city. He provides decorations and paintings for holiday and birthdays, and he designs decorations for motorcycles. To carry out his idea, Richard worked in a shop where he got a lot of experience. With their liquidation he went solo and bought what he needed from them to make beautiful designs in his free time. This made it easier for him to start his own business venture which began in his backyard where it is today. 

Currently he has applied for his 5th loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization he’s worked with for 7 years. With his previous loans he was able to build his working capital, help his family, and increase their well-being. His goal going forward is to own his own home, continue growing his business, and generate work. With the Kiva loan he’s asked for, he will buy materials like paint, styrofoam, paint brushes, pencils, erasers, and tape because he’s the holiday season is approaching, a time when Ricardo usually makes the most of his sales.

loans.use: to buy materials like paint, styrofoam, paint brushes, pencils, erasers, tape,

loans.name: Makatini 3 Group

texts.en:
Noah is the facilitator of the Makatini 3 group. Noah and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Noah takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Noah had a good maize yield, harvesting 13 ½ bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Noah was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Noah and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Noah will educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Makatini 3 group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 24 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and her husband is a university student. They have four children between the ages of 5 to 10, all of them are attending school and live at home. For the past seven years she has been selling bitter balls in bags in the market. She has more customers and makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase additional bags of bitter balls for her business. Ruth's plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of bitter balls for her business.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío, de 49 años, es una mujer muy buena, amable y trabajadora, esta separada del que fue su conviviente por muchos años y con quien tuvo res hijas, de las cuales solo una es menor y aun depende de ella para poder tener educación y alimentación. Juntas viven en su casa propia y juntas trabajan mucho a diario para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Rocío consiste en la venta de golosinas y otros productos, y que son expuestos en un pequeño tablero frente a un parque muy transitado de su ciudad. Su negocio es muy concurrido por los niños, ya que siempre tiene cosas muy deliciosas para vender, además que tiene mucha paciencia para atenderlos, motivo por el cual casi siempre acaba con su mercadería. Además ella preparara algunas cosas más como maíz (pop corn) dulces y salado, lleva frutas y otros productos que las personas siempre desean comer. Esto lo hace ya que aprendió durante todo este tiempo, por lo que hay que tener mucha variedad que ofrecer a los clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite decidir su horario de atención, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto sin poder moverse. Espera con el tiempo juntar el dinero necesario, para poner una tienda de abarrotes. Este será el sexto préstamo con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 600 soles, comprará mas golosinas y grutas para así seguir ofreciendo sus productos en variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rocio is 49 years old. She is a good, friendly, and hardworking woman, separated from her partner of many years with whom she had three daughters. Only one of her daughters is still a minor and depending on Rocio for her education and care. They live in her house and work together every day to be able to have a better quality of life.

Rocio's works selling candy and other products, which are exhibited on a small table in front of a busy park in her city. Her business is very popular with children, as she always has delicious things to sell, and also because she has a lot of patience for serving children. She almost always sells out of her merchandise. In addition to candy, Rocio prepares things like sweet and salty popcorn, and she brings fruit and other products that people always want to eat. She does this because what she has learned during this time is that one should always have a lot of variety to offer to customers.

What Rocio likes most about her work is that it allows her to decide her own schedule. She has been doing this for two years, and she thinks the most difficult part is to stay in one place all day without moving. She hopes that in time she will be able to put together the necessary money to put in a general store. 

This will be her sixth loan with MFP, and she is looking forward to the collaboration that will help her continue working toward her goals. She is also determined to make her payments on time, as she did with her past loans. In addition, Rocio is grateful for being part of the communal bank, because all of its members are very responsible and supportive. With the requested amount of 600 soles (~230 USD), she will buy more candy and fruit to continue offering a variety of products to her clients.

loans.use: to buy candy and fruit.

loans.name: Ranan

texts.en:
Ranan is 36 years old and married. She is from Al Hussein, Amman; Jordan. Ranan is making handmade masterpieces and rugs and operating from her home. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase raw materials needed to make rugs.

Ranan is looking to expand her home-based project by networking with other countries such as Libya since she used to live there.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make handmade rugs

loans.name: Israel

texts.es: Israel, de 27 años, es un joven muy alegre y luchador, vive en su propia casa  junto a su esposa Eugenia de 22 años y sus 02 queridos hijos, Alexander de 04 y Josue de 03 años de edad, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Israel, es un hombre de provecho, se dedica con mucho esmero a labrar la tierra  para luego cultivar plantas de café, cacao y hojas de cosa, actividad que realiza hace más de  10 años. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros; de esa manera extrae rápido los frutos para luego ser  comercializados a las empresas acopiadoras, quienes le remuneran buena ganancias por cada kilogramo de cacao, café y hojas de coca que vende. Sin embargo le resulta difícil transportar sus frutos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio, situado en la ciudad de San Francisco. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar la siembra y de esa manera aumentar su producción y por ende obtener una buena estabilidad económica.  Este será su  crédito número 02 con MFP, está dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. En su banco comunal es un socio muy participe. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, contratará jornaleros para que lo apoyen en sacar la maleza que aqueja sus plantas.
texts.en:
Israel, 27, is a very good-natured and determined young man. He lives in his own home along with his wife Eugenia, 22, and their two dear children, Alexander, 4, and Josue, 3, to whom he wishes to provide a better quality of life. Israel is a productive citizen and devotes himself wholeheartedly to working the earth in order to plant coffee, cocoa and coca leaf plants, something he has been doing for more than ten years. During harvest times he relies on the support of day laborers so as to rapidly extract the beans and leaves for sale to the warehousing companies who remunerate him well for each kilogram of cocoa, coffee and coca leaves he sells. However, it is difficult for him to transport his products from the farm to the warehouses, located in the city of San Francisco [Peru]. But for now his biggest priority is to buy new land in order to increase his acreage for planting and thus increase production and achieve good financial stability. 

This will be his second loan with MFP. He is willing to make all his payments on time, since he wishes to have access to another loan further on. In his communal bank he is a highly participative member. With the 2,000 Peruvian soles he will hire day laborers to assist him in removing the weeds afflicting his plants.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is 45-years old, married  woman living with her husband and nine children in the area of Multan. Her husband owns a General store in which he sells Shampoo, bath soaps, detergents, biscuits, rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well, his some relatives like to purchase from his General Store. He speaks with monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone; he has built up very good relation with his customers.Nasreen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he would be able to buy  additional products to increase his income. He hopes that lenders will support him and this loan will prove productive for her husband's business as well. She is much impressed with the KIVA loan cycle system;she is thankful to the lenders as well.

loans.use: To buy her husband's general store's items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy sacks of cereals, laundry detergents,beverages and antiseptics for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Khanbala

texts.en: Khanbala is 39, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of  Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. He is settled in Fizuli region, Makhmudlu village, married, and has 2 children. He has been running a cattle-breeding business which he started 4 years ago. Now he needs a loan of US$725  to buy a pregnant cow  for improving his business.

loans.use: Purchase of a pregnant cow

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur H. is a 26-year-old single businessman. He lives in the southern part of Azerbaijan, in the center of the town of Imishli. He started his business 3 years ago. With money he borrowed form his friends he rented a small store and purchased pens, notebooks and markers. In less than one year his business increased and all these goods sold quickly. He enlarged his store and purchased more stationery. Elnur's store is open from early morning until late at night, and selling is going very well, so he decided to apply for $900 loan to add to his inventory computer accessories.

loans.use: To start selling computer accessories

loans.name: Shamil

texts.en: Shamil A., a 34-year-old man, is married and has two  children. He has his own orchard in Yenikand village in the Salyan region and has been in this business for eight years. Now he requests a loan of $725 to buy pesticides to improve his orchard.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita has devoted much effort to the cultivation of mangoes and cocoa, thanks to the support of her partner whom she married years ago. Together, they've devoted their efforts and continued commitment to their agricultural work in order to give a proper education to their children who brought joy to their lives each day. But sadly, even with all their hard work and good intentions, they suffered a great tragedy when their eldest daughter suffered a serious accident in which she lost her life. This brought great anguish and sorrow to their home, but despite having great pain and sadness in their hearts, Rita collected all her strength and took over the care of their small grandchildren (3 and 7 years old), which were orphaned when their mother died, and because their father didn't want to take responsibility of them. Despite all the sadness (over their daughter's death), joy filled them when she and her husband took over the paternity of her grandchildren and began to work hard for them. As a consequence of this situation, Rita intends to upgrade their products and expand the cultivation of their land. This is why she is applying for a loan (to buy fertilizers) in order to improve their crops, which will help them in creating a pleasant life for her grandchildren. With your help Rita can provide a life suited to their grandchildren and provide them with a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Rita, se ha dedicado con mucho esfuerzo al cultivo de mangos y cacao; gracias al apoyo de su pareja con el que contrajo matrimonio años atrás, dedicó por completo sus esfuerzos y empeño constante a su labor agrícola a fin de brindarle una adecuada educación a sus pequeños niños que alegraban su día a día su humilde morada.Sin embargo cuando todo esfuerzo y trabajo estaba concentrado hacia ese fin su hija mayor sufrió un grave accidente en el que perdió la vida; este hecho trajo gran congoja y tristeza en su hogar y a pesar de tener gran dolor e inmensa tristeza dentro de su corazón, se armó de valor para hacerse cargo de sus pequeños nietecitos de 3 y 7 añitos, los cuales quedaron huérfanos porque su padre nunca quiso hacerse responsable de ellos.Motivo por la cual ella y su esposo asumieron la paternidad de sus nietos y por ellos trabajan arduamente y muy contentos para también otorgarles felicidad y bienestar.Ha consecuencia de esta situación Rita, tiene pensado mejorar sus productos y extender el cultivo de sus terrenos y solicita un préstamo para acrecentar sus productos y comprar abonos a fin de mejorar sus cosechas, que le ayudarán a tener una vida placentera para ella y sus nietos.Con tu colaboración Rita podrá brindar una vida adecuada a sus nietos y brindarles un futuro prometedor

loans.use: For the purchase of seeds and fertilizers to benefit their harvest and quality of their products.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
The client currently lives with his wife and two children. He is need of a mode of transportation that will take him quickly from one place to another. His business of electrical, plumbing, and other types of repairs require him oftentimes to make house calls. He finds himself having a difficult time of arriving in a timely manner for his customers. For this reason, he seeks a loan to be able to purchase a car that would allow him to arrive more quickly and cover his route more efficiently. With an improved mode of transportation, he would be able to improve his earnings, give his children a better education, and cover the living expenses of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El cliente vive actualmente con su esposa y dos hijos, se le hace necesario el poder transportarse de un lugar a otro de manera rápida ya que su negocio es de reparaciones eléctricas servicio de fontanería y otros, en muchas ocasiones los clientes le solicitan el servicio a domicilio y no puede dárselo de manera oportuna, es por eso que solicita el crédito para poder comprar un vehículo que le permita llegar mas rapìdo y poder cubrir la ruta además de esa manera podría tener mas ingresos y poder dar a sus hijos una mejor educación y solventar las necesidades de la familia .

loans.use: Purchase a car to better serve his electrical and plumbing repair customers who require house calls.

location.town: Col. 20 de Octubre  Calle Principal Poligon 2 lote

loans.name: Nelson

texts.fr:
Mr. Nelson T. is a 35-year-old mechanic and a married father of three children. He has owned an auto repair garage for the last five years. The income he earns from his business allows him to pay for his children’s education and to meet his family’s needs. With this loan, he would like to purchase the equipment he currently lacks in order to better satisfy his customers and in turn earn more to support his family.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Nelson T. est un mécanicien âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 03 enfants. Il est propriétaire d'un garage de réparation d'automobile depuis 5 ans .Les revenus de son activité lui permettent de financer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il souhaite par ces fonds acquérir les outils de travail qui lui font défaut afin de satisfaire plus ses clients et par là gagner plus d’argent pour répondre aux exigences de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of mechanic’s equipment to increase working capacity

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen A. is 34 years old. She is married with 5 children. She sells drinks and pepper soup. She hails from Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 2002. She needs the loan amount of $275 to buy more drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Saom

texts.en:
Mrs. Saom Y., 50, is a widow with eight children. She works making Khmer food (a roll made of hashed meat - usually pork) wrapped and cooked in banana leaves. Normally, people like eating this with wine or beer. On average, she earns around $2.50 a day in profit. One of her children is employed as a hotel security guard with a salary $50 a month, and helps her mother make the food.

The loan from Kiva will be used to purchase rice, banana leaves and generator gas. She wants to expand the business to gain more profits. (Mrs. Saom Y. is pictured with her daughter.)

loans.use: To purchase rice, banana leaves and generator gas.

loans.name: Siri

texts.en:
Siri is single woman who owns a small beauty salon, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 9am to 6pm in the salon and she can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items such as hair conditioner and weaving for her salon.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A. is married and has four children. She is a trader who travels to farming areas to purchase food products in large quantities for resale. She also sells building materials. Business is growing and Lydia wishes to increase sales but the cost of transportation takes a great part of her profit.

She is asking for a loan to purchase higher quantities of food for resale.

loans.use: To buy higher inventories of food products for resale

loans.name: Ho Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ho Thi H., 50 years old, joined the Fund since 2004. Since joining the TYM Fund, her family economy experiences improvements by opening a local drink station. She regularly borrows money from the Fund. She has 2 children and both of them are building their own families and one of them is living seperately. Her children work and earn approximately 200 USD/month. She earns 3-4 USD/ day. Because of stable income, repaying weekly is not very problematic for her. This time she wants to borrow 725 USD to expand her drink service. Her average income is 225 USD/ month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hồ Thị Hợp 50 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2004, từ khi tham gia vào Quỹ Kinh tế gia đình chị đã có nhiều thay đổi, với việc kinh doanh hàng giải khát tại địa phương gia đình chị vay các vòng vốn của Quỹ rất đều đặn, Chị có 2 con và 2 con chị đều đã xây dựng gia đình và 1 con đã ở riêng, hiện nay vợ chồng chị đang sống cùng 1 người con, con chị cũng đi làm và thu nhập bình quân 2.000.000đ/ tháng, chị bán hàng giải khát tại địa phương cho thu nhập đều đăn bình quân 50.000đ/ ngày. Với thu nhập đều đăn này thì việc hoàn trả vốn của gia đinh chị là không mấy khó khăn. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 12.000.000đ tiếp tục mở rộng mặt hàng giải khát. Thu nhập bình quân: 3.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Drink service

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. H. is 43 years old. She joined the TYM Fund since 1999. Since the beginning, she used the borrowed money in raising animals. She was raised in a family with agricultural tradition; therefore, she has a lot of experience in breeding animals. After 9 years of membership, her farm is expanded. She went from having 2-3 pigs to having 25 pigs. Currently, breeding animals is Mrs. H. and her 2 children’ responsibilities. Her husband is a carpenter, earning 100 USD/month. This time, she wants to borrow 1075 USD to fix the breeding facilities and buy more pigs. Her average income is 225 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Huyên năm nay 43 tuổi. Chị bắt đầu tham gia vào quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999. Ngay từ khi tham gia vào Quỹ chị đã vay vốn và sử dụng vào dự án chăn nuôi. Với truyền thống gia đình làm nghề nông nên gia đình chị đã có rất nhiều kinh nghiệm trong chăn nuôi. Đến nay qua 9 năm sử dụng vốn có hiệu quả mô hình chăn nuôi của gia đình chị đã được mở rộng hơn. Từ chỗ chỉ nuôi 2-3 con lợn đến nay gia đình chị đã có đàn lợn 25 con. Hiện tại công việc chăn nuôi tại gia đình do chị và 2 con đảm nhiệm, chồng chị hàng ngày đi làm thợ mộc cho thu nhập 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 18.000.000đ để sửa sang chuồng trại và mua lợn về nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân 3.500.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thavy is a mother of four children who lives in Phteah Rung Village, Pursat Province. She has been growing rice crops with her husband for eighteen years. Rice grows only in the rainy season. The rice crop provides the main income for her family; thus she has to sustain her efforts and be willing to expand in the future.

She increases her rice yield every year by using fertilizer. Now she is requesting a loan of KHR 500,000 ($125 USD) to purchase fertilizer to use to increase her rice yield.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to use to increase rice yield

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
Mrs. Orn S. (pictured with her daughter), 43, and her husband, Mr. Ra Dul, 44, who live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1993 and have four children; two sons and two daughters. One of her children is married and lives outside the family home. Two of the children are silk weavers and the youngest one studies in the local school.

Mrs. Orn has been a silk weaver for fifteen years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a construction worker.

Orn is requesting a loan of $100 to purchase silk materials for her weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa inició el negocio ya que siempre le han gustado las ventas, y de esta manera tiene la oportunidad de conocer personas además de que le permite ser independiente y ganar su propio dinero y también ayudar a sus hijos para que terminaran una carrera profesional y tener asi mejor calidad de vida. Comenzó en Agosto de 1992, primero vendiendo cerámica que una señora le daba a comisión para que la vendiera. Como se dio cuenta que era un buen negocio decidio independizarse y sus ganancias se duplicaron. Además de la cerámica también comenzó a vender productos de belleza y sus ganancias también eran buenas, posteriormente se dedicó a vender joyería y actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa. El anterior crédito que recibío a través de KIVA le sirvió muchísimo ya que pudo resurtir su negocio para la temporada de fin de año que es cuando las personas compran más.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $550 que pagara en 5 meses para volver a surtir el negocio para darle un mejor servicio a los clientes y para que estos le sigan comprando
texts.en:
Rosa started her business because she's always liked sales. Her business gives Rosa the opportunity to get to know other people, be independent, earn her own money, help her children pursue professional careers, and have a better quality of life. She started in August of 1992, first selling ceramics that she commissioned from a lady who crafts them. When she realized that business was good, she decided to work independently and her sales doubled. In addition to ceramics, she also began to sell beauty products, and later she added jewelry. Now she sells clothing, too. Rosa's previous loan with Kiva helped her a lot because she was able to resupply her business for the holiday season, when people spend more. Rosa needs a loan of US$550, which she'll repay in 5 months. She'll once again use the money to supply her business so as to provide better service to her customers so that they continue to buy.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Caro

texts.en: Caro O. sells drinks in her store.  She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  She is 51 years old and married with 5 children.  She buys drinks from distributors in Benin City.  She needs the loan amount of N52,000 to purchase more drinks to sell.  She hopes to be a major distributor of drinks in future.  She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Vivant dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village Bougoula Hameau, situé à environ 3km de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali, les membres du goupe Benkadi (8 femmes: 7 mariées et 1 célibataire) avec en moyenne 3 enfants et une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans). Ce groupe est une émmanation de l’association Badeya  unie par des liens  de parentés (des soeurs et cousines) et qui a pour activités génératrices de revenus l’achat et  la vente d’huile d’arachide,  de riz, de savons, de noix de Néré, des  produits de beauté, du «Soumbala » et des  condiments alimentaires. Le “Soumbala” est fait à base des noix de Néré après cuisson. 
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clièntele qui ne cesse d’augmenter, ce groupe décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son 4ème cycle du prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe). Tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles (les femmes du groupe) sollicitent ce prêt pour pouvoir acheter, 2 bariques d’huile d’arachide, 13 sacs de riz, 5 sacs de noix de Néré et une grande quantité de condiments (2 sacs d’oignon, 2 sacs d’aubergine, 1 sacs de gombo, 5 paquets d’arome , 5 boîtes de concentré tomate).
 Les villes de Bobo Dioulasso et de Bamako (respectivent au Burkina Faso et au Mali) sont les principales sources d’approvisionnement possibles des femmes de ce groupe. Les marchandises sont achiminées à Sikasso les jours de foire pour être vendues au comptant, à la fois en gros et détail à une clientèle composée très généralement des femmes et surtout des foraines. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au comptant et à crédits soit au marché local, soit à la maison à une clientèle locale feminine.
Elles (les femmes du groupe) envisagent réaliser chacune avec ce 4ème prêt un bénéfice moyen de 50.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utiliser pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir  aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités respectives.
texts.en:
Living in traditional extended families in the village of Bougoula Hameau, located about 3 km from the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali), the members of the group Benkadi (8 women: 7 married and 1 unmarried) average 3 children and 34 years of age. This group came out of the association Badeya and is united by ties of kinship (sisters and cousins). The group members work to earn an income by trading in peanut oil, rice, soap, néré seeds, beauty products, condiments, and "soumbala", which is made from cooked néré seeds.

To satisfy their ever-increasing customer base, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, with which they are on their fourth solidarity loan cycle (group loan). All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

The women of the group are requesting this loan to buy: 2 barrels of peanut oil, 13 sacks of rice, 5 sacks of néré seeds, and a sizable quantity of condiments (2 sacks of onions, 2 of eggplant, 1 of okra, 5 packets of flavorings, and 5 cans of tomato paste). The cities of Bobo Dioulasso and Bamako (respectively in Burkina Faso and Mali) are the main sources of supplies possible for the women.

The goods are taken to Sikasso on market days to be sold in cash at wholesale and retail levels, both. Their customers are generally composed of women and especially market vendors. Sales are made either at the local marketplace or out of homes, cash or credit accepted.

Using this fourth loan, the women each envision realizing an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay the loan interest, to provide for the family, and to invest the rest into their respective businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy conditments, peanut oil, rice, soap, néré seeds, beauty products

loans.name: Rosila

texts.en:
Rosila J. is a member in good standing of Mahayahay Center in Usocan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.  She is 29 years old and married to Danny. Rosila and her husband only finished high school. Hard work is what they have to do to live a good life, Rosila said.

Armed with the desire to have their own business, they began a fishing business. The couple need a lantern for fishing, which is will provide light in the dark with the use of a battery. They applied for a loan to purchase the lantern. Luckily, Paglaum MPC released the said amount. A portion of the amount will be used to purchase a blinker, which is another fishing accessory, used to attract a good catch of squid. Just like any other business, fishing has its many challenges. When fishing is banned for a period of time, her husband works in construction as a sideline. It's a matter of "diskarte" (strategies) on how to earn a living. In the future, Rosila and Danny want to repair their house from their earnings.

loans.use: To purchase a lantern for fishing.

loans.name: Khaitgul

texts.en:
Khaitgul is a 39-year-old married mother of two children. Her husband is an entrepreneur and Khaitgul started her business in 2002 in order to help support her family. All year she sells fruit and vegetables that she buys from local farmers. Twice a week, Khaitgul travels over 60 km to sell her produce at attractive prices at a busy market. With the loan of 3000 Somoni from Kiva, she plans to increase the range of her goods, and to buy apples, pomegranates, oranges, tomatoes, and cucumbers.

Khaitgul strives to give her children a better life than they have, including seeing them through a high level of education. With her business, she has been able to supply the community with fresh vegetables and also provide for her family. Khaitgul is a well-spoken, friendly businesswoman who is worthy of the support of Kiva lenders.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing the range of  fruit and vegetables she sells

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to two children - a boy and a girl. She says both of them are currently in the basic school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a small town called Simpa, a farming community which is a few kilometers away from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana.

The majority of the inhabitants are farmers or merchants. Grace works hard to help her husband take care of the family. Her husband is a cocoa/cassava farmer. Grace sells foodstuffs such as yams, cassava, plantains, cocoyams, etc. in the local market square. She buys the goods from farmers in the community.

She has been in business for about four years. She also distributes to food vendors in her community. Grace wants a loan to buy foodstuffs in bulk. She hopes to help her husband send their children all the way through school.

loans.use: To procure foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Abduhakim

texts.ru: Абдухакиму 33 года, он женат. Вместе с женой они воспитывают 2 детей. Вот уже несколько лет они занимаются мелким предпринимательством. Абдухаким нигде не работает и поэтому предпринимательство является основным доходом семьи. С Микроинвест Абдухаким сотрудничает уже три года и полученные займы внесли заметные изменения в его бизнес. Раньше они ездили по окрестным базарам, теперь приобрели маленький киоск и торгуют постоянно на одном месте. Ассортимент его товаров огромный, Абдухаким имеет множество постоянных клиентов. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса он планирует получить новый займ и собирается приобрести новый ассортимент товаров.
texts.en:
Abduhakim is 33 years old and married. He and his wife are raising two children. For several years they have run a small business. As Abduhakim has no other job, the business is his family's main source of income. He has been working with MicroInvest for three years and the loans he has received have made a significant impact on his business. Previously they traveled to neighboring bazaars, however now they have purchased a small kiosk and sell from a fixed location. Due to his broad assortment of goods, Abduhakim has many regular customers. To further develop his business, Abduhakim plans to take out a new loan to purchase a selection of new merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory

loans.name: Ndaga Beye

texts.fr: Madame Ndaga Beye M. est une femme mariée qui vend des bijoux et des vêtements prêt à porter pour enfants à Diourbel,  une petite ville rurale à 150 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal.  C’est son premier crédit, et elle va l’utiliser pour reconstituer son stock de marchandises pour mieux servir les clients dans le quartier.  Avec les revenus de son entreprise, elle soutient sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Ndaga Beye M. is a married woman who sells jewelry and ready-to-wear clothing for children in Diourbel, a small rural city located 150 km from Dakar, the capital of Sénégal. This is her first loan. She's going to use it to replenish her stock of merchandise in order to serve her customers better in the area. With these revenues from her enterprise, she supports her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To jewelry and ready-to-wear clothing for resale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina has been selling used clothes in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 5 years. She belongs to Tuwe Wakweli Group Loan (Group code 2090). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$90. She works at her business every day for 12 hours.  

Amina is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business, pay school fees for her children and save money for future use.  

Amina is 40 years old, married, and has two children: aged 23 and 21.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Miiro Christopher is a hardworking businessman, age 28. He deals in suitcases, briefcases, leather bags, canvas bags, and so on. He started this business 10 years ago when he was a boy of 18. Now he owns a plot of land where he has built some rental houses.

He is using the loan to purchase more bags in order to expand his business.

He has two kids and hopes to be able to educate them up to the university level.

loans.use: To purchase more bags in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar Muhammad Khalid Group

texts.en:
Naseem akhtar baji is the group leader of this group of four. They are all very supportive of each other. The other three members respect Naseem baji very much. They are very hardworking ladies. They handle their own businesses to share the financial burden of their husbands. Naseem baji wants  a loan to buy clothes for her husband’s clothes selling business.

Of the other ladies, Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell, Asia baji wants a loan to buy a bicycle for her bicycle selling business, and Suraiya begum baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Aterei C Auma Jennifer Group

texts.en:
A. Jennifer is 35 years old and married with five children who are all schooling. She makes bricks for sale. She has been in this business for 4 years.

She will use this loan to purchase a bicycle to simplify her movements to the base where she makes her bricks, and to pay the workers who help her make the bricks, load and offload them, and transport them to convenient places for sale. She is active and hardworking, and her dream is to work hard to improve the productivity of her business and her farm.

loans.use: Purchase a bicycle and pay her workers

loans.name: Association Djigbode Group

texts.fr: Cette association a été crée par 6 femmes dynamiques, le but de l’association à sa création fut d’aider  financièrement ses membres. Elles se sont toutes convenues de se spécialiser dans une activité qui est la vente  de pagnes. Certaines disposent d’étalage, d’autres font ce commerce de façon ambulante. A la fin de chaque semaine l’association se réunit pour identifier les problèmes auxquelles certaines font face afin de l’aider. Voulant agrandir l’activité du groupe elle ont décidé d’un commun accord de solliciter de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 30 pièces de pagnes de différentes qualité. 3 de ses femmes sont mariées et mères de famille,les trois autres sont des femmes célibataires
texts.en:
This group was formed by 6 dynamic women and its founding goal was to help the members financially. They all decided to specialise in selling pagne (printed fabric). Some of them use display stands, others sell on foot. The group gets together at the end of each week to identify and solve any problems they encounter.
Wishing to expand the group’s business, they mutually agreed to request a loan from WAGES to purchase 30 lengths of pagne of different quality. Three of these women are married mothers and the other three are single.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pagne

loans.name: Lê Thị

texts.en:
T. Lê Thị (1311020238) is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of HƯng Nguyên. She is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To making a living, T. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising water buffalo for sale. T. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund, which was used to purchase breeding livestock. T. is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Ngwa

texts.en:
Ngwa T. W. is a 65-year-old father of eight. He has been with GHAPE since 1999, and has been able to take out nine separate loans to be able to support his pig and fowl raising activities. For the first time, T. is looking to start another business as a motorcycle taxi driver, a rather profitable business in the area.

T. will use this motorcycle to take community members throughout the area to and from their homes and places of business, and will also aid in taking their produce to market. This activity is sure to succeed, T. thinks, because he will be the driver of this bike himself, rather than paying other people to take care of the machine and drive people around. With this being the case, he will be riding the bike more carefully than other people, working harder, while also being able to cut down on the maintenance needs of the bike. 

As he generates profits from this activity, T. will be using the money to invest in the education of his children, and also to improve on his family's living conditions. 

Originally coming to GHAPE, T. saw that they were one of the best options for providing credit in the area, as they have lower interest rates, more agreeable terms on their loans, and a payment plan that is not very stressful. In addition to this, T. has been able to enjoy GHAPE training on how to manage his business, his money, and also on how to operate in his family life and day to day dealings with other people.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of motorcycle, documentation and licensing

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer B., 38, believes that “the best way to a man’s heart is through his stomach.” She loves to cook for her family, especially her husband Jonjie, 38, who works as a driver and a part-time cook. They have four lovely children – all school-aged.

Five years ago, Jennifer converted a portion of their house into a small eatery where she serves “value meals” which are a hit for drivers and students. She makes a daily sale of P 800. Her kids take turn in assisting her in her business, especially on peak days.

Jennifer got more blessings when she joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006. She used her previous loans from the cooperative to sustain her business. Now on her 8th loan, she needs the amount of P 10,000 to venture into an additional business buying and selling pork.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: Fresh pork for a new business venture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: COMPRA DE EQUIPOS PARA TALLER

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mamadou Samaké est un polygame de 34 ans qui vit avec ses épouses et ses deux enfants  dans une famille traditionnelle à Ouéléssébougou, une des sous- préfecture relevant  de Koulikoro,  deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Suite aux difficultés de la vie, il quitta l’école très tôt pour faire le manœuvre à l’usine d’égrainage coton de la Compagnie Malienne de Développement Textile du Mali (CMDT) durant  trois ans. C’est avec ces épargnes qu’il entama la vente en détail de carburants  jusqu’à ce qu’aujourd’hui il  est parvenu à ouvrir une station service de  vente de carburants et  de lubrifiants. Il est très apprécié et sollicité à Ouéléssébougou pour la qualité de ses produits.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, il fait recours au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier prêt individuel.  
Il compte avoir avec ce prêt  600  litres de lubrifiants et s’approvisionne à Bamako une fois par mois auprès des grossistes. Il effectue sa vente en détail, au comptant et quelques rare fois à crédit, à une clientèle composée généralement de propriétaires de motos  et de véhicules.
Il estime pouvoir réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 65.000 FCFA qui servira à   payer les échéances du prêt et être réinvestir dans son entreprise.

loans.use: Achat de lubrifiants.

loans.name: Magadalena

texts.es:
Magdalena tiene 37 años, es una madre muy admirada por sus vecinos, ya que trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia. Vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Con mucho sacrificio Magdalena pudo instalar una tienda de abarrotes, la cual con el pasar del tiempo ha ido creciendo y haciéndose muy conocida, pues gracias a su carisma y alegría a logrado tener muchos clientes, los cuales prefieren comprarle a ella ya que saben que ahí encontraran todo lo que necesitan.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 3 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su negocio, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que realizarlo. Para el futuro espera que su negocio crezca y le brinde mejores ingresos económicos.
Este es el quinto préstamo de Magdalena con MFP y está muy contenta de la oportunidad de crédito. Sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo para no perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su bodega.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy and her husband have a grocery stall in their community. She is 26 years old and without a child. She is a hardworking woman and hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is determined to lift her business above poverty. She hopes for a loan of 120,000 naira to purchase more grocery items to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Dayra Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Dayra García de 48 años de edad vive en el barrio Memorial Sandino,  procreo dos hijos ya mayores, desde hace ocho años trabaja como cocinera del ejercito de Nicaragua, por su bajos ingresos no ha logrado un crédito mayor a diez mil Córdobas lo que ha logrado ir poco a poco construyendo su vivienda, con el desembolso anterior repello paredes y embaldoso  sala. Con este va a terminar de repellar las paredes de afuera que le falta ya que se gasta mucho cemento y arena y no logro lo esperado en el anterior. Se siente sastifecha ya que podrá ver su casa más bonita y sólida. Todo gracias al financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado, es su noveno ciclo con la institución y se ha beneficiado en las mejoras de su vivienda  así como muchas familias Nicaragüenses logran tener una casa digna para su familia. A pesar de la economía critica del país. Los desempleos es por eso muchas familia emigran a otro país para lograr el bienestar para una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dayra García is 48 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. She has two grown children and has worked as a cook for the Nicaraguan Army since she was 8 years old. Because of her low income she has not been able to receive a loan for more than 10,000 Córdobas. She has used her previous loans to improve her home little by little. With her last loan she plastered her walls and tiled her living room. With this loan she will finish plastering the outdoor walls because it required more cement and sand and she was unable to complete the job with her last loan. She is satisfied because soon her house will be more solid and look better. Many thanks to the loans that Afodenic has provided. This is her ninth loan with the institution, and she was benefitted from the improvements made on her house. Despite the financial difficulties in the country, this has allowed her and many Nicaraguan families to have a worthy house for their families. Unemployment is the major reason why many families emigrate to other countries in order to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to plaster walls

loans.name: Mativa

texts.en:
Mativa F. S. is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Auala 2. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mativa F. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting taro for sale. Mativa F. has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 300 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Mativa F. joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mativa F. is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Mativa F. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina G. is from the village of Ramos East. She is 43 years old and is married. To make a living, Carina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling cosmetics products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling different personal products such as cosmetics. Carina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a week for these activities.

In 2009, Carina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carina is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be the first loan she has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for business improvement

loans.name: Artemia

texts.es:
Artemia es una simpática mujer D. 57 años, ella comparte sus días con el amor D. toda su vida (Lucio), D. 62 años; con él tiene 8 hijos, pero sólo viven con 3 D. ellos: Nilton D. 30, Adrián D. 18 y Ricardo D. 14.

A pesar D. su edad y su delicada apariencia ella es una mujer muy luchadora, y aun se esfuerza por trabajar porque según menciona: “en esta zona del país los ociosos no sobreviven”. DesD. muy joven se dedica a la siembra D. papa y olluco, este oficio lo aprendió D. sus padres y se ha dedicado a la labor agrícola durante toda su vida, así ha ayudado a su esposo, que también se dedica a la siembra, a sacar adelante a sus hijos porque esa es la mayor preocupación que tienen ambos. El día D. Artemia empieza a las 5 D. la mañana cuando se levanta para atender a su familia y una hora mas tarD. se dirige a la chacra donD. no solo vigila sus cultivos al lado D. su esposo, sino también debe cuidar a sus animales, ya que tiene ganado ovino.
A Artemia le gusta realizar ambas actividades porque son tranquilas y rentables, aunque en años anteriores tuvo que experimentar la pérdida D. parte D. su cosecha, los años y la experiencia le han brindado las herramientas necesarias para aprender todas las técnicas para producir en cantidad con calidad.
