Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy satisfecha con lo alcanzado hasta hoy, es por eso que se compromete a ser, una vez más, cumplida en cada uno D. los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará abono, fertilizantes e insecticidas que le ayudarán a mejorar y preparar sus tierras para la próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
Artemia is a likeable 57 year old woman. She shares her days with the love of her life, 62 year old Lucio. They have eight children, but only three of the children live with them. Nilton is 30, Adrián is 18, and Ricardo is 14. In spite of her age and her delicate appearance, this woman is a fighter. She still puts forth a lot of effort working because she says, “This is the part of the country where the idle do not survive”. She has been planting potatoes and “olluco” (Peruvian tuber) since she was very young. She learned from her parents, and she has worked in agriculture her whole life. That is how she has helped her husband, who also farms. They do it to get their children ahead because this is the biggest worry they both have. Artemia’s day starts at five in the morning when she gets up to take care of her family. One hour later she goes to the farm where she not only watches over the crops at her husband’s siD., but she also takes care of their animals. They have sheep. Artemia likes doing both activities because they are peaceful and profitable. Even though she lost part of her harvest in previous years, the years and the experience have given her the necessary tools to learn the techniques to produce quantity and quality. This is the sixth time she has had a loan with MFP. She is very satisfied with what she has achieved so far. That is why she promises, one more time, to make each one of her payments. She will use the money she is asking for to buy compost, fertilizers, and insecticides, which will help her improve and prepare her land for the next harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Roeung's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 13 people, all of whom live in Preaek Khmer village in Kandal province. Roeung T. is a village bank president who has been selected by the other members who will use the loan for varying purposes. 

She and her husband, Mr. Kou Kon, are farmers who own a piece of land on which to grow crops to make a living. With this farm, they face some problems because they do not have enough money to support the green leeks field. Thus, Roeung T. decided to apply for a loan to buy more green leeks to grow, and, with the rest of the loan, she needs to buy fertilizers, and pesticides. 

Roeung T. is the mother of four children, two of whom are farmers, while the other two are studying at the local public school.

loans.use: To buy green leeks, fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Liberathe

texts.en:
Liberathe is 37 years old and married, and he has 8 children, ages 2 to 17. Liberathe and her family live in the Northern Province, approximately two hours from Kigali. This region is touristy, which is appropriate for her business and is the reason why Liberathe has been engaged in business. She has been in business of selling food and a traditional non-alcoholic soft drink that is called "ubushera" in the local language. She has chosen this business because it generates a profit.

Liberathe is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase some additional food to add in her business so she can also start selling it. She will also buy more sorghum to produce the ubushera. If this strategy is successful, she believes she can earn more profits, which will allow her to provide for all of the needs for her children, pay their school fees, and enable her to save money for her future. 

After her business day, Liberathe socializes with her family.

loans.use: To buy food to sell

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha C., 40, has been married to Mr. Chanthorn since 1991, and they live in the Muk Kampoul District of Koh Dach, a famous island located 30 kilometers along the Mekong River roughly 15 kilometers northeast of Phnom Penh. Koh Dach has been nicknamed Silk Island because of the many villagers who weave silk on traditional looms.

Sokha has been a silk weaver for 26 years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a construction worker for one year, working in his village. Sokha is now requesting a loan of 500USD to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Calvin

texts.en:
Calvin V. is from the village of Southwestern, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 75 years old, gets a small pension, is married, and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Calvin owns & operates a business venture, which is providing transportation services in the local community. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from his pension and the other comes from his motorcycle. Calvin has been engaged in his business for 8 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Calvin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Calvin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Calvin is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase motorcycle spare parts. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Calvin from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
Aquilina es socia del Banco Comunal Solución.
Aquilina es soltera y tiene 54 años, Aquilina se dedica a la siembra de verduras en la comunidad de Compañía, sus productos los comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de ayacucho.
Aquilina necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de semilla y abono.
Aquilina sueña con terminar el cuarto piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Aquilina is a member of the Solución community bank. She is single and is 54 years old. She works planting vegetables in the community of Compañia. She sells her produce in the wholesale market in the city of Ayacucho. Aquilina needs a loan of PEN 1050 to invest in the purchase of seed and fertilizer. Aquilina dreams of finishing the fourth floor of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa K. sells plantain, fresh pepper, cassava and other food stuffs at Jukwa. Adwoa has not received any form of education. She is divorced and has three children. She is responsible for feeding and clothing her children, as well as providing good quality education for them. Her loan will be used to buy more plantains and other food stuffs for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save up to build on a piece of land she has already acquired.

loans.use: to buy more plantains and other food stuffs for sale.

loans.name: Rosalynn

texts.es:
Rosalynn es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Luren.
Rosalynn es soltera, tiene 28 años y vive con sus padres, Rosalynn estudia repostería y prepara postres de acuerdo a pedidos de sus clientes, además trabaja en una cebicheria junto a sus hermanos.
Rosalynn necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de batidora.
Rosalynn sueña con implementar un negocio en donde venda sus productos.
texts.en:
Rosalynn is a member of the Communal Bank Señor de Luren. She is single, 28 years old, and lives with her parents. She is studying to be a pastry chef and makes custom desserts for her customers. She also works in a restaurant with her siblings. Rosalynn needs a loan of 750 soles to purchase a mixer. She dreams of setting up her own business where she can sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a mixer

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy P., 39 years old, is a farmer and an accessory vendor in Banga, South Cotabato. She said she sells accessories, necklaces and wristwatches to maximize her time, especially because she has bigger needs in her family. She has two children and her eldest child is 10 years old.

Nancy dreams that all her children will finish their studies. She also dreams of a more stable business so that she will be able to provide whatever her children need. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 4,000 to buy farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and more accessories to sell

loans.name: Elba

texts.es: Elba, de  37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 10 años  trabaja en la venta de licores artesanales, que ella misma elabora para las festividades  que se realizan en diversas zonas aledañas a su comunidad. Antes criaba animales, pero por razones del cambio climático observo que no era adecuado para dedicarse como negocio. Y con las ganancias que obtuvo de  la venta de sus animales, y adicionado a sus propios recursos decidió  adquirir un motocarro, con el que su  esposo brinda actualmente el servicio de transporte. Elba esta planeando ampliar  su negocio y  vender productos de temporada.Es la novena vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete será muy  responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, además  agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo que solicita y que  le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de cantidades de insumos para elaborar sus licores; y también para iniciar el negocio de venta de madera pues necesita un  capital inicial.
texts.en:
Elba, 37 year of age, lives with her husband and 3 children in a house they own. For the past 10 years, she has worked selling liquors that she makes herself for the various festivities that take place in the areas near her community. She previously raised animals, however, for reasons related to climate change, she decided it best not to continue with this activity as a business. With the funds saved from selling her animals, as well as additional other resources, she decided to buy a motorcar that her husband currently uses to provide transportation services. Elba plans to expand her business and sell seasonal products. This is her ninth time obtaining a loan with MFP, and she commits to being responsible with her installment payments. In addition, she thanks everyone who helped make this loan possible and states that it will help her a great deal in growing her enterprise. She plans to invest the requested funds into buying the supplies she needs to make her liquor; also, she would like to start a business selling lumber, and needs start up capital for this endeavor.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for making more liquor.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
El señor Augusto tiene 70 años, es casado, tiene 4 hijos, vive en la ciudad de Anta y pertenece al banco comunal “Manuela Ramos de Iscucha Anta”.  

Al entrevistar al socio de banco comunal él nos manifestó. Soy chofer y cuento con un pequeño negocio el cual consiste en comprar en cantidades zapatos y después los vende para lo cual a un inicio se hacia un poco difícil ya que no contaba con mucho capital, fue entonces que se me presento la oportunidad de pertenecer al banco comunal de la unidad de microfinanzas Asociación Arariwa y mi me prestaron por primera vez 100 dólares. Desde ese momento nuestra vida comenzó a cambiar ya que contábamos con un capital, y en ese sentido nos pusimos a trabajar mi esposa Esperanza y yo así como también mis hijos y desde entonces cambio todo para nosotros tanto en lo económico como en lo familiar, porque desde ese momento empezó a crecer nuestro negocio. 

Ahora que mi negocio va creciendo y así como también cuento con un capital y me va muy bien entonces  quiero aumentar más mercadería por lo cual necesito el crédito para comprar más zapatos.
texts.en:
Augusto is 70, married with four children, lives in the city of Anta and belongs to the community bank "Manuela Ramos de Ischucha Anta". When we interviewed him, he told us: "I am a driver and have a small business which consists of buying large quantities of shoes and selling them. At first it was a bit difficult as I did not have much capital; later I was given the opportunity to belong to the Asociacion Arariwa community bank and they lent me my first 100 dollars. At that moment, our lives began to change since we had capital. I and my wife Esperanza and our children got to work, and since then everything has changed for us, both economically and in our family, because that was when our business started to grow. Now that my business is growing and we have capital, things are going well. Now I want to obtain more merchandise, so I need this loan: to buy more shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Luis Alfonso Díaz, se dedica a reparaciones de electrodomésticos en un taller que tiene en su misma casa de habitación, es casado y ya no tienen hijo a cargo todos son independientes.

El señor lleva ya 16  créditos con  CEPRODEL, los cuales los ha pagado en tiempo y forma, es una persona muy responsable y luchadora para salir adelante por cuenta propia.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis Alfonso Díaz repairs electrical appliances from a workshop located in his house. He is married and does not have any children under his care since all of them are independent.

Luis has already had 16 loans with CEPRODEL, all of which have been repaid on time and according to form. He is a very responsible person who struggles to get ahead through his own efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for making repairs

loans.name: Jovencio

texts.en:
Jovencio C. is from the village of Tolon. He is 46 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jovencio sells steel furniture in the local community. Jovencio has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Jovencio joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Jovencio is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for the business. This will be Jovencio's first loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Odilio

texts.es:
Odilio es socio del Banco Comunal Los Ladrilleros de Compañía, Odilio vive en la comunidad de Compañía es casado y tiene 3 hijos que estudian, Odilio se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales con la ayuda de peones, los ladrillos los vende crudos sin quemarlos a otros productores, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Odilio necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de los peones.
Odilio sueña con tener una empresa de ladrillo y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Odilio is a member of the Community Bank Los Ladrilleros de Compania. Odilio lives in the Compania community, he is married, and he has 3 children who are currently going to school. Odilio makes bricks with the help of his employees. He sells the raw bricks to other producers who fire them. He makes bricks every day. Odilio requires a loan of 1250 soles, funds that will be used to pay his employees. Odilio dreams of having a brick factory and he wishes to expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay wages to employees.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is an 18-year old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his two parents and six siblings. His father is the main income provider but with this big family, the borrower helps his father to pay for the heavy expenses of life. He has four years of experience working as a home painter. He has been running his own business since 2008. He works independently in his business. Today, he is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase needed tools for his painting work. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%. Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers. About Ameen: Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in microfinance. At Ameen s.a.l., we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: Purchase needed tools for his painting work

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es: Lupe tiene 31 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada. Hace más de 4 años vende ropa, y lo realiza de manera ambulante u ofreciéndolo de casa en casa. Desde entonces sale a vender sus productos, dejando a crédito la mercadería que es vendida, por ello cuenta con clientes fijos. Además cada cierto tiempo viaja a la capital para abastecerse de mercadería, ya que lo consigue a un precio muy cómodo. Afirma que le agrada su trabajo, es por ello que desea tener exclusividades de modelos y diseños en prendas de vestir. Es su sexto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  además aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en al compra de prendas de vestir en cuero y otros materiales.
texts.en:
Lupe, age 31, lives with her two children in a rented house. For over four years she has been selling clothes in an itinerant manner or by going door to door. She leaves to sell her products, and she sells her merchandise on credit. Therefore, she has fixed customers. After a certain amount of time she travels to the capital to stock her merchandise because she gets it for a very comfortable price. She says that she likes her work, and she wants her garments to be exclusive models and designs. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support. She has always demonstrated that she is responsible with her payments. Also, it pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people. She is grateful to the people who will fund the loan she is requesting. It will be very useful to the progress of her business. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy clothing that is made of leather and other materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy garments made from leather and other materials and designs

loans.name: Ty

texts.en:
Mr. Ty E. (pictured), 27, is a soldier. His wife, Mrs. Chanthean Keo, 36, runs grocery store at home. They have been married since 2003 and have three children-one son and two daughters. The family lives in a village along national road number four about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 


Ty is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase more grocery items for his wife’s store.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for his wife’s store.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Banco del Desarrollo”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. José Luis; el tiene 26 años de edad y es soltero; el socio estudia la carrera profesional de derecho, el quiere terminar de estudiar y así poder empezar a trabajar, el socio quiere tener su estudio jurídico. El socio solicita el préstamo para pagar las mensualidades de sus  estudios de la carrera profesional de derecho. 

	
El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “Banco del Desarrollo” ["Development Bank"] communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Wanchaq, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

His name is José Luis; he is 26 years old and single. He is studying for a professional career in law. He would like to finish his studies and earn a law degree so he can start working. He is requesting the loan to pay the monthly fees for his studies toward his professional law degree. 
	
The borrower is grateful to all of those who are participating in his dream in this way, and he is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: Making his monthly payments for his studies toward a professional law degree

loans.name: Asucina

texts.en:
Asucina B. is 45 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. She is from the town of Plaridel within the province of Misamis Occidental on the Mindanao islands. Asucina operates a fishing concern in which she harvests and sells ocean-caught fish to the local community. Asucina has been in business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2004 Asucina joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. Asucina successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Asucina is requesting a new loan, her fourteenth from PMPC, of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Soun P., 26 years old, lives with her husband and one young child in the Takeo province. She works in a garment factory, making 2.50 USD of profit a day, while her husband operates a moto-taxi. On average, he is able to make about 5 USD a day. This family spends about 20 USD on food monthly, 6 USD on utility and 20 USD on other expenses.

Soun P. is asking for a loan of 700 USD to purchase a trailer to attach to her husband’s motorbike. A motorbike attached to a trailer can make the driver more money than a motorbike alone.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer

loans.name: Condori Villena

texts.es:
M. es socia del Banco Comunal “Sol de Oro”  ubicado en el distrito de Juliaca,  provincia de San Román, departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente y tiene 02  hijos,  la señora tiene estudios hasta 2do de educación secundaria.

M. viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 05 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que incrementó en el capital de  su negocio de venta de abarrotes así como también pollos y frutas.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio.

Su sueño es tener más capital y que sus hijos sean profesionales..

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es lo que gana en el ahorro.
texts.en:
M. is a member of the communal bank “Sol de Oro” (Golden Sun), located in the district of Juliaca, San Román province, in the Puno region. She is 42 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 2 children. She is schooled through the 2nd grade of secondary school. 

M. has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 5 years. She started with an initial loan of 300.00 soles, money that increased the capital of her grocery, chicken and fruit sales business. She will ask for a new loan of 1000.00 soles, money that she will invest in the purchase of grocery goods for her business. 

Her dream is to have more capital and for her children to be professionals. The thing she likes most about the communal bank is what she gains in savings.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her business selling grocery staples, fruit and chicken.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Fredy vive en casa propia cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad Chahuira pampa. El es productor lechero y su esposa le colabora en todas las actividades agrícolas. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El tiene Dos hijos. 
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera. Esto le permitirá aumentar su producción de leche.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Fredy lives in his own house, located in the community of Chahuira Pampa. He is a dairy farmer and his wife helps him with the farming work. This is their main source of income to support themselves. He has two children.
 
He will use the loan to buy a dairy cow, which will allow him to increase his milk production.

This is his first loan wiht Impro.

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: RAMIRO C.   es casado,  tiene 55 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos  todos mayores de edad los cuales trabajan por su cuenta. Ramiro inicio su negocio hace 22 años cuando el y su esposa  iniciaron su negocio   con un pequeño ahorro lo invirtió  en la  compra cortinas colchas vajilla y, el agradece primeramente a Dios y Fape que le puedan brindar la oportunidad en darle un crédito  e invertirlo en mas mercadería de usos domesticos   y   poder trabajar  con su familia y tener un mejor futuro. El sueño que él  tiene es poder comprarle  a cada uno de sus hijos un terreno.
texts.en:
Ramiro C., age 55, is married and has three grown children who work for a living. Ramiro began his business 22 years ago when he and his wife started with a little savings and invested it in the purchase of curtains, bedspreads, and tableware.

It is thanks primarily to God and FAPE that they were able to be offered the opportunity it to obtain a loan, invest it in more merchandise for domestic uses, and be able to work with their family for a better future. His dream is to be able to buy land for each if his children.

loans.use: Purchase of products for domestic uses.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana forma parte del banco comunal “Banco de la Fe” perteneciente a la ciudad de Linares. Ella  vende ropa de adultos y niños, y accesorios como por ejemplo cosmetiqueros y billeteras, por encargos y a domicilio. También hace y vende empanadas en una cancha cerca de su casa, solo los días domingos. Además trabaja de forma dependiente durante la semana como maestra de cocina en un restaurante. Para aumentar la venta de sus productos, vendiendo en la semana mientras trabaja, le ayuda su hija, a quien le paga una comisión por venta y, además,  a una señora para que le ayude a cocinar las empanadas.
Con este préstamo comprará ropa e ingredientes para las empanadas, es decir harina huevos, aceitunas, carne, cebolla y pasas. 
Ana tiene 5 hijos, pero solo viven con ella 3, de los cuales dos estudian, el menor de 11 años y su hijo de 22 que está en su último año de universidad estudiando construcción civil.
El sueño de Ana es tener un carrito para la venta de comida rápida. 
Está muy agradecida de la oportunidad de crecer económicamente que le ha dado Fondo Esperanza, por medio de los préstamos. También se siente muy acogida por la unidad de sus compañeros de grupo.
Linares es un importante centro urbano de la región del Maule, ubicado en la zona centro del país. En esta zona se desarrolla de manera importante la producción agrícola y también vitivinícola sobresaliendo en el ámbito de las exportaciones. Destacan los cultivos de cereales (arroz, trigo, maíz y avena), hortalizas (remolacha, repollo, lechuga y acelga y legumbres) y frutas. Linares es la principal provincia productora de arroz, en Chile; de hecho, el 78% de la producción nacional de este cereal se da en esta provincia, especialmente en la comuna de Parral.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the community bank named « Banco de la Fe » and it is located in the city of Linares. She sells kids’ and adults’ clothing and accessories, such as make-up bags and wallets. She sells from her home and she also takes orders. She also sells prepared foods in a park nearby, but only on Sundays. She also works during the week as a cooking instructor in a restaurant. In order to increase the sale of her products her daughter helps her during the week while she is at work.  She pays her commission for the sales she makes and she also hires someone to help her make the foods to sell. 

She will purchase items of clothing and ingredients with this loan, such as: cooking flour, eggs, olives, meats, onions, and potatoes. 

She has 5 children, but only 3 of them live with her, and only two of them are in school. The youngest is 11 years old. Her son who is 22 years old is in his last year in university, where he is studying civil engineering. 

Ana’s dream is to have a car to be able to sell prepared foods quickly. She is very grateful to Fondo Esperanza (Kiva Field Partner) for the opportunity to grow financially through these loans. She feels very close to the members of the group for the strong sense of community. 

Linares is an large urban centre in the region of Maule. It is located in the central part of the country. This is region is an important producer, strong in agriculture and vineyards, and an exporter of their goods. The primary products are cereal grains (rice, wheat, corn, and oats), and produce (beets, cabbage, lettuce, spinach and legumes) and fruits. Linares is the primary producer of rice in Chile. In fact, 78% of cereals consumed in the country are produced in this province, especially in the community of Parral.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials for making her handicrafts

loans.name: Bugongi United Savings And Credit Group B-Kihihi

texts.en:
30 year old T. Peter has been selling crude liquor for the last 5 years as a means of earning his livelihood.  It goes without saying that this beverage is in high favour with many rank and file folks around his neighborhood.  For this reason, Peter has been able to make ends meet though not as effectively as he would want.  The reason for this he says is because unlike other beverages like beers which are taken by middle and high income earners, crude alcohol is mostly consumed by low income earners with paltry cash. 

This business, Peter reveals, was begun with savings from his produce sales business, which is still a business for him, though he has less time for it at the present time.  When he is not there to see the day to day running of business, his wife with whom he has 5 kids is always there to run it.  Monthly, this business generates him 200,000 shillings.  With this loan, Peter says he is going to buy more jerrycans of crude alcohol to resell.  Peter belongs to Bugongi United Savings and Credit group-Kihihi.

loans.use: The purchase of more jerrycans of crude alcohol to resell.

loans.name: Kantuta Group

texts.es:
El banco de Emprendimiento "KANTUTA" es un Banco que se encuentra en su primer ciclo  pero esta formado por cuatro socias antiguas que pertenecían al Banco de Emprendimiento "BELEN" y han demostrado ser  puntuales y responsables en el pago de sus cuotas, ella lograron conformar esté banco que esta representado por las siguientes personas: la Sra. Rita quien es la presidenta del banco es una de las socias antiguas, es casada tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya son independientes, ella tiene el negocio de venta de ropa en las ferias zonales (Punata, Cliza, Arani) viajando cada fin de semana a estas localidades, su crédito es para compra de ropa por cantidad y así  incrementar su capital de trabajo. Como Tesorera se encuentra la Sra. Roxana quien es soltera y tiene un gabinete Fisioterapéutico, las socias del grupo la conocen como una persona responsable y puntual. El crédito saco para compra de equipo de fisioterapia y la Sra. Roxana quien ocupa el cargo de Secretaria, ella tiene el negocio de venta de medicina natural en una de las calles céntricas de la ciudad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos que 2 que se encuentran en edad escolar, el destino de su crédito es para incrementar su capital de trabajo.
Todas las socias que conforman el banco de emprendimiento KANTUTAS son personas responsables y trabajadoras que luchan para sacar a su familia adelantes y se encuentran agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The communal bank "Kantuta" is a new bank, in its first period, comprised of four members who used to be with the communal bank "Belen."  They have all proven to be punctual and responsible with their payments.  They were able to form this bank that is represented by the following people: Mrs. Rita who is the president of the bank and one of the old members.  She is married and has four children who are all adults.  She has a business selling clothing at the markets (Punata, Cliza, Arani) and travels to these places every weekend.  Her loan is to purchase clothing, in bulk, and in this way grow her working capital.  The treasurer is Mrs. Roxana who is single and has a physical therapy practice.  The bank's members know her to be a punctual and responsible person.  Her loan is to buy physical therapy equipment.  Mrs. Roxana is the secretary.  She sells natural medicine on one of the cities streets.  She is married and has four children who are all school-age.  Her loan is to increase her working capital.  All of the members who make up the communal bank "Kantutas" are responsible, hard-working women who fight to get their familiar ahead and who are grateful for this institution and the support it provides.

loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Remberto

texts.es: El señor Remberto es soltero vive en casa de su mama que es una persona de edad avanzada su padre ya falleció y el se dedica a la elaboración de artículos en cuero de manera artesanal, con el dinero del  crédito comprara materia prima para la fabricación de sus productos,   el señor se responsabiliza de su madre y se hace cargo de su manutención con los ingresos que percibe el tiene que solventar los gastos de su madre y los gastos de él, es una persona responsable que cuida de su mama ya que están solos los dos, el sr. Remberto esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Remberto is single and lives at the home of his mother since she is an elderly person and his father is already deceased. He produces handmade items out of leather.

Remberto will use the money from this loan to buy materials for making his products. He is responsible for his mother and takes charge of supporting her with the earnings he generates. Remberto covers his mother’s expenses as well as his own. He is a responsible person who takes care of his mother since it is just the two of them.

Sr. Remberto is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: Purchase leather

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara Isabel Z. Gonzales es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 54 años quien tiene un negocio de venta de materiales de construcción, arreó de materiales y servicio de cisterna desde hace 10 años. El negocio se ubica en San Judas, Managua.
Ella con el crédito lo ocupara para legalizar una camioneta que acaba de adquirir.
texts.en:
Sara Isabel Z. Gonzales is a hard working 54 year old entrepreneur.  She owns a business which sells construction materials, transports materials, and offers a cistern service.  The business is about ten years old and is located in San Judas, Managua.

She will use the loan to register a recently purchased truck.

loans.use: To register a truck.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en: Haydar H. lives in Bilasuvar. He is 32-years-old married man and the father of two  children who are currently in school. They all live together in their own house, located in the settlement built for refugee families in Bilasuvar. Haydar got his start as a farmer in his parents' fields when he was very young. After marriage he decided to start his own sheep-breeding business. The income from this business is the only source of profit for the family. Haydar would like to expand his business, buying more sheep and balanced feed so that he can increase his sales. For this reason, he requested a loan for 1000 AZN from AqroInvest and Kiva to purchase 10 more sheep. His goal for the future is to breed 100 and more sheep.

loans.use: to buy ten sheep

loans.name: Yamileth Del Carmen

texts.es: Yamileth Del Carmen de 51años, es una mujer sincera. Por más de 7 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa. Ella  vende ropa usada casual, vestidos, trajes, pantalones de vestir. El negocio que realiza le gusta mucho, solo que en esta temporada sus ventas han sido pocas. Por ello, no se provee de muchas mercaderías solo compra de acuerdo al pedido que le hacen sus clientes y, de ese modo no se acumula mercaderías mucho tiempo, sin rotarlas. Está convencida que a trabajando arduamente, en adelante desea proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios. Con el dinero del crédito que solicita, comprará algunos pedidos de pantalones, faldas, vestidos, trajes, camisas, entre otros.
texts.en: 51-year-old Yamileth Del Carmen is a sincere woman. For over 7 years, she has sold clothing. She sells casual used clothing, dresses, suits and dress pants. She likes her business a lot - the only problem is that this season her sales have been few. Because of this, she does not supply much merchandise, just according to what her cutomers order and, in this way, she does not accumulate much merchandise for a long time without rotating it. She is convinced that by working ardently, in the future she wants to provide her family with the necessary income. With the credit that she is seeking, she will purchase some orders of pants, skirts, dresses, suits and shirts, among others.

loans.use: to purchase some orders of pants, skirts, dresses, suits and shirts, among others

loans.name: Serapio

texts.es:
El señor Serapio es un hombre muy trabajador que cuenta con su negocio de polarizado de autos desde hace 12 años ubicándose en el estacionamiento de una tienda departamental muy conocida en la ciudad.
En este momento se ve en la necedad de pedir un préstamo para pagar las escrituras de su casa, y a que el papeleo que tienen que realizar le sale a un bajo precio por lo que no quiere desaprovechar la oportunidad ya que hace tiempo por motivos ajenos a el, no pudo escriturarlo. Serapio necesita capital para poder arreglar este problema y así tener todo en regla.
texts.en:
Serapio is a very hardworking man who has had a polarized auto glass business for 12 years located in the parking lot of a department store that is very well known in the city.  

At this time, he needs to ask for a loan to pay for the deeds to his house. The paperwork that needs to be done is available at a low price and he wants to take advantage of the opportunity since some time ago, for reasons beyond his control, he couldn't get the deed. Serapio needs the money to be able to fix this problem and have everything in order.

loans.use: to pay for the deeds on his land.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana: se dedica a la venta y crianza D. animales ella nos cuenta que esta muy contenta porque es una actividad que le a gustado mucho porque le gustan mucho los animales sobre todo los pallos ella ella compra los pollos pequeños y cuando ya estan buenos para destazar venD. la carne y lo venD. a buen precio, ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. animales y alimentos para pollos su sueño es agrandar mas su negocio y tener mas animales para la venta.
texts.en: Juana raises and sells animals.  She tells us that she is very happy because it is a business that she really enjoys.  She really likes animals, especially chickens.  She buys them when they are small and, when they are ready to be slaughtered, she sells the meat at a good price.  She is requesting this loan to buy animals and chicken feed.  Her dream is to further expand her business and have more animals to sell.

loans.use: to buy animals and chicken feed.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is married and has two daughters and a son. He lives in the small town of Maliye Kopani.  Ivan is a farmer. He grows early spring vegetables and has 5,000 tomato, 40,000 pepper, and 50,000 strawberry plants in addition to 3 tons of radish. Ivan has been working in agriculture for 20 years. He has invested about 200,000 Grivnyas in this business. 

Ivan is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to repair his greenhouses and to install a drip irrigation system.  The irrigation system will cost him 2,000 Grivnyas.  He also needs to purchase seeds for 2,000 Grivnyas, farming fiber for 6,000 Grivnyas, fertilizers for 4,000 Grivnyas, as well as gasoline and oil for 1,000 Grivnyas. Ivan is hoping to meet customer demand this season and increase his income as a result.

loans.use: to buy seeds, protective plastic film, fertilizers and install a drip irrigation unit

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en:
Hadijah is 20 years old and lives in Uganda. She is married and has no children. Hadijah has a small retail shop, which she has run for three years.
To help expand her business, Hadijah has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Hadijah hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own a wholesale shop.
Hadijah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by encouraging her to be hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina tiene 52 años D. edad, esta casada y vive en casa propia, que afortunadamente cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, en una comunidad urbana en vías D. desarrollo llamada  Picsi perteneciente a la provincia D. Chiclayo.

Cristina cuenta con un kiosco, ubicado en un colegio D. su comunidad, en el cual venD. toda clase D. golosinas y pequeños platos D. comida como papitas rellenas y tortillas D. choclo, además D. desayunos y almuerzos. Esta actividad la viene ejerciendo desD. hace más D. 5 años y sus clientes, escolares, están más que satisfechos con su servicio.

Cristina solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 1000 nuevos soles para comprar ingredientes y mercadería para su puesto, pues se acercan las actividades D. aniversario del colegio, del día del padre y fiestas patrias, eso implica una gran demanda en los productos D. Cristina. Así que ella quiere aprovechar estos eventos para incrementar sus ganancias. Además Cristina tiene pensado acondicionar su local para brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.

Ella estaría muy agradecida D. concedérsele el crédito pues le sería D. gran utilidad.
texts.en:
Cristina, age 52, is married and lives in her own house.  Fortunately, it has all of the basic services.  She lives in a developing urban community call Picsi in the Chiclayo province.

Cristina has a kiosk at a community school.  She sells all types of sweets and small dishes like stuffed potatoes and corn tortillas.  She also sells breakfast and lunch.  She has been doing this for over five years.  Her customers, who are students, are more than satisfied with her service.

Cristina is requesting a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will use the loan to buy ingredients and merchandise for her food stand.  The activities for the school’s anniversary, father’s day, and national holidays are approaching.  This involves a great demand for Cristina’s products.  She wants to take advantage of these events in order to increase her earnings.  Cristina also is planning to fix up her stand in order to proviD. her customers with better attention.

She would be very grateful to be granted the loan because it would be very useful.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and merchandise and to fix up her kiosk.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul  is 38 years old.  He is married to Grace and they are blessed with two children. He has been operating his spare parts business for the past year. 

He has been loaned KES 80,000 by KADET Ltd. This is his second loan from KADET. He intends to use his loan to repair his vehicle and purchase spare parts for his motorbike.

He plans to use the profit from his business to add more stock.  In the future, he hopes to open another spare parts shop.

loans.use: purchase car and motorbike spareparts

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 40-year-old single mother of four children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Mary has been selling clothes for 20 years. She started her business with 500,000 Shillings and now has 1,500,000 Shillings as her working capital. Her main challenge is bad debtors. Mary's vision is for a bigger shop and to educate her children. She intends to use this loan facility to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Paso Real Group

texts.es: Maritza Esperanza, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Paso Real, tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, y reside en la Aldea Pálala. Maritza es una persona de muy escasos recursos económicos pero también es muy luchadora y desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar para ayudar a sus padres y ahora que es madre soltera lo hace para sus hijos. Desde hace unos años atrás se dedica a la venta de ropa americana usada de forma ambulante, sus pequeños hijos la ayudan a cargar la ropa y junto con ella recorren las calles de la comunidad donde residen y también las comunidades aledañas para realizar las ventas de casa en casa. Con el préstamo solicitado Maritza comprará un fardo de ropa usada de la temporada (suéteres, chamarras, gorros, sombrillas, etc.) y así podrá ofrecer a sus clientes variedad en estilos. Ella está segura que con el apoyo de este préstamo sus ventas aumentaran y por tanto sus ingresos también.  Su sueño es ampliar su casa para instalar un pequeño local y ya no salir junto con sus hijos a la calle para realizar sus ventas. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera cancelar las cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Maritza Esperanza is a member of the Solidarity Group “Paso Real”. She is 41 years old and a single mother with three children. They reside in La Aldea Pálala. Maritza is a determined individual even though she has very limited financial resources. At a very young age, she learned how to work in order to help her parents. Now she is a single mother who does what she can for her children. A few years ago, Maritza began selling used American clothing as a street vendor. Her children help her with carrying the clothes and together they walk through the streets of their community. They also travel to the neighboring communities and generate sales by going house to house.

With the loan she requested, Maritza will buy a bundle of used seasonal clothing (sweaters, jackets, caps, umbrellas, and other items) so that she can offer her customers a variety of styles. She is confident that the assistance from this loan will increase her sales and her income. Her dream is to expand her house so that she can open a small store and not have to travel through the streets with her children in order to make sales. This is her first loan with FAMA and she hopes to submit her payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of used clothing.

loans.name: Tiessiri I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes qui composent le groupe TIESSIRI I sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Banco ville, chef lieu de commune rurale, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, OUMOU, la deuxième personne debout à gauche , compte acheter les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare de riz.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten women who make up the Tiessiri I group are all married and average 39 years of age with an average of four children each. They live in polygamous families in Banco town, the administrative centre of the rural community in the prefecture of Dioïla, which lies in Koulikoro, which is the second administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the aim of organising their activities more effectively at the beginning of the rainy season. They grow, among other things, rice and groundnut. They are on their first loan from the institution.

With this loan, Oumou, who is standing second from the left, is planning to buy agricultural inputs and small farming equipment, as well to pay for labor costs to maintain around 0.25 hectars of rice.

Once harvested, the produce is sold at the markets in Baou, Koula, Banco and N'Golobougou, to a customer base made up of men and women.

The women are expecting to make an average profit of 25,000FCFA per season.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seeds, fertilizer, weedkiller and small farming equipment

loans.name: Khanh

texts.en:
Khanh was born in 1974. She lives in Nghia Lai village. She is married with two children who are going to school. Her husband is a driver. He has a monthly income of about 7,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). Her family has a store. Mrs Khanh has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. 

Since 2004 she has participated in SEDA. This is the eighth time she is borrowing money in SEDA. This time, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy goods to resell. She wants to earn more money to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy goods to resell.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel,  vive con su familia, dos hijos y su esposa, desde pequeño Manuel se dedica a la siembra de maíz, el cual cultiva año a año para sostener a su familia con la ayuda de su padre.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y tratamiento para las plagas, con esta compra fortalecerá el  cultivo y espera que un buen cuido obtenga al final una buena cosecha.
Su aspiración es que a través de su trabajo pueda apoyar a sus hijos y velando por todas sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his family: his wife and two children.  He has been growing corn since he was a young boy.  He grows his corn year after year to support his family and has the help of his father.

Manuel is currently requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pest treatments.  This purchase will strengthen his crops and he hopes that good care of his crops will result in a good harvest.  

Manuel's goal is to be able to support his children through his work and look out for all their needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pest treatments

loans.name: Sarren

texts.en:
Sarren (in the photo) is 59 years old. She lives with her husband and daughter, who is a tailor, in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sarren is asking for a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase fabric and a sewing machine for her daughter’s tailoring business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and a sewing machine for her daughter’s tailoring business.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
This is Girlie, 21, resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Renante, her business partner, and is a mother to three children. The eldest child is already in college while the youngest is still in elementary school. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Girlie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also retails rice & electronic cell phone loading. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 550 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 19,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Girlie hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and other products for sale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Evelyn works hard to support her family. She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from copra. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca weaving business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Jeffriy

texts.en:
Jeffriy is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Jeffriy is providing motorcycle or "habal-habal" services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

Jeffriy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jeffriy hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en: Damaris is a single, 32-year-old lady with two children, who are four and ten years old. She runs a small shop that specializes in selling ladies handbags. The business is located at Rongai and her primary customers are women. She has been doing this business for two years now, and she says that the business is profitable. The major challenges she faces are those of weather changes. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to add to her stock of handbags. She hopes to own a well stocked boutique in Rongai in the future. Damaris describes herself as honest.

loans.use: To add to her stock of handbags

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 47-years-old. She is widowed. 

Rosalina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Rosalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosalina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Ricardo Moises

texts.es: Ricardo de 24 años de edad tiene su negocio en pleno centro de la ciudad, en un centro comercial muy reconocido, donde ofrece servicios de reparación y mantenimiento electrónico, en este oficio tiene  4 años de experiencia. En su condición de padre separado con una hija de 5 años, su meta es fortalecerlo y aumentar sus ingresos, para lograr ofrecerle bienestar para que en el futuro, ella sea una profesional exitosa.  Cuando Ricardo finalizó su bachillerato, inició sus estudios de electrónica, los cuales debió abandonar en la época de práctica,  pues  la llegada de su hija lo impulsó en la búsqueda de ingresos para su manutención. Inicialmente trabajó con su tío, pero con el paso del tiempo y con sus propios ahorros se independizó y el resultado ha sido muy bueno y como tiene aspiraciones de crecimiento personal y empresarial  está en esta búsqueda y por eso necesita comprar repuestos al por mayor, que le reporten mayores ganancias. Este es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará repuestos al por mayor para ganar descuentos.
texts.en: Ricardo is 24 years old and has his own business in the center of the city in a well known mall where he repairs and maintains electronic devices; he has worked in this field for 4 years. Being separated and having a 5 year old daughter, Ricardo’s goal is to strengthen and increase his income to give his daughter a good future and that she be a successful professional. When Ricardo finished high school he began studying electronics and had to abandon his studies for some time since the arrival of his daughter prompted him to seek an income to support her. At first Ricardo worked with his uncle but as time passed and as he saved he started his own business and the results have been very good. He has hopes of growing personally and in business which is why he needs to buy spare parts wholesale which will help him have greater earnings. This is the reason why Ricardo went to credikiva, this is his first loan made through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and he will buy spare parts wholesale to get a discount.

loans.use: buy spare parts wholesale to get a discount.

loans.name: C5684 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 22 years old and is single. He has a business selling Irish potatoes, beans and bananas etc, which is open from 9am until 5pm every day. 
He currently employs two people to help him and he is the leader of the group, which is called "C5684 Tuzamurane" in the local language. Jean Baptiste is the first person on the right hand side and has one year's experience in this business. 
He has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more Irish potatoes, beans and bananas etc to sell. With this profit, he expects to save money for his future and to pay for medical insurance for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more Irish potatoes, beans, bananas and so on.

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi, 27, is a single woman who stays at a family house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her young siblings.

For the past two years, she has operated a boutique business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer needs 

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Osmar

texts.es:
El Sr. Osmar es de ciudad del este, está casado, tiene dos hijos, quienes están todavía en edad escolar.
Él se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, a la vez también se dedica a la venta de joyas de forma ambulante por las colonias, la misma cada vez más está en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso. Con la ayuda de su esposa  están saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo.
El nos cuenta que todo el trabajo que el y su esposa hacen es por darle a sus todo lo mejor, pues desean darle un futuro mejor, sin privaciones como las que ellos tuvieron que pasar.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de joyas, como ser anillos, cadenas, pulseras y demás tipos, con los cuales podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Osmar is from Ciudad del Este.  He’s married and has two children who are still school age.  He sells basic staple items but also sometimes sells jewelry in an itinerant manner throughout the neighborhoods, a business that’s currently growing and generating good income.  With help from his wife they are getting ahead with much sacrifice and effort.

He tells us that all the work he and his wife do is to provide the best because they want to give them a better future without the privations they had to undergo.

He is asking for the loan to buy jewelry like rings, chains, bracelets and other types to stock up and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy assorted jewelry.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 32-year-old, secondhand clothes seller in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. He is single. He has been successfully running this business for the past 6 months.

 Ali was recently introduced to KADET and this marks his first loan. He plans to use the loan to purchase more bales of secondhand shirts, trousers, blouses and skirts. He will use the proceeds to repay his loan and buy more stock of clothes for his business.

He hopes to expand his business and and open a clothes boutique.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of secondhand shirts, trousers, blouses and skirts

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
Don Virgilio continua laborando en el area de conductor, como objetivo estos años, ha sido la construccion de su vivienda, lo que junto a su esposa se esfuerzan para lograr las mejora, ella trabaja cuidando niños, lo que equilibra los gastos de alimentacion  y poder cubrir los pagos.
Sus hijos solo dos estan con ellos, los cuales estudian, hoy con este nuevo prestamo cambiara techo de los cuartos, y si ajusta comprara puerta y ventana, lo que lograra mejor seguridad y estabilidad familiar.
texts.en:
Mr. Virgilio continues to work as a bus driver, but his goal these last few years has been to build his house. He and his wife work hard in order to be able to make home improvements. She works in childcare, which helps with the cost of food and helps pay the bills.

Their children, who live with them, are currently in school. With this new loan, he will change the roof of the rooms, and if he has enough money left over, he will buy a door and window to increase safety and family stability.

loans.use: to change the roof of the rooms in his house and purchase a door and window, thus making his home safer.

loans.name: Ivan Dario

texts.es:
Ivan siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador, y esto le ha permitido superar grandes adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida. Ivan se encuentra casado y tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad, a quien siempre busca brindarle una buena calidad de vida y buenas oportunidades de estudio. Desde muy temprana edad aprendió las actividades de la agricultura, gracias a que sus padres se dedicaban a esta actividad y desde muy joven se la enseñaron para que trabajara junto a ellos; y es con la experiencia que ha adquirido que ahora tiene un cultivo de verduras el cual es reconocido por la buena calidad de los productos que allí se cosechan. Con su negocio, Ivan genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, y es por esto que siempre trabaja fuertemente en este con el ánimo de hacerlo crecer y cada vez aumentar sus ventas. Actualmente presenta una gran dificultad que es la temporada invernal que le ha venido deteriorando el crecimiento de sus cosechas, y es por esto que ahora busca que un préstamo le permita comprar impermeabilizantes, abonos, riegos e insecticidas para poder sacar su cosecha adelante a pesar del fuerte invierno.
De esta manera podrá seguir ofreciendo productos de buena calidad a sus clientes y así podrá seguir generando los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Además, Ivan espera que su familia siga progresando económicamente y en un futuro puedan tener una mejor estabilidad económica que les permita progresar.
texts.en:
Ivan has always been known as a hard worker. This has enabled him to overcome great adversities in his life. Ivan is married and has a four-year-old son, so he is always looking to provide them a good quality of life and good opportunities for study. His parents taught him farming activities at a very early age. As a young man, he utilized what he learned and began working with his parents. With the experience he gained, he now has a crop of vegetables and is known for harvesting good quality products. This business enables Ivan to generate the income he needs to maintain the household expenses, which explains why he works hard and is eager to grow and increase his sales.

His greatest difficulty at the moment is the winter season, which has diminished the growth of his crops. Now he is seeking a loan so that he can buy waterproofing material, compost, insecticides, as well as pay for irrigation so that his crops can thrive during the strong winter. This will help him continue offering good-quality products to his customers and generating the income he needs to maintain the household expenses. In addition, Ivan hopes that his family will continue progressing financially and have better economic stability so that they can move forward.

loans.use: to buy waterproofing material, compost, insecticides, as well as pay for irrigation.

loans.name: Canan Thuwathikanaye Group

texts.en: Meresi is 40 years old married with 4 children. She deals in produce business for now five years. She has a responsibility of paying her children's school fees and general family maintenance. She has a challenge of inadequate capital to buy enough stock and the ever changing prices of produce. Now that its peak season, Meresi needs to stock enough maize and keep it for sell when prices are high the purpose for this loan. She is a member of Canan Thuwathikanaye group where members guarantee one another to access a loan facility.

loans.use: to stock enough maize and keep it for sell

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine F. got married to a teacher with whom she had three children. She also looks after a little brother and three sisters, who are in apprenticeships. Her husband’s salary cannot cover the bills, so she is compelled to help him with income from selling ice water and fruit juice. She has had this business, which she names «Espérance» (Hope), for five years and has been doing well in it. She is a very disciplined woman with regards to management and has proven to be honest and trustworthy by successfully repaying an initial loan of $250 without a problem.

She is requesting another loan, in the amount of $550, which will allow her to acquire sugar, fruit, and other ingredients for making juice and ice water. The success of her plans will augment her production and therefore increase her income for the welfare of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame F. Justine s’est mariée à un enseignant avec qui elle a trois (03) enfants et a à sa charge 1 petit frère et 3 sœurs en apprentissage. Le salaire de son mari ne pouvant pas couvrir les charges, elle est dans l’obligation de contribuer en aidant son mari avec les revenus de vente d’eau glacée et du jus de fruit. Cela fait 5 ans qu’elle exerce ce commerce qu’elle maîtrise assez bien. Elle est femme très rigoureuse en matière de gestion et a fait preuve de femme d’honnêteté et de confiance à travers son premier crédit de $250 obtenu et régulièrement remboursé sans incident.

Elle sollicite un second crédit de $550 qui va lui permettre de s’acheter du sucre, fruits, et autres matières qui entrent dans la fabrication du jus et de l’eau glacée. La réalisation de projet augmentera sa production et de facto accroîtra ses revenus pour le mieux-être de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy sugar and fruit to make fruit juice and to sell ice water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary W. Mbuchu intends to construct two new permanent rental rooms.

loans.name: Fagan

texts.en:
Fagan  is 30 years old and single. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the  occupied territory of  Azerbaijan, Lachin region. He is settled in Absheron region, Masazir village.
He has 3 years of experience in running a butcher shop.  
He is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to buy 20 sheep to expand his business and attract more clients.

loans.use: Purchase of 20 sheep

loans.name: Ibadet

texts.en:
Ibadet M. is 43-year-old married man who is the owner of a flock of sheep. He is from Mazrali village near IMishli town, situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan.

Ibadet has a big family, a wife and three children. He started his business in 1999. With money he had saved up, he purchased 10 sheep to raise for resale. Mutton is in high demand in Azerbaijan, and his business brought him income. He enlarged his flock from ten to twenty, and now he wants to purchase some goats and additional sheep.

Since the autumn and winter is high season for purchasing mutton, Yadigar decided to borrow US$ 1200 to buy fifteen additional sheep (at about US$ 70 each), and six goats (at about US$ 30 each).

loans.use: purchase 15 sheep and 6 goats

loans.name: Walter Luis

texts.es:
Walter is a 38 year old man, hard worker and dedicated who loves his family and does numerous activities in order to provide for them. Because he bears a great responsibility he will spare no effort, working at night in a gas station close to his home. As we know, night jobs require a lot of effort, but he has many needs that he has to take care of and therefore he has to sacrifice some of his sleep for the well being of his family. He has some plans in mind, and he would like to open a small store to sell shoes in an area of the house of his mother-in-law, but in order to do that he requires a $350 loan with which he will be able to achieve his objective in a short period of time. Your contribution is important so that he can achieve his dream.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer

Walter es un hombre de 38 años de edad, trabajador y empeñoso en lo que realiza, ama mucho a su familia y para procurarles bienestar realiza innumerables actividades.Frente a la gran responsabilidad que tiene no escatima esfuerzos y también se dedica por las noches a prestar sus servicios en un grifo de combustible próximo a su hogar. Como sabemos los trabajos de noche requieren de mucho esfuerzo, pero para él con tantas necesidades que cubrir a cuestas no le queda mas que sacrificar sus horas de sueño por el bien de su familia Hoy tiene planes en mente, aperturar una pequeña tienda para ofertar zapatos y zapatillas en un ambiente de la casa de su suegra; sin embargo para llevar a cabo este próximo propósito necesita la suma de 350 dólares con los que podrá poner en marcha sus objetivos en corto tiempo.Tu colaboración es importante para la cristalización de sus deseos

loans.use: To buy shoes in order to start a new business

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en: Ruslan V. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. He is 45 years old, married and has three children. Ruslan is a taxi driver. He has started this business four years ago. He wants to borrow a $800 loan and expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Mrs. Lun S., 25, is married with two children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.

She works on her piece of land growing a variety of vegetables and makes around $2.70 a day in revenue. Her husband works selling ice to the people in his area and can typically make around $3.80 a day.

Mrs. Lun S. hopes to use this loan to purchase more seeds to expand her crops and the remaining money to open a new business selling sugar cane juice. Money also will go toward buying a freezer and a motorcycle for her husband's business.

loans.use: To open a new business selling sugar cane juice and buy a freezer and a motorcycle for her husband's business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel started in sales when he was very young and he acquired a liking and a knack for it. As a result, he saved and started his own business selling clothing, which has been prospering. Currently, he has a shop on one side of his house. He just acquired a shop in the Principal Market, which he needs to supply with merchandise and variety in order to be competitive and improve his earnings so that he may provide a better life to his wife and small children, who are 2 and 4 years old, respectively.

It is for this that Daniel is soliciting a credit of US $650 which he will repay in 6 months. With this money, Daniel will be able to buy merchandise so that he can have more variety in his new shop. With your help, Daniel will be able to grow his business and offer his children the opportunity to consider a career so that they may have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Daniel Empezó desde muy joven en el negocio de las ventas y adquirió el gusto y la habilidad para las ventas, lo que lo llevó a ahorrar e iniciar su propio negocio de venta de ropa, el cual ha ido prosperando, actualmente tiene un local a un costado de su domicilio y acaba de adquirir un local en el mercado Principal, para el cual necesita surtir con mercancía y variedad, para ser competitivo y mejorar sus ingresos para poder brindarles un mejor estilo de vida a su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos de 2 y 4 años cada uno.

Es por eso que Daniel está solicitando un crédito de US $650 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Daniel podrá comprar mercancía para poder tener más variedad en su nuevo local. Con tu ayuda Daniel podrá crecer sus locales y así poder ofrecerles a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera para que puedan tener un mejor futuro.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his new shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To operate a larger stall to sell used clothing

loans.name: Kamuli Rd Village C(I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Monica N.. She is currently in the business of used clothing sales and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes. Monica is 32 years old and is married. She has 5 children ranging from ages 2 to 15, and most of her children go to school. Each week, Monica makes approximately UGX 120000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for her personal needs and save the rest. Monica has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to add stock to the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Monica is joined in her small group by Margret K. and Justine N.. Margret K. has a business running a retail shop and wants to increase the amount of commodities in her shop. Justine N. is currently operating a business selling matooke and wants a loan to expand to wholesale.

loans.use: To add more working capital to clothing business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 18 years old and is a single woman. Mariam started selling clothes in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama Baldé lives in Velingara, Senegal.  She is 53 years old and married. She has 3 children, 5 grandchildren and another child from her husband's family under her care.  She has been a member of the Samba 15ANS village bank for over 2 years.  Mariama is requesting this loan to purchase a refrigerator for her ice cream business.  She will also purchase bazin and brodé fabrics to sell. This loan is for a duration of  6 months and will be repaid with a single, bulk repayment at the end of 6 months.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for her ice cream business as well as 2 types of fabric for resale.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en: M. Aziza has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2003. She has been a reliable client and has not had any problems with loan repayment. Mrs. M. is 26 years old and lives in Khujand. She is involved in the commercial services and underwear and socks sales business. Mrs. M. is now asking for a business support loan of US$1,050 for a 4-month term to be able to purchase a new assortment of goods.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for sale

loans.name: Thi Thuoc

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Thuoc, 54 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 1999. Before that, her family's income came mainly from farming. Therefore, she used the first loan to invest in raising livestock.
