However, the income from that project did not bring about a significant increase in income. As she is skillful and sensitive in doing business, she discussed with her husband and decided to borrow and invest in growing decorative plants. Together with raising livestock and farming, this project has brought about increasing income. Currently, she has many decorative plants with high values. This time round, she would like to borrow 9,000,000VND (550USD) to grow more decorative plants to sell in the coming Lunar New Year. Her family's monthly income is 4,000,000VND (about 250USD)

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thược năm nay 54 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương gia đình chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp. Vì vậy khi được vay vốn vòng 1 gia đình chị đã sử dụng để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Nhưng hiệu quả từ dự án chăn nuôi lại không mang lại hiệu quả kinh tế cao. Với bàn tay khéo léo và sự nhanh nhẹn trong việc nắm bắt nhu cầu thị trường vợ chồng chị đã bàn bạc và quyết định vay vốn để đầu tư vào dự án tăng thu nhập mới đó là dự án trồng cây cảnh. Với dự án này kết hợp với chăn nuôi, trồng trọt, thu nhập của gia đình chị đã rất ổn định và ngày càng phát triển.Trong vườn nhà chị hiện nay đang có rất nhiều cây cảnh có giá trị kinh tế cao. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư cho việc trồng cây cảnh để bán trong dịp Tết Nguyên đán tới. Thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Invest in  growing decorative plants

loans.name: Raiy

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Raiy is a 43-year-old farmer. For three years, she has also sold porridge and raised pigs, earning $2.67 per day. She lives in Khcas Commune, Siem Reap Provice. Her husband, Mr. Srey Ro, 42, is a bricklayer earning $2.73 per day. They live with their four children. Their two eldest children can earn $0.75 per day.

In order to increase her family's income, Raiy requests a loan of $500 to purchase wine proving tools to make wine to sell. She will use the remainder of the loan to purchase fertilizer for her rice crop. This loan will help their family increase their income from the new occupation. In the future, Raiy wants all her children to graduate university and get good jobs.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase wine proving tools to make wine to sell and to purchase fertilizer for her rice crop.

loans.name: Hasina's Tusifarikiane Group

texts.en:
Hasina is 50 years old, married, and has nine children, all between 7 and 28 years old. Since 2005, Hasina has been earning income selling charcoal and firewood. Every day, she works from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m., earning a monthly profit of about US$70 from the sales.

Hasina currently needs a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for sale in order to improve her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group members, who have businesses dealing with dress-making and general sales.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and firewood for sale

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda inició el negocio para pagar gastos adicionales y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, primero empezó a hacer y vender arreglos florales para diversas ocasiones a sus vecinos y ellos le recomendaron mas personas para arreglos de mesas, y fue así como empezó a hacer se de clientes y que su negocio fue prosperando.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $325 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar material de trabajo y cumplir los encargos que tiene de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yolanda started her business to help her husband afford living expenses and to cover additional living costs. She started manufacturing and selling flower ornaments for her neighbors' special occasions. Those neighbors, in turn, began telling their friends about Yolanda's table ornaments; therefore, she slowly began building a clientele and her business prospered. She needs a loan in the amount of US$325 that we will be paid back within 6 months. This amount will be used to purchase merchandise to fulfill clients' orders.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: comprar material de trabajo

loans.name: Mrs. Samrith Mom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Samrith M. is 35 years old and the father of four He is a motorbike taxi driver who makes a small income to support his family. His wife, Hun Saron, is a farmer who owns a 0.7-hectar rice plantation. Although Samrith and Hun have different businesses, they still cannot support their family. Samrith has decided to ask for a loan to help build a new house for their household. 

Samrith is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. Ten people who are living in Damnak RovI. Village in Takeo Province are made up the village bank loan and they plan to use the loan for different purposes.
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Seven members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to add to her saving to build a new house for her household.

loans.name: Mukaramkhon

texts.en: Mukaramkhon M. is 50 years old.  She is married with 4 children.  Mukaramkhon started her business in 1994 after being retrenched from the company she was working for.  With her retrenchment money, Mukaramkhon immediately rented a shop and opened a cosmetic shop.  The business has been doing very well up to now and Mukaramkhon has been able to generate a good income from it.  She now wants to increase the stock in her shop, which will enable her customers to have a better variety of cosmetics to choose from, and they will be able to get any products they require at her shop.  Mukaramkhon is therefore requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni ($1200 USD) which she will use to purchase much-needed products like shampoo, soap and perfumes for her shop.  The repayment period for her loan will be 6 months.  She expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes and cosmetics in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Khann

texts.en: Mrs. Khann K. is a 59-year-old widow with two children one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the remaining one is immigrant who works in Malaysia. Mrs. Khann K. is a villager in Taing Srey village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a  2.5-hectar field where she cultivates rice for a living. She now faces a small problem because she does not have enough rice seeds to cultivate rice in the dry season. Thus, Mrs K. has decided to ask for a loan of $500 to buy more rice seeds for this purpose. In addition, she would use the rest of the loan to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field and purchase fertilizers to support the field.

loans.use: To buy more rice seeds, to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field, and to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
N. Nasiba is 38 years old. She is married with four children. Nasiba is selling women’s clothing at the local market. She started her business 6 and a half years ago. At that time her husband-entrepreneur supported Nasiba, providing the funds for start-up. Gradually Nasiba's business expanded. Being hard-working and polite by nature, she managed to obtain a clientele that is happy with her goods and the services. The business generates a stable income for the family. Nasiba loves her children very much and she wants all of them to be well educated. Today she is requesting $1200 USD for the term of 8 months. She is planning to spend the loan to purchase additional fashionable clothes for women. You could become an important part in Nasiba family's life. She deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of the clothing for increasing the range of goods

loans.name: Moh

texts.fr:
Madame Moh B. a accumulé beaucoup d’expériences dans le commerce notammant la vente de crème et d’igname. N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, elle a appris cette activité auprès de sa coépouse. Elle mène son activité dans les differents quartiers de Bougouni.
Elle avait tenté plusieurs activités notamment la vente de chaussures et tissus et cela sans réussite. C’est ainsi qu’elle a décidé d’associer la vente de la crème et d’igname à son activité.
Avec une expérience de 2 ans elle maîtrise bien son activité.
Pour agrandir son entreprise, Moh B. décida  d’intégrer une association  de son quartier.
 Après deux prêts solidaires(prêt de groupe) elle est passée au prêt individuel  où elle est à son quatrième prêt. Tous les prêts précedents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce prêt Moh B. envisage d’acheter par jour, 4 litres de lait frais, 2 kilogrammes de sucre, 2 kilogrammes de mil et 100FCFA de glace. Elle achète aussi 1 sac de 100 kg d’igname dans le mois.  
Elle s’approvisionne dans le grand marché de Bougouni. La vente se fait également à ce niveau et d’une façon  ambulante.
 Madame Moh B. envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 55 000FCFA 
 Avec ce bénéfice elle compte ouvrir un restaurant..
texts.en:
Ms. Moh B. has accumulated a lot of experience in commerce, notably in selling cream and yams. Not having attended school, she learned her work from her co-wife and now operates in different areas of Bougouni. She had tried several kinds of work, notably the sale of shoes and fabrics, though unsuccessfully. This is why she decided to include the sale of cream and yams with her commerce. After two years of experience, she mastered it

To grow her enterprise, she decided to join an association in her district. After two solidarity loans (group loans), she has gone on to individual loans, where she is on her fourth one. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. With this loan, she envisions buying each day: 4 liters of fresh milk, 2 kg of sugar, 2 kg of millet, and 100 francs CFA of ice. She also buys one 100-kg sack of yams per month. All supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Bougouni. Sales are also made there and going door-to-door.

She envisions realizing a monthly profit of 55,000 francs that she plans to use to open a restaurant.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy millet, milk, yams, sugar, ...

loans.name: Pablo Eugenio

texts.es: Su Nombre es Pablo Eugenio S. tiene 38 años de edad, su estado civil es casada, Don Pablo se dedica a la actividad económica es la venta de productos de veterinaria y servicios de asistencia. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio pero es importante resaltar que este negocio surgió por la necesidad de enfrentar los gastos de su familia. Los propósitos de Don Pablo son de mantener su negocio y lograr más recursos para aumentar su inventario. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo ya que el desarrollo de su negocio ha sido por medio de los financiamientos y así poder ofertar a sus clientes la variedad de sus productos. Sus deseos son de obtener un lugar en donde estable ya que el ofrece estos productos de forma ambulante. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 9.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Pablo Eugenio S. is 38 and married. Pablo sells veterinary products and services. He has had this business for more than 16 years, but it is important to note that the business arose out of the necessity to face his family’s expenses. Pablo’s intentions are to maintain his business and to gain more resources in order to augment his inventory. The loan that he is requesting is for working capital. The development of his business has been through loans and as such he has been able to offer his customers a variety of products. He wishes to obtain a permanent place, as he currently travels to sell his products. He is requesting C$9,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Deborah Delzell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Toribio Marcial

texts.es: El Señor Toribio Marcial Téllez I. tiene la edad de 43 años, su estado civil es soletero. Don Toribio tiene 1 hijo y trabaja. La actividad económica de Don Toribio es la venta de verduras y frutas. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en mercado La Estación, ya que es aquí donde consigue a sus mejores clientes. Los propósitos de Don Toribio son de vender todos sus productos ya que el mas solicitado por sus clientes son los tomates. Don Toribio solicita este financiamiento solamente para su capital de trabajo y así invertirlo en la compra de tomate, cebolla, papa, plátanos, ajos y repollo. Es por eso que su deseo más grande es llegar a comercializar estos productos en mayores cantidades. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 8.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mr. Toribio Marcial Téllez I. is 43 years old and single. Toribio has one son and he works. Toribio sells fruits and vegetables. He has had this business for 4 years. His business is located in the La Estación market. That is where he gets his best customers. Toribio’s intends to sell all of his produce; however tomatoes are most in demand by his customers. Toribio asks for a loan for working capital. He will buy tomatoes, onions, potatoes, bananas, garlic and cabbage. His biggest desire is to be able to market these items in larger quantities. He is asking for $400 (8000 NIO).

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mastona

texts.en:
S. Mastona is 26 years old. She is not married and has been running her own business for more than a year. Mastona has a grocery store which she attends to herself, aside from caring for her family and her home. She began this business with financial support from her father. The reason for starting the business was to increase her family’s income, and the business has been gradually growing ever since. In order to grow her business she requests a loan of 1000 US Dollars. Mastona is planning to spend the loan purchasing more goods for sale thus increasing the range of goods she has on offer. She thanks everybody who decides to support her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing goods to increase the range of goods she sells

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria González tiene dos hijas las cuales están estudiando una de ellas esta en primaria y la otra en la preparatoria. La señora quiere el bienestar de sus hijas y esta solicitando un préstamo para pagar la colegiatura de ellas e irse preparando para el nuevo ciclo escolar y las prisas no la tomen por sorpresa.
No quiere que ellas dejen de estudiar para que puedan ser una buenas profesionistas en un futuro.
texts.en:
Candelaria González has two daughters who are studying, one in primary school and one in high school. Ms. González is concerned about the well-being of her daughters and is asking for a loan to pay for their school fees and to be prepared so the new school year and the rush don't take her by surprise. She doesn't want them to give up studying because they could be good professionals in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Mamuna

texts.en: Mamuna A. is 34 years-old. She is married with two children who are currently in school. She lives in Dorma Ahenkro which is in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She is a food vendor and sells waakye and banku.  Waakye is cooked rice and beans that is usually served with stew, macaroni, and fish.  Banku is prepared from milled maize and is usually eaten with soup or stew.  It is sold in the mornings as breakfast.  It is very tasty and satisfying and almost all tribes in Ghana enjoy both dishes.  She also sells other food stuffs in the market.  She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, beans, and tubers of yams to increase her stock of goods.  With the loan she believes she can help support her husband in taking care of the family needs. She belongs to a village bank called ‘‘Hwe die Nyame Aye’ which means See What the Lord Has Done.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, beans, and tubers of yams.

loans.name: Bakhriddin

texts.en:
B. Bakhriddin is a gentleman who has dedicated himself to the business of farming and livestock for the past 3 years. He is married and has a daughter. Currently he is faced with the need to invest in the purchase of cattle. For this simple reason he is seeking the support of IMON International to obtain a loan for the purchase of cattle to sell. Bakhriddin is grateful to everyone supporting him.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle for developing business.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is divorced with two grown children. She sells women's clothing.  Oksana has been in this business for 10 years. She used to work as an engineer. After downsizing, she became unemployed and decided to try to open a business. 

She got a kiosk that was located close to the central food market. It helped her to catch many clients who go to the food market. Even today there is very little competition at this particular location. It helps Oksana to have good sales. 

Using HOPE loans, Oksana recently opened a second location. Oksana would like to borrow 11,000 UAH (US$1,450) to purchase more inventory. Oksana has a goal -- to help her daughter purchase a separate apartment.

loans.use: To purchase women's shorts and T-shirts

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (1912080328) is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, H. owns & operates a restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. H. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 Vietnamese dong (about $140 US) a month from these activities.

In 2008, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 dong from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. H. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 dong which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 3rd loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Vida Luz

texts.es: Vida Luz R. M. tiene la edad de 31 años. Es una mujer casada. Doña Vida tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella. Por lo que sus principales propósitos son de ampliar su negocio para proporcionarles a sus hijos los estudios necesarios. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es ofrecer los servicios de video juegos. La ubicación de su negocio en su vivienda. Tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por mantener al día sus pagos. Por lo que en este momento requiere del financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de nuevos discos de juegos, controles y proporcionarle mantenimiento a sus televisores. En sus deseos esta obtener otro medio de ingreso para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Vida Luz R. M., 31, is married and has two dependent children. Her primary objective is to expand her business to be able to give her children the necessary education. Her business is offering the services of video games. Her business is located in her house. She has worked with the Fundación León 2000 for a long time. She has always been careful to make her payments on time. She now needs a loan for working capital to buy new video game discs, controls, and to perform maintenance on her televisions. Her dream is to get another means of income to be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: I. sells provisions and foodstuffs and has been in this business for the past eight years. She joined LAPO two years ago. I. is forty-seven years old and married with five children, whom she said are their priority. Whatever the husband provides, Sarah adds to it from her profits to make sure the family can buy food and clothing, pay their rent and look after aged parents. The family is based in Lagos.  I. hopes for a loan  of N160,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Jhonathan

texts.es:
Jhonatan vive en la AV. Eduardo Avaroa en la zona Obispo Indaburo en la ciudad de La Paz., vive en casa de sus padres, trabaja en taller propio y realiza conexiones de gas a domicilio.

Gracias a los préstamos otorgados anteriormente, cuenta con unas pequeñas herramientas y capital de trabajo con el cual tiene  mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jhonatan lives on Evuado Avaroa Avenue in the Obispo Indaburo region in the city of La Paz. He lives in his parents’ house. He works in his own shop, and he makes gas connections in homes. Thanks to previous loans given to him, he has some small tools and working capital, which gives him better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Get equipment

loans.name: Fé Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Fé y Esperanza, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Churcampa, distrito y provincia D. mismo nombre, ubicado en el departamento de Huancavelica. La comunidad de Churcampa de encuentra ubicado a 03 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, caracterizándose por su producción agropecuaria.

Dionicia, es viuda y tiene 01 hijo. Dionicia desde muy joven se dedica a los negocios, por ahora a la compra y venta de animales menores en las ferias, negocio en el cual le ayuda su hijo. Dionicia, solicita un préstamo con el cual compraría mas animales para su venta. Dionicia, esta ahorrando para contar con su propio capital y para la educación de su único hijo.

Gregoria, es madre soltera y tiene 03 hijos. Gregoria se dedica a la venta de comida, tanto en las ferias como en su comunidad, donde da pensión a los lugareños. Gregoria quiere abastecer e implementar su pequeño restaurante, por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos y materiales, con los cuales mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: El Bancomunal Fé y Esperanza solicita un préstamo de 9,400 soles para que sus 19 socias inviertan en sus negocios

loans.name: Khoun

texts.en:
Y. is a 56-year-old married woman and mother. To earn a living, Y. and her husband plant various crops on their own farmland located next to their house. They grow cabbage, morning glory and rice, which they propose to sell to buyers when the crops are matured. The family has been farming since 1991 and typically earns $3 in income a day. 

This couple has been blessed with two children: one is married and the other one is single and works in a garment factory. Y. decided to seek a loan to buy more farming supplies such as fertilizer and seeds to support their business.

loans.use: To buy more farming supplies such as fertilizer and seeds for growing

loans.name: Tep

texts.en: Tep S., 35, sells wine and grocery items from home of Phnom Penh. She is a single woman who lives with her parents. She typically makes about US$3 each day, and would like a loan to expand her business. In order to increase her profits, Tep is asking for US$200 to purchase more grocery items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair the motor in his car

loans.name: Fialogo

texts.en:
Fialogo A. is a 65-year-old woman living in the town of Faiaai. She is widowed and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Fialogo owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Fialogo has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 300 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Fialogo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fialogo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase harvesting equipment. Fialogo is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Chuun

texts.en: Chhun P., 48, is married with five school-aged children. She resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling various kinds of vegetable and boiled fish, earning a gross income of about US $71 per day. Her husband (pictured) is a security guard at a Christian church, earning an income of US $3 per day. These sources of income from P. and her husband help cover the family expenses especially for the children’s education in the future. P. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, P. is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase more fish and vegetable to expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and vegetable for resale

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem S., 45, is married and lives with her three children and husband in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she makes rice wine and grinds rice at home in her village.  She has been in business since 2000 and earns an income of $4 per day. Her husband raises pigs at home and he uses waste from the rice wine manufacturing to feed his pigs. He is able to earns $3 per day.  S. and her family members want to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase more rice to produce wine. With the remaining money, she wants to raise more pigs to sale.  This is her fifth loan from CREDIT MFI.  In the future, she hopes she will be able to improve her businesses.  She wants her children to finish high school and build a good house for her family.

loans.use: Buy rice to produce wine.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is forty-four years old. She is married and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community.

Beatrice works hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She is a seamstress by profession, working in a shop by the roadside in her community. According to her, she has been in business for some time now and wants a loan to buy fabrics and other sewing accessories to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and other sewing accessories

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Fanny S. is a 45-year old married woman who lives in Brgy Enclaro, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She sells fish. Fanny’s husband Jonathan works as a fisherman and helps her sell the catch. They have seven children who go to school and help their parents as part of their daily chores.

Fanny joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1994.  With the help of loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase her family's income by selling fish.  She earns an average monthly income of Php 20,000.

Fanny S. is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 29,000 fund her fish vending business, and it had a positive impact on her business and family.  Now she is borrowing for her 16th loan, the amount of Php 29,000 to continue funding the operations of her fish vending business.  Fanny is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family.
----------------------------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her fish vending business.

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Mrs. Somaly S., 52, and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Oem, have been married since 1983 and have six children: three sons and three daughters.  One son is married and lives independently; two sons have full-time employment; two daughters are in school and the other is still young. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Somaly has been a tailor for 10 years, while her husband has been an auto repairer for many years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to purchase fabric for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase fabric for her tailoring business

loans.name: Olman Ramon

texts.es:
Este Señor es Originario del Municipio de San Francisco del Norte, Departamento de Chinandega, ha tenido 10 créditos ha sido un excelente cliente, solicita un crédito para mejorar su vivienda, repararla y comprar materiales de construcción tales como: laminas de zinc, bloques, cemento, arena, madera, para vivir en una casa digna para su familia. 
Además por medio de este crédito va a poder reparar su vivienda.
texts.en:
He is from San Francisco del Norte, Chinandega department. He has had 10 loans and has been an excellent client. He is asking for funds to repair and improve his home. He needs to buy building materials and supplies like: zinc metal sheeting, concrete blocks, cement, sand, lumber to live in a home that is proper for his family. In addition, the loan will make it possible for him to repair his home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Candelario

texts.es:
Candelario es un padre de familia de 24 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y su menor hijo de 2 años de edad en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el caserío Lagunas, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia hizo que hace dos años empezara a dedicarse a la confección de gorros de lona, el confecciona sus productos y luego los vende a diversos comerciantes de las ciudades de Piura, Jaén y Bagua. Candelario ya ha había trabajado anteriormente en un taller y con sus ahorros pudo adquirir su máquina de coser al momento de independizarse.

La demanda por su producto ha aumentado y Candelario piensa ampliar su negocio con la confección de más gorros, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le permitan comprar materiales (hilos, lona) para realizar esta acción.

Candelario es un padre honesto, muy entregado a su trabajo y que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es poder adquirir una vivienda para darle a su esposa y a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Candelario is a 24-year-old father who lives with his wife and young 2-year-old son in his parents´ house, located in the hamlet of Lagunas, a rural zone in the Mórrope district of Lambayeque province, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. Two years ago, the need to support his family made him start to work at sewing canvas caps. He makes his products and later sells them to different salespeople in the cities of Piura, Jaén and Bagua. Candelario had previously been employeed at a workshop and with his savings was able to buy a sewing machine when he went independent. Demand for his product has increased and Candelario is thinking about expanding his business by making more caps. To do so he needs to ask Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, for a loan of 1500 new soles, which will allow him to buy supplies (thread, canvas) to take this step. Candelario is an honest father, dedicated to his work, and always gives the best he can to support his family. His greatest dream is to be able to buy a house in order to give his wife and son a better qualify of life.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thread and canvas to make caps.

loans.name: Las Atrevidas Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria Estela L. C. es presidenta de un grupo de 11 personas cada una de ellas con diferentes actividades productivas que se juntaron para solicitar crédito a Fundación Realidad. El grupo lleva por nombre Las Atrevidas, le pusieron ese nombre porque se atreven a pedir dinero para trabajar. Se conocen por que ya han tenido experiencias en conjunto con los créditos, con otra institución, pero decidieron cambiar buscando un mejor servicio y una menor tasa de interés.
La Señora Maria Estela es originaria y vecina de una comunidad llamada San Marcos, Dentro de la Costa Chica del Estado de Guerrero, en México. La Comunidad cuenta con 13,000 habitantes, siendo Cabecera Municipal, sus habitantes se dedican principalmente a actividades agropecuarias y al comercio.
La señora Maria estela  tiene 39 años de edad, cuenta con una escolaridad de 2º de secundaria, esta casada, su esposo es taxista, y cuenta con 2 hijos que estudian primaria.
Tiene 2 actividades económicas de donde provienen sus ingresos con los que ayuda a la economía familiar por las mañanas cuenta con un molino de nixtamal donde ofrece el servicio de molienda de maíz y venta de masa, y por las tardes vende comidas, antojitos mexicanos.
Con el molino de nixtamal tiene 11 años y con la venta de comidas por las tardes apenas 2 semanas. El crédito lo necesita para hacer crecer su negocio además quiere poner otro giro que es la venta de verduras, ya que quiere seguir creciendo en sus actividades productivas.
Los integrantes del grupo asi como sus actividades productivas son los siguientes:

Nombre	Actividad económica
Maria Estela L. C.	Molino de nixtamal y venta de comidas
Maria Luisa D. Teresa	Venta de ropa
Clemencia M. V.	Cocina económica para venta de comidas
Susana C. García	        Venta de refrescos
Petra Jiménez R.	        Venta de frutas y verduras
Maria Matilde D. T.	Venta de frutas y verduras
Alejandra C. S.	Elaboración y venta de pan
Pedro C. J.	        Cocina económica para venta de comidas
Gloria Jiménez V.	Venta de refrescos
Paula M. R.	        Venta de frutas y verduras
Epifania T. L.	        Venta de dulces
texts.en:
Maria Estela L. C. is the president of a group of 11 women, each of whom works in different areas. They got together to ask for a loan from Fundación Realidad ("Reality Foundation"). The group is called Las Atrevidas ("The Daring Ones"). They gave themselves this name because they dare to ask for money for their businesses. The women know each other because they have had experience with other group loans with another institution, but they decided to change looking for better service and lower interest rates. Maria Estela is a native and resident of a community called San Marcos in Costa Chica in the Mexican state of Guerrero. The community has 13,000 residents, as it is the municipal capital. Its inhabitants work mainly in agriculture or business. Maria is 39 years old and has a secondary education. She is married to a taxi driver. They have two children who are in primary school. She has two economic activities that provide revenue she uses to help with household costs. In the mornings, she works in a corn mill where she mills corn and sells cornmeal. In the afternoons, she sells food like typical Mexican snacks. She has worked 11 years in the corn mill and two weeks selling food. She needs the loan to be able to grow her business. Additionally, she wants to add another direction to her business with vegetable sales, because she wants to continue growing through her work. The following is a list of the members of the group and their work: Maria Estela L. C. - Corn mill and food sales Maria Luisa D. Teresa - Clothing sales Clemencia M. V. - Cooking for food sales Susana C. García - Drink sales Petra Jiménez R. - Fruit and vegetable sales Maria Matilde D. T. - Fruit and vegetable sales Alejandra C. S. - Baking and selling bread Pedro C. J. - Cooking for food sales Gloria Jiménez V. - Drink sales Paula M. R. - Fruit and vegetable sales Epifania T. L. - Candy sales

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise to increase sale of cornmeal and Mexican food

location.town: Localidad de San Marcos, Municipio de San Marcos,

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 48 años, madre de 3 hijos y juntos viven en su casa propia. Desde hace 23 años, vende productos de primera necesidad, en un inicio lo hizo de manera ambulante, hoy tiene un puesto de ventas en un mercado cerca de su casa. Su actividad empieza en las mañanas, atendiendo a sus clientes, y por las tardes, después de almuerzo, continua con su trabajo por algunas horas más. Siempre ofrece a su público consumidor productos de primera calidad, es por eso que acuden a su establecimiento, eso favorece mucho para su economía, ya que gracias a ella, puede sostener a su familia, así como también para aquellas dificultades financieras que se presenten en el futuro. Su deseo es seguir trabajando en su negocio, por lo querrá adquirir más mercadería. Este es su 13avo. Crédito con MFP,  por lo que asegura ser responsable con sus pagos, además manifiesta que dicho aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para comprar más productos variados para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Antonia is 48 years old, the mother of three children, and lives in her own home. She has been selling basic necessities for 23 years. Originally she started out selling as a street merchant, but now she has a store near her home. She begins her work in the mornings, attending to her customers until lunchtime. In the afternoons, she continues her work for a few more hours. She always offers high quality products to the public, which is why people come to her establishment. Thanks to the favorable income that her business generates, she is able to support her family and handle any financial difficulties that may occur in the future. She wants to acquire more merchandise so that she can continue working in her business.

This is her thirteenth loan with MFP. Antonia assures us that she will be responsible with her payments. She also says the funds will be very useful in advancing her business. The loan will be used to buy various products to restock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

loans.name: Libertino's Group

texts.en:
Libertino S. is from the village of Mozzozzin, Santa Maria, Isabela. He is 47 years old. Libertino is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Libertino is single. To make a living, Libertino owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Libertino has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Libertino joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Libertino has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. Libertino is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Libertino from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Ever Wilder

texts.es:
Ever es un padre de familia de 28 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Tembladera, el distrito con menos altitud de la región Cajamarca, pertenece a la región de Contumaza, se encuentra ubicado a tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la comercialización de verduras frente al mercado de la localidad de tembladera, el nos cuenta que el negocio nació de la necesidad de contar con un ingreso que le permitiera sustentar los gastos de su familia. Empezó vendiendo pocos productos y actualmente ya cuenta con bastante demanda, por lo que sus productos encuentran rápida acogida, ello lo pone muy contento y cada dia se esfuerza para seguir creciendo como empresario. Ever nos comenta con bastante orgullo de que gracias a las ganancias que le brinda su negocio ha podido construir su vivienda y que poco a poco esta avanzando en este proceso. 

Ever desea responder de mejor manera a la demanda de sus clientes adquiriendo mas productos, de modo que pueda ampliar su negocio, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Ever es un joven padre que da lo mejor de si por sacar a su familia adelante, en la localidad de tembladera sus vecinos y clientes le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una persona honrada y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Ever is 28 years old and a father. He lives in the Temblandera district, along with his wife and two children. Temblandera is the lowest lying district in the Cajamarca region of Contumaza, located three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque. He’s been selling vegetables in front of the Temblandera marketplace for the past three years. He tells us that his business was born out of the need to earn an income to be able to support his family. He began by selling only a few items, but how he can count on a much greater demand and his products sell quickly. This makes him very happy and he works harder each day as an entrepreneur. Ever is proud to say that the income he has earned through his business has allowed him to build his home little by little. Ever would like to be able to better respond to his customers’ demands by acquiring more items and expanding his business. It’s because of this that he has seen fit to request his first loan of 1,500 PEN ($350) through Edpyme Alternativa. Ever is a young father who gives his best to help move his family ahead. He is admired by his neighbors and customers and they consider him to be hard working and honest.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vegetables for resale

loans.name: Oscar Nevil

texts.es:
Oscar de 39 años, vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil, el aunque no tuvo un estudio avanzado en reparación de equipos electrónicos por la necesidad de dinero tuvo que trabajar en “Casa Soni” donde aprendió toda la practica que necesitaba para tener su propio negocio. 

Cuando le bajaron el sueldo aprobecho para tener su propio ingresos e independizarse. En la actualidad el tiene un taller de reparación de equipos electrónicos. Repara televisores a $ 80.00, DVD  a $ 15.00, etc.  Trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días. 

Con el fin de reparar mas aparatos electrónicos el quiere comprar mas repuestos con el préstamo. En el futuro quiere vender repuestos y readecuar el local para tener mas espacio.
texts.en:
Oscar, age 39, lives in a periurban area of Guayaquil. Even though he did not have advanced studies in repairing electronic equipment, he had to work en “Casa Soni” because he needed money. There he got all of the training he needed to have his own business. He took the opportunity, when his salary was lowered, to have his own income and become independent. He currently has a repair shop for electronic equipment. He repairs televisions for $80.00 and DVDs for $15.00, etc. He works from nine a.m. until six p.m. everyday. In order to repair more electronic equipment, he wants to use the loan to buy more replacement parts. In the future he wants to sell replacement parts and recondition his place in order to have more space.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replacement parts

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en:
Dolly M. is from the village of Lumipac, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old and married with 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Dolly sells household items and dry goods in the local community. Dolly has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Dolly joined PMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dolly successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC which she used as additional capital for her business. Dolly is requesting her third loan from PMPC, for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to redeem the pawned land.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To redeem the pawned land.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita J. is from the village of San Antonio, Katipunan. She is 49 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $200 a month from these activities.

In 2007, Esterlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. 

She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. This will be her 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 24-year-old single man.  For years, he has been selling mobile phone cards to earn a living. He has been an active member of Faulu Kenya and previously took out a loan of 20,000 KES.  He has requested a new loan of 20,000 KES to buy more mobile phone cards.  He hopes to have a well established business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more mobile phone cards

loans.name: Elmira's Group

texts.en:
Elmira S., 45, is the leader of this group. She is a widow and has raised four children. Elmira’s mother-in-law suggested that she purchase a cow and sell milk to make money. Elmira now sells ten liters of milk per day. She also breeds livestock and wants to use the money received from this loan to purchase sheep for breeding. In the future, Elmira plans to increase the number of her livestock and to save money to be able to support her children in the future.

Kenjeke M. is the treasurer of the group. She is 35 and a widow. She has three children; all of them are at school. Kenjeke is engaged in farming, cultivating barley and clover. She also sells 15 liters of milk every day, earning 5,000 KGS per month. With the money received from this loan, Kenjeke wants to purchase saltpeter which is needed for farming. In the future, she wants to save money to be able to give her children a good education.

Elvira A., 37, is married. She has three children; all of them are at school. Elvira and her husband are farmers, cultivating barley and various fruits and vegetables and breeding cattle. To make money, Elvira sells milk (10 liters per day). Elvira makes 10,000 KGS per month from all these activities. With the money received from this loan, she wants to purchase a calf to increase the number of her cattle. In the future, Elvira plans to purchase a vehicle.

Syrga BeishenA., 50, is a widow. She has raised four children; three of them are married and live separately with their families. The youngest daughter lives with her mom and studies at school. Syrga has been engaged in cattle breeding for 25 years. To make money, Syrga sells milk (10 liters per day), earning 2,400 KGS per month. She applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase feed for cattle for the winter season. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Edinansi

texts.en:
Edinansi is 30 years old. She's a single mother to two children aged 5 and 10 years. She takes care of her family and lives with other three dependents. She lives in a rented home and her family goal is to educate her children so that they will have a bright future. Her place of residence is Masindi, Uganda.

She is into the retail business and has been doing it for six years. She started with little stock but now it has grown considerably. She faces a challenge of paying rent which is ever on the increase and in future she expects her business to grow into a big retail shop. She wants the loan for purchasing sugar, soap, rice, and other domestic items for selling in her shop.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, soap, rice, and domestic items for her shop

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor C. is from the town of Trento. He is 49 years old and married with 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Victor farms rice and has been doing so for over 12 years. Victor joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victor has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Victor is now requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria V. is a 63-year old married woman who supports her family by selling fish and oysters in her community. She lives in Labugon, Brgy. 1, Ilog, in the southern part of Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard selling oysters and fish in her community and the surrounding areas, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10000. Gloria needs PHP 16000 to sustainably expand her oyster and fish vending activities. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. She previously borrowed PHP 14000 to fund her vending operations, and since paying it off, she now wants to add a little more to her revolving capital so that she can increase her income capacity. Gloria aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. Gloria is shown in the accompanying picture with the raw oysters that she sells in her community. Her hometown is known to have some of the best-tasting oysters in the island of Negros.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund oyster and fish sales operations

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca M., from the town of Lopez Jaena, is 56 years old, married, and has seven grown children. To make a living, Rebecca has been cultivating fruit trees and harvesting their fruit for sale for over 3 years, earning approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rebecca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to invest in expanding the business, she is now requesting her fourth loan for 15000 PHP to be used for the same purpose. Rebecca plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Hem S., 39, is a professional tailor and also sell noodles, making 10 USD each day in Takeo province. She is married and has five children living at home to support. Her husband makes approximately 5 USD every day as a moto-taxi driver.

Hem S. would like a loan of 400 USD to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: To pay for her children’s education

loans.name: Luis Arturo

texts.es:
Luis Arturo M. M. tiene 21 años. Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Luis pertenece a la Ventanilla  Guantucoto ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería especialmente a la siembra de maíz y papas en la zona de la sierra y en la zona de la costa al arroz, esta ventanilla tiene 25 miembros.

Luís se dedica a la agricultura por varios años,  siembra maíz y papa, además tiene animales de cría y ganado para luego vender,  las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Enfrentan desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar vehiculo y comprar casa.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Luis Arturo M. M. is 21 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and 2 children in Guaranda Canton in Bolivar Province.  

Luis belongs to the Communal Bank "Guantucoto" located half an hour from Guaranda.  The group is dedicated to agriculture and livestock, especially growing corn and potatoes in the highlands, and rice in the coastal area.  This Communal Bank has 25 members.

Luis has been involved in farming for several years, growing corn and potatoes.  He also has livestock and cattle which he buys in Guaranda, and then later sells in the wholesale market in the same city.

He is requesting a loan to purchase inputs for planting corn and potatoes. This support would help financially to meet his family's needs.  They face challenges such as pests and crop diseases.  His dream is to buy a car and a house.  He also likes sports.

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs for planting corn and potatoes.

loans.name: Hugo Antonio Alberto

texts.es:
Antonio tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de padres ubicada en el sector Saltur, una zona que pertenece al distrito de Zaña, se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de trasporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina) el brinda este servicio a los pobladores de la zona y a los turistas tanto nacionales como extranjeros que pasan por el lugar para allegar al complejo arqueológico Huaca Rajada (lugar donde se encontró al Señor de Sipán). Adicionalmente trabaja como operario de maquinaria pesada, labor que realiza de modo eventual.

Antonio se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la reparación y mantenimiento de su mototaxi. El es un joven bastante responsable y que siempre busca el modo de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Antonio is 23 years old.  He is single and lives in his parents' home in Saltur which is in Zaña district, forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Antonio provides transport services for cargo and passengers in a 'mototaxi' (a motorized vehicle which consists of a motorbike with a carriage on the back).  He provides his services to the area's residents and also to national and international tourists who come to the area to visit the Huaca Rajada archeological complex (the site of Lord Sipán's tomb).  He also works as a heavy machinery operator on a casual basis.

Antonio is requesting a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will use his loan to repair and service his taxi.  He is quite a responsible young man and he is always looking for ways to get ahead in life.

loans.use: To have his mototaxi repaired and serviced

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is 37 years old, married to Peter Okeyo. They have three children; Felistus 14 years old, Brian 11 years old and Eunice eight years old. 

Rose is in the business of selling second-hand clothes and has been doing it for 10 years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend who has benefited from the loans. Rose intends to use the money to buy more bales of clothes to add to her stock. The profits made will be used to cater to the family’s needs and also pay school fees for her children

Her dream is to start selling new clothes.

loans.use: Buy bales of clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es: La señora Adriana Rodríguez V. se encuentra localizada en la comunidad de Ahuehueyo, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México. ella tiene 38 años de edad , estudio hasta el 3er. Año de la secundaria tiene su certificado, ella es casada tiene 3 hijos Roberto Carlos tiene 21 años de edad  es casado y trabaja, Marco Antonio tiene 16 años de edad y trabaja y Bryan tiene 10 años de edad estudia la primaria, la señora Adriana tiene su negocio de venta de pollo, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar pollo, ella  inicio su negocio hace 7 años por necesidades ya que con el dinero que entraba de su esposo no alcanzaba, el local donde vende esta en el centro y lo renta paga muy poco de renta al ayudante, comenzó vendiendo al realizo le dejaban el pollo en la mañana y en la tarde lo pagaba, su negocio está en centro de Ahuehueyo a 2 cuadras de su casa llega caminando, su negocio es importante porque de ahí vive con su familia, la parte favorita de su negocio es cuando hay venta porque tiene dinero y le da gran satisfacción y orgullo poder salir adelante, cuando puede comprar lo que sus hijos le piden. Sus clientes son sus amigas, sus vecinas, las señoras, las muchachas, los productos que ofrece a sus clientes son pollo por pieza o entero, bistec de pollo, su negocio es popular por el buen trato a los clientes le hacen su pedido y cuando pasan ya lo tiene listo para entregar, cuando hacen sus fiestas le apartan su pollo. Su negocio enfrenta la competencia hay mas pollerías cerca de su negocio, las ganancias las va ocupando con sus hijos, ella quiere tener un lugar para tener el pollo vivo y tener más ganancias y lo piensa logra esforzándose, su negocio le ha ayudado en lo económico para los gastos de sus hijos para que sigan estudiando, sus planes y esperanzas son crecer en su negocio, aumentar las venta y está feliz con este préstamo que le proporcionan porque le da  la oportunidad de adquirir su pollo y dar mejor servicio a los clientes, las mejoras que desea para el futuro de sus hijos son que sigan estudiando que se preparen para ser alguien importante y lo piensa lograr apoyándose en el préstamo utilizarlo para el negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adriana Rodríguez V. is located in the community of Ahuehueyo Ayala in the state of Morelos, México.  She is 38 years old and finished third grade of middle school; she has her certificate.  She’s married and has three children: Roberto Carlos, 21, who is married and works, Marco Antonio, who is 16 and works, and Bryan, who is ten and goes to elementary school.

Her business is selling chicken.  She is asking for funds to buy chicken.  She started the business 7 years ago due to need because her husband’s earnings didn’t go far enough.  The locale where she sells is located downtown and she rents it; the rent se pays to the helper is low.  When she started her business she’d get the chicken in the morning and she’d have to pay for it in the afternoon.  Her business is in downtown Ahuehueyo, two blocks from home.  She walks to work.

Her business is very important to her because that’s what provides for her family.  Her favorite part of the business is when sales happen because then she has money and that gives her much satisfaction and pride for being able to get ahead, when she is able to buy the things her children ask for.

Her customers are her friends, neighbors, housewives and domestics.  The products she offers her customers are whole chickens and chicken parts, chicken filets.  Her business is popular thanks to the good customer service she provides; when the customers come by she already has their orders ready for them to pick up and when they have parties they order the chicken from her.

Her business faces competition from chicken shops nearby.  She uses the profits for her children.  She’d like to have a place to keep live chickens and earn better profits; she expects to accomplish this through hard work.

Her business has helped her economically to meet her children’s educational expenses so that they can continue in school.  Her plans and hopes are to see her business grow and increase sales.

She is happy with this loan she got because it will provide her with the opportunity to acquire her chicken and provide better customer service.

The improvements she hopes for the future are that her children stay in school so that they will prepare themselves to be people of importance some day and she aims to accomplish this with help from the loan she’ll use for her business.

loans.use: To buy live chickens and at wholesale to sell whole or in pieces.

loans.name: Edwin Bladimir

texts.es:
El Señor Edwin Bladimir S. G. tiene 20 años de edad y vive en la casa de sus padres  en la comunidad de San Andres de esta ciudad de Tarija. Edwin no es casado y no tiene hijos. Edwin  se dedica desde hace mas de 3 años a la producción agrícola sacando al mercado productos como ser papa, zanahoria, arveja, etc. Lo cuales vende en el mercado campesino. Edwin quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante, pero el nos cuenta que tiene la necesidad de comprar semillas de papa, abonos, remedios, es por eso que el crédito será destinado para la compra de dichos productos, para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.    
                                                                                                                                                                                                  
Edwin nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para mejorar las condiciones de su casa donde vive.
texts.en:
Mr. Edwin Bladimir Sánchez G., 20, lives in his parents’ house in the city of Tarija’s San Andrés community.  Edwin is unmarried and has no children.

For over three years Edwin has been farming producing such products as potatoes, carrots, peas, etc. to market at the local farmers’ market.
Edwin wants to have better income in order to get ahead but he tells us that he needs to buy potato seed, manure and plant treatments so the loan will be destined to buy said products thus increasing his income.

Edwin tells us that he wants to improve his living conditions so mentions that the next loan he requests will be for home improvements in the house he lives in.

loans.use: To buy seeds.

loans.name: Yoel Guadalupe

texts.es:
Yoel tiene 27 años de edad; es soltero y  reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Paiján perteneciente a la Provincia de Ascope ubicado en la región de la Libertad, que esta a más de tes horas de la cuidad de Chiclayo.

Yoel se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su mototaxi por toda la zona de Paiján, traslada a sus clientes a su destino brindandoles calidad en su servicio. El ya tiene varios años dedicándose a esta actividad y gracias a ella solventa los gastos  económicos personales y ayuda a su familia.

El desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda de modo que su familia pueda vivir en mejores condiciones. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Yoel  es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por sus compañeros de trabajo, ellos lo consideran alguien responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Yoel is 27 years old.  He is single and lives with his family in Paiján district, in Ascope province, in La Libertad region, more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Yoel provides transportation services in his 'mototaxi' (a motorbike with a cabin in back for transporting passengers).  He offers his services throughout Paiján district, transporting his customers to their destinations and providing them with a good-quality service.  He has been in this business for several years and it has helped him cover his personal financial expenses and also help his family.

Yoel would like to make some improvements to his home so that his family can live in better conditions.  For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 Peruvian soles.

Yoel is quite a well-known person and is well-liked by his work colleagues.  They consider him to be a responsible person with a great desire to get ahead in life.

loans.use: To improve his home

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana M. is 46. She lives in Vanadzor city. Her husband lives in Russia now, and her son is a soldier who serves in Vardenis. 
For over 20 years, Svetlana has run a clothes business in a rented place. She likes her job very much.  She always serves her customers with a smile, so she has her regular customers and sells her merchandise very quickly. 

Svetlana received loans from Nor Horizon 12 times and has never delayed her repayments. Now Svetlana is asking for a 900,000 Armenian drams loan, which will allow her to buy women's spring season clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy women's spring clothes to sell

loans.name: Ta -Try Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “TA-Try” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan, so they may invest in their businesses. 

Mohamed S. is the leader of this group. Mohamed is 45 years old, married with three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school. Mohamed sells cold drinks and water, and has been doing this business for 10 years. With the help of this loan, Mohamed will invest in his business by buying drinks in bulk, to add to his inventory.

loans.use: Buys drinks in bulk to add to his inventory.

loans.name: Mery

texts.en: Mery M. makes soaps locally for sale in Abura near Frami in Cape Coast. She is holding in her hands one of the soaps she has made. Mery is married and has three children. She has a junior high school educational background. Mery helps her husband provide for the basic needs of the family. Mery will use her loan to purchase more ingredients to prepare the soap for sale. Mery plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to prepare soap for sale.

loans.name: Ciro

texts.es:
Ciro nació en la ciudad del Paruro y tiene 47 años de edad. Actualmente, Ciro vive en misma ciudad donde nació, él es un padre trabajador que saca adelante a sus tres hijos, él brida servicio de transporte en su propio carro en la ruta de las ciudades del Cusco hacia Paruro y viceversa.  Ciro en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro. El sueño de Ciro es la comprar otro carro para igual brindar servicio de transporte. 

Ciro es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Puntualito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Ciro is 47 years old and was born in the city of Paruro.  He currently lives in the same city in which he was born.  Ciro is a hard-working father who works to get his three children ahead in life.

Ciro provides a transport service in a car that he owns on a route which runs between the cities of Cusco and Paruro.  On this occasion he requires a loan to have some maintenance work done on his car.  Ciro's dream is to buy another car which he can use to offer a transport service.

Ciro is a responsible person who belongs to Asociación Arariwa's 'Puntualito' community bank which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to have maintenance work done on his car

loans.name: Andres Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Andrés de 39 años, vive en el Barrio Santa Rosa, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar.
