Su actividad económica es el alquiler de sistema de luces y sonido a la cual se dedica desde hace 12 años Alquila para distintos acontecimientos, también cuenta con una actividad secundaria  como auxiliar contable. Su esposa trabaja como jefe de ventas en una empresa muy conocida de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  así mismo ayudando con los gastos del hogar. El crédito que se le otorgo para la compra de una computadora, el cliente quedo muy agradecido con la institución por  brindarle crédito.
texts.en:
Andrew is 39 years old and lives in the Barrio Santa Rosa with his wife and three children, who are school age. His business is the rental of sound and lighting systems for various events and he has been involved in this business for the past 12 years. He also has a secondary activity as an assistant accountant.

His wife works as a sales manager in a well known company in the city of Santa Cruz, also helping with household expenses. The loan was granted for the purchase of a computer.   He is very grateful to the institution for providing credit.

loans.use: purchase a computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cages to raise guinea pigs.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married with two grown children. She lives and runs her business in a small town close to Kamenka. Oksana rents a facility that serves as a grocery store. There are a little over 100 houses in town, and Oksana’s store is the only one in this town. She sells food items, as well as household chemicals and other small items. Oksana worked as a salesperson in the store for 22 years. She decided to try her luck as a private entrepreneur four years ago and rented the facility for that purpose. Currently, she has about 25,000 Grivnyas in merchandise. Her net profit amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas a month.  

Oksana is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase a batch of goods wholesale, i.e. tea, coffee, noodles, flour, sugar, etc. One of her long-term plans is to purchase the facility she is renting at the moment and own it.

loans.use: to purchase tea, coffee, noodles, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 18 years old and lives in Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is currently in school. Elizabeth has a business selling charcoal, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Elizabeth has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Elizabeth hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family In the future, she hopes to expand her business.
Elizabeth is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Clémentine

texts.fr: Née le 08 Avril 1982 au Bénin, Clémentine est mariée à Victor un mécanicien. Le couple à deux  enfants tous scolarisés et leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées  par Clémentine et son mari. Pour participer efficacement aux devoirs de mère de famille qui est le sien, Clémentine vend  depuis cinq ans, des poissons fumés dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. A côté de cette activité qui lui génère de revenu, Clémentine vend des chaussures et des tissus. Dans le but de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Clémentine sollicite auprès de ALIDé un troisième prêt. Clémentine avait obtenu antérieurement deux crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés.
texts.en: Born on April 8, 1982 in Benin, Clementine is married to Victor who is a mechanic. The couple takes care of their two children who are in school. The various household expenses are the responsibility of Clementine and her husband. In order to effectively participate in her responsibilities, Clementine has been selling for the past five years smoked fish at one of the markets in Benin. On the side of this income-generating business, she also sells shoes and fabric. With the goal to re-stimulate her business and to better respond to client demand, Clementine is requesting her third loan. Clementine has already received two loans which were both properly reimbursed.

loans.use: to purchase baskets of fish, fabric and shoes.

loans.name: Mirly

texts.en:
Mirly is 59 years old and is a married woman who lives in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur with her familiy. She is engaged in farming and has been growing rice for more than 25 years. She works hard to grow her business and improve her family's living conditions.

Mirly has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor. In the future, she hopes that CEVI and Kiva will continue to support her business.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Fatima De La Concepcion

texts.es: Fátima De La Concepción tiene 43 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general y pulpería. Este negocio lo inicio hace 8 años, con mucho sacrificio ha salido adelante, pues no ha sido fácil mantener este negocio. La mayoría de sus clientes llegan a comprar la amplia variedad de productos que ofrece, tiene que levantarse temprano todos los días para comenzar su labor. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, granos básicos, jugos, leche, fósforos, sal y cosas para el hogar.
texts.en:
Fátima De La Concepción is 43 years old. She sells general merchandise and has a store. Fátima started this business eight years ago with great sacrifice so that she could get ahead. However, it has not been easy to maintain her business. Most of her customers come to buy the expanding variety of products she offers. She has to wake up early every day in order to start her work.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy candy, basic grains, juices, milk, matches, salt, and household items.

loans.use: to purchase candy, basic grains, juices, milk, matches, salt, and household items.

loans.name: María Celina

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Maluay, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre y pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, parroquia que tiene hermosos paisajes para admirar, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad para trabajar en diferentes áreas, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
 
Doña María tiene 34 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 15 y 8 años de edad, su primera hija está estudiando en el colegio y su ultimo hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es técnico en telefonía, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad siendo el esfuerzo del trabajo conyugal.
 
La Señora. María hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Yanbal, pero hace 6 meses esta criando pollos y cuyes, es un proyecto en el cual están recibiendo charlas de profesionales para ponerle en práctica y se encuentran involucradas gran parte de sus amigas y esperan salir en adelante.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su séptimo ciclo y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para un galpón de pollos y pollos.
 
Su meta es crecer y sacar adelante al proyecto trazado.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “Maluay” communal Bank and lives in the community of the same name in Del Valle parish. This parish has beautiful landscapes to admire. It's people are dedicated to commerce, animal raising, and agriculture. Many go to the city daily to work in different areas. The people maintain their culture and traditions.

Maria is 34 years old, married, and from this union there are 2 children, ages 15 and 8 respectively. Her older daughter is studying in high school and her son attends a small school in the city. Maria's husband is a telephone technician. The house they live in is their own property, resulting from their collective efforts.

For some 10 years, Maria has been selling cosmetics, trade name Yanbal.  Also, for the last 6 months, she has been raising chickens and guinea pigs. Maria is attending lectures by professionals in this project, and putting the lessons in practice, alongside many of her friends, who hope to get ahead in this manner.

Maria's communal bank is in its 7th loan cycle and her new loan will be invested in purchasing construction materials to build a shed for her chickens and guinea pigs.

Maria's goal is to grow and forge ahead in her planned project.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a shed for raising chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Jose Moises

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y un hijo, es casado, administra una granja para pollos de engorde, dicho negocio fue creado por iniciativa de él y su esposa, no cuenta con horario fijo para atender a sus clientes. 
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pollitos de un día de nacidos, el concentrado para la alimentación y las vacunas necesarias para su crecimiento, esto le permitirá ampliar su negocio.
Su más anhelado sueño es mejorar su vivienda y tener otro negocio para su esposa, además en un futuro tener un negocio turístico.
texts.en:
José, lives with his wife and son.  He’s married.  He runs a chicken farm.  He and his wife started the business on their own initiative.  He does not have a fixed schedule to take care of customers.

He is asking for a loan to buy one-day-old chicks, the feed concentrate for them and the necessary vaccines for their growth; this will make it possible for him to expand his business.

His greatest wish is to do some home improvements and to have an additional business for his wife as well as to have a tourism-related business in the future.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed concentrate for them.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.es: Rosana tiene 42 años, es madre soltera de dos niños de 8 y 2 años y medio, vive en casa de sus padres junto a ellos y sus hijos. El trabajo de Rosana consiste en la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, este trabajo lo hace en su casa, le ayudan sus padres y lleva ya con esto muchos años realizando esta actividad. Lo que le gusta de este trabajo es que tiene tiempo para su hogar y hacer otro tipo de trabajos o estar junto a sus hijos, le va regular ya que no es muy buena la venta y espera que mejore, por el momento prefiere mantenerse ahí ya que con lo que gana lo utiliza para los gastos del día. Por otro lado tiene como profesión de docencia, y los ingresos que recibe no le da abasto. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, le gusta mucho trabajar con este grupo por que hasta el momento se mostraron como personas muy responsables. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes para implementar su bodega y asi poder tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosana, age 42, is the single mother of two children, ages eight and two and a half.  She lives with her parents and her children in her parents’ house.

Rosana sells groceries and basic needs products.  She does this work at home, and her parents help her.  She has been doing this for a long time.

What she likes about this work is having time for her home, having time for other types of work, and being with her children.  It is going so-so for her because sales are not very good, and she hopes they will improve.  For now she prefers to keep it there because she uses what she earns for the daily expenses.  On the other hand, she is a teacher by profession.  The income she gets is not enough for the necessities.

This is her eighth loan with MFP.  She really likes working with this group because so far they have shown themselves to be very responsible people.

She will use the requested loan to buy more basic needs products and groceries to stock her store.  That way she will be able to have more variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock her store.

loans.name: Manuela De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña Manuela,  venD. medicina natural, es casada y vive con su esposo y dos hijos, estos trabajan y le ayudan para los gastos del hogar,  el negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal.
Actualmente quiere invertir en el negocio para mejorar su atención a los clientes contando con más medicinas y para distintas enfermedades es por eso que hoy solicita un préstamo para solventar esta situación ayudándole a seguir con un negocio más fuerte y capaz D. satisfacer la demanda D. los clientes.
La compra será en vitaminas, antibióticos, reanimantes, todos en presentación en tabletas, jarabes, e inyecciones.
texts.en:
Manuela sells natural medicines.  She is married and lives with her husband and two children.  Her children work and help her with the household expenses.  Her business is located in the town market.

Manuela would currently like to invest in her business so that she can improve her customer service by having available more medicines for different illnesses.  She is requesting a loan in order to resolve this situation.  This will help her to continue with a stronger business and be able to satisfy her customer demand.

Manuela will buy vitamins, antibiotics and stimulants in the form of pills, syrups and injections.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, antibiotics, stimulants and natural medicines

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is 27 years old and married. She has two children who are ages three and nine years old. Everline owns a phone accessories shop in Kapsabet town and has been in the business for the past nine years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

This is her second loan. She successfully repaid the previous. The loan amount will be used to purchase all kinds of phone accessories needed for her shop. The profits will be put back into the business to purchase more stock. Her dream is to be self-sustainable and grow in her business.

loans.use: To purchase phone accessories

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta, aged 69, is a resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Benigno, who assists her with the business, and is mother to their three children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Violeta operates a piggery business. She earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 4,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy feed and additional hogs. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Violeta hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration there from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feed and additional hogs.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Sherlita works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Sherlita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Sherlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Jackelin Marlene

texts.es:
Jackelin, necesita comprar maíz y gas propano para el negocio, por esta razón se ha decidido a un nuevo préstamo, ya que el anterior le sirvió el realizar esta compra de materiales de una sola vez, generando mejores ganancias.
Estos préstamos le han permitido estabilizar el negocio, y de las ventas poder pagar las cuotas para continuar trabajando. Su Familia se encuentra bien, sus hijos estudiando con el apoyo que ella les brinda.
texts.en:
Jackelin needs to buy corn and propane for the business and this is why she’s decided on a new loan since the previous one made it possible for her to buy these materials all at one time generating better profits.

These loans have allowed her to stabilize her business and be able to make her installments with profits from sales.  Her family is well; her children are going to school thanks to the support she provides them.

loans.use: to buy corn and propane.

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat is 40 years of age, married and her husband is a milk seller. He sells milk and yogurt to his community clients on cheap rates. The quality of milk he sells is very good. Mussarat is very cooperative, and sews clothes for supporting her family.  She is the mother of 4 sons and a daughter. Her eldest son left his education after intermediate and started work. He does a job in factory. 2nd one is an expert in computer embroidery and 3rd son works with his father at his milk selling shop while younger one reads in 8th standard. Her daughter reads in 12th standard. 

Mussarat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah fort the establishment of her husband’s milk selling business. With the loan, he will buy milk in larger quantity that will allow him to be able to sell more and earn better income. He has started operating his business 3 months ago and his business very much new. Mussarat is hopeful that after the loan investment he will be able to get established in it and increase his profits. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Mussarat.

loans.use: To buy milk for selling

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en:
Rechel is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Rechel has a food shop that sells viands like caldereta and afritada. She also has a retail store that sells biscuits and snacks. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands and groceries for the store.

Rechel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rechel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands and groceries for the store

loans.name: Donato

texts.en:
Donato has operated his two hectares of rice fields for almost 16 years. He is 41 years old, married to a midwife and has one child. Donato grows agricultural crops within the local community he lives. He is an industrious and responsible man. He mainly sows rice crops and then sells them on the market.

Donato said that working on the land requires effort and patience to be able to obtain a good production of crops. He and his wife work hard to earn a living. His wife is his partner in his farming activities. He really enjoys performing his farm activities because through this business, he could get a bigger income for his life. Donato would like to improve his crop production, but he has insufficient funds to buy inputs. With this regard, he is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 50,000. He is hoping that through his loan, he could improve his farming practices which will enable him to increase his yields, and thus he could provide for his family's needs and educate his only child.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs for his rice field

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”SIRENACHAYOC”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Feliciana;  La socia tiene 65 años de edad, la socia es casada, La socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de animales menores, ella los cría y los vende, la socia compra cuyes y aves de corral y  como ya es muy conocida por las clientas la buscan y le piden un numero de cuyes por ejemplo 20 cuyes para una fiesta o reunión y ella los prepara y los cocina muchas veces o simplemente lo vende pelado. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores la socia comprara cuyes para la venta.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Feliciana, 65, belongs to the “Sirenachayoc” communal bank located in Huanchac District in Cusco Province and Department.  She is married and is a small farm animal merchant.  She raises them and sells them.  She buys guinea pigs and barnyard fowl and because she’s very well known among her customers she is sought out and orders are placed perhaps for 20 guinea pigs for a party or a get-together and she cooks them often and sometimes simply sells them butchered.  She is asking for the loan to buy small farm animals.  She will buy guinea pigs to sell.  She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments according to the timeline.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 28, is single and lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is paying the rent.

For the past year, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teofilo nació en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo (Sitio arqueológico incaico, capital del Distrito de Ollantaytambo (Provincia de Urubamba), situado al sur del Perú, a unos 90 km al noroeste de la ciudad del Cuzco.). 

Teofilo tiene 34 años edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, él vive en la comunidad de Tanccar y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, él se dedica a la compra, venta y crianza de ganado. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

En esta oportunidad Teofilo requiere el préstamo para comprar un torito que cuesta S/. 1, 000 nuevos soles  y después lo engorda y lo vende S/. 2,000 nuevos soles.

Teofilo es integrante del grupo “Siempre Adelante” lo conforman 12 socios que viven en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Teofilo was born in the city of Ollantaytambo (an Inca archeological site, capital of the district of Ollantaytambo, province of Urubamba, situated in the south of Peru some 90 kilometers northwest of the city of Cusco).

Teofilo is 34 years old and has one child from a common-law relationship.  He lives in the community of Tanccar where he works buying, selling, and raising livestock.  He has been doing this work for several years now and it is going very well for him thanks to the effort he puts into his work.

This time Teofilo needs the loan to buy a young bull that costs 1,000 PEN, which later he will fatten and sell for 2,000 PEN.

Teofilo is a member of the Siempre Adelante group made up of 12 members who live in the city of Ollantaytambo where they carry out their economic activities.

loans.use: to buy a young bull.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy bananas for brewing alcohol.  He used his previous loan for the same purpose. 

Robert faces the challenges of price fluctuations, inflation, and high fuel and transportation costs. He was able to save money and buy a motorcycle for transportation which has made his work easier. His dream is educating his children and owning a well stocked liquor store.

loans.use: to purchase bananas for brewing alcohol.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
San Cayetano es el grupo formado por 10 mujeres de la ciudad de Curuguaty, ellas son personas muy luchadoras y se esfuerzan día a día para poder dar a sus familias un mejor estilo de vida y de esa forma darles lo que ellas no pudieron tener. Actualmente están en el tercer ciclo, y una de estas mujeres es la señora Gloria, quien se dedica a la reparación de teléfonos celulares de todo tipo.
Comenta que gracias a Dios tiene muchos clientes y que gracias a ello ella puede ayudar con los gastos de la casa que diariamente surgen. Ella dice que a muchas personas le sorprende ver a una mujer reparando celulares y eso es lo que más le gusta.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carcasas, repuestos para teléfonos y demás artículos, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda con su negocio.
texts.en:
“San Cayetano” is a group composed of ten women from the city of Curuguaty; they are very tenacious people who strive day to day to be able to give their families a better living standard and thus give them what they themselves were unable to have.  They are currently in the third cycle.  One of these women is Gloria who works repairing all types of mobile phones.

She comments that thanks to God she has many customers and thanks to this she’s able to help with household expenses that crop up every day.  She says that many people are surprised to see a woman repairing mobile phones and that’s what pleases her the most.

She requested the loan to buy cases and spare parts for mobile phones and other items which will be very helpful for her business.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone spare parts and cases.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a mother of five from Kisii county. She was able to complete her o levels but because of her humble background she could not progress with her education. As a result, she ventured into grocery farming from which she has made a living for the last 7 years. She owns a small grocery stand where she sells produce from her small parcel of land. Gladys became a member of REV and she acquired some lanterns which she used at her home. She liked the product because her children could do their homework at night. Her neighbors also wanted some lanterns for their homes so she bought some more lanterns which she sold to them. The demand for solar lanterns has grown ever since. Gladys needs a loan of $700 to add her stock of solar lanterns to sell in her area. She currently uses her grocery stand to sell the lanterns and she hopes to move to a sheltered shop

loans.use: To buy new solar lanterns to sell to the families in her village

loans.name: Marium

texts.en: Marium  is 42 years old, married woman. She has 4 children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Marium  expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business

loans.name: Amezee

texts.en: Mrs. Amezee E. is a 29 year old woman who lives in a semi-urban area in the Edo State of Nigeria.  She sells soft drinks at her own store.  Amezee spent 2 months learning her trade before she decided to start her own business. She would like to use a loan to buy more soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Eddie is 38 years old, unmarried, and has no children. He had education through a technical institution, but he has decided to go into retail trading.

Eddie operates a mini general store at a large heavy-haulage terminal in the city. The area is crowded with trucks carting cocoa to the port of Takoradi. Eddie is in need of funds to purchase the range of merchandise that the drivers and their attendants need daily. He therefore looks forward to obtaining a loan from KIVA to assist in this direction.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Zahid

texts.en: Zahid S. is 46 and he is from Sabirabad. He is the owner of a small business where he sells women's clothing in the Sabirabad Central Bazaar. His working place is in the open air, and he would like to change it to a more practical place. For this he applied for a $1000 USD loan.

loans.use: Mr. Sultanov would like to rent a new, more practical working place where he can sell women's clothing.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 28 years old and has a small mobile phone shop in Kirkuk. He will be married next month. He wants to get $1200 to pay for new advertising and to purchase newer and more goods. He wants to increase his income and enhance his standard of living.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: New advertising and to purchase newer and more goods

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
The ceaseless fighting spirit of Beatriz, a mother of a 3 year old girl, lead her to build a small business that manufactures and sells furniture over 4 years ago. As a result of much effort and sacrifice, she was able to rent a space where she could run her business and conduct sales. Her work day begins at 8:00 am and ends at 7:00 pm every day of the week. Her small business also provides work to 5 other people who are responsible for the well-being of their families. She asks for a loan of $635 in hopes to continue to grow and increase the quality of her products to sell in other cities. She will invest this money to acquire raw materials to build her beautiful furniture that she sells in her city. Be an important part of Beatriz's business growth; she awaits your help.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva volunteer.

El incansable espíritu luchador que tiene Beatriz, madre de una niña de 3 años, la ha llevado a constituir una pequeña empresa de fabricación y venta de muebles; trabajo al que se dedica hace más de 4 años.A base de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio logró alquilar un local con el propósito de implementar su pequeña fabrica y espacio de ventas, inicia su trabajo a las 8:00 de la mañana y la culmina a las 7:00 de la noche durante todos los días de la semana, en su pequeña fábrica también ofrece trabajo a otras 5 personas quienes velan por el bienestar de sus respectivas familias. El deseo de seguir creciendo e incrementando la calidad de sus productos para comercializarlos en otras ciudades la lleva a solicitar un préstamo de 675 dólares, dinero que invertirá para adquirir materia prima para la elaboración de los hermosos muebles que oferta en su ciudad. Se parte importante del crecimiento del negocio de Beatriz, ella espera tu ayuda

loans.use: Purchasing of raw material.

loans.name: Lona

texts.en: Lona is an older, hard-working woman of sixty-three years of age. She has eight children, and they are all married and live on their own now. With not so much to do, she owns a small retail shop in her village, where she offers her services to the people of her community. Lona has a strong heart that her business will succeed because of the help she gets from the SPBD office in order to support her business financially. She earns more than six hundred tala a week from her sales, and she uses the money for her loan payment and to support her husband and some of her grandchildren’s education.

loans.use: To buy supplies and inventory for her small shop

loans.name: Lotufaamanatu

texts.en: Lotufaamanatu has 9 children. She has lived in Lotofaga for almost ten years with her husband and her inlaws. Plantation work is their only source of income, and having so many children she has a hard time in feeding them and sending them to school. Her husband is unemployed which makes it worse for Lotu to cope with the everyday life. Through years of struggling and though her loans with SPBD she has managed to improve her family living and develop her business into a better one.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Shodigul

texts.ru:
Shodigul B. is 44 years old, has a secondary education, is married and has 6 children. Shodigul purchases and sells livestock. She would like to use the loan to purchase several calves to fatten and resell. Shodigul has been in this business for 10 years. Profits from this business help her to provide her family with necessary clothing and food. This loan will allow her to purchase large livestock, previously she has only raised small livestock. Shodigul will pay back the loan over 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобошоева Шодигул, возраст – 44 года, образование средне, замужем, имеет 6-х детей. Шодигул занимается куплей и продажей курпного и мелкого рогатого скота. На полученный кредит она хочет приобрести несколько молодых бычков для откорма и продажи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 10 лет. Доход получаемый от этого бизнеса помогает ей вносить свой вклад в обеспечение своей семьи необходимыми вещами и продуктами питания. Полученный кредит даст ей возможность приобрести крупный рогатый скот, так как до этого она занималась продажей только мелкого рогатого скота. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en: Ramatu I. is 35 years old, married, and has two kids. She lives in Isashi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells provisions, drinks, and baby items. She needs a loan of $875 to enable her to buy more provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Sokkheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokkheng S. and her husband, Orn Hun, have been married for ten years. They have three children; one son and two daughters. One of her daughters is in school and the other two children are still young and stay at home. The family lives along the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sokkheng has been a silk weaver for thirteen years. It’s a skill she learned from her sister. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village. Her husband has been a construction worker for eight years.

Mrs. Sokkheng is requesting a loan for the third time in the amount $100 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: For purchasing silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Mr. Julián M. M. lives in his own home in the Fabril area of El Alto city with his wife, Mrs. Pabla Surco, and their daughter. Julián works as a public transportation driver and his wife is employed as a domestic employee in the city of La Paz. The loan he seeks will be used to demolish an old home made of adobe which because of its age is in danger of collapsing, and then construct a new home of brick in the same location. This is the sixth loan and the socioeconomic analysis qualifies him favorably to access this line of credit. Julián has been a client of Impro since 2000.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Julián M. M. vive en casa propia, en la zona Fabril de la Ciudad de El Alto, con su esposa, la señora Pabla Surco y su hija. El señor Julián trabaja como chofer de transporte publico y su esposa es empleada en un domicilio particular de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la demolición de una habitación de adobe que por su antigüedad corre el riesgo de caer, para luego construir en el mismo lugar una habitación de ladrillo. Esta es la sexta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Julián es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2000.

loans.use: Demolish an old home made of adobe and construct a new home of brick.

loans.name: Mujeres De Valor (Women Of Courage) Group

texts.en:
Roseline is an outgoing and lively 26-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children (ages 7 and 10) in the community of Agua Negra (Black Water). Agua Negra is nestled inside the biggest port on the north coast of the Dominican Republic, with several ships coming in and out every day. This community is perhaps one of the poorest on the north coast and gets its name because of the dirty and contaminated water that flows through the community. Roseline and her husband have two of their nieces living with them, and they can barely afford the basic necessities. With this loan Roseline will replenish her clothing and shoe supply and continue selling these products from her home. In the future she wants to own a house and expand her business.

Thank you for supporting this group!

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Gulizor

texts.en:
N. Gulizor is 37 is years old. She is separated from her husband and has two children. She began her business to keep herself active and busy when she found herself sad and depressed over her separation. She also wanted to have an independent income. Her business is the main source of income for her family. 

Gulizor has been running her own small business for six years. She rents a store in the local market and sells different kinds of candies and sweets. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m. Her sister helps her with the business. Gulizor and her sister are very friendly and polite people which has earned them a loyal clientele. 

Gulizor is now requesting 3400 Somoni ($1000 US Dollars). She is planning to spend the loan to purchase additional good to sell, thus increasing the variety of goods sold, and to be able to continue to provide for her children's needs and their school fees. 

Gulizor promises to repay her loan within 12 months and thanks everybody who decides to support her. She is counting on your help.

loans.use: Purchasing new goods for selling to increase variety of stock

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en: Dilrabo N. is 23 years old. She’s married. Her husband recently graduated from the university. Dilrabo is a hard-working woman and she owes it to her dear parents who forged in her an attitude of determination and dedication for self-improvement. Dilrabo has run her business for almost two years. She purchases  young cattle in the local market, fattens and sells in the local markets. Her husband helps Dilrabo with the business. Thanks to this activity she is supporting her family. Today Dilrabo is applying for a loan of $400  for the term of 12 months. With the help of the loan she is planning to purchase more small cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle in order to expand the business.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.ru:
Nasira N. lives in the city of Yavan. She lives with her large happy family. Her husband and her three children love eachother very much despite all the hardships. Her husband works at a construction site while she stays at home. She raises farm animals. She has decided to buy a young cow in order to increase the amount of animals she has. This will be possible only if she can obtain a loan for 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Нуралиева Назира жительница города Яван. Живет в своей большой и дружной семье. Трое детей и муж , все очень любят друг друга , не смотря на трудности в жизни. Муж работает на стройке , а она занимается домашним хозяйством. Имеет небольшое хозяйство , где разводит домашний скот. Сейчас решила купить молодую корову для дальнейшей цели увеличить полголовье скота. Это возможно только , если она сможет получить кредит сроком на 8 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a young cow

loans.name: Victorine

texts.fr: Victorine T. est âgé de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle tient une boutique d’alimentation générale à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle espère avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant des bidons d’huiles, des sacs de riz, des cartons de savons, de sucres et des carrons de boîtes de conserves. Les fonds qui seront issus de ses ventes lui permettront de rembourser le crédit et aussi de prendre en charges certaines dépenses du foyer.
texts.en:
Victorine T. is 46 years old, married, and the mother of five. She runs a grocery shop in Adéta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She hopes to use this loan to increase the capacity of her business by buying drums of oil, sacks of rice, boxes of soap, some sugar, and boxes of canned food. The funds derived from her sales will enable her to repay the loan and also to cover certain household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drums of oil, sacks of rice, boxes of soap, some sugar, and boxes of canned food

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: Máximo de las buenas personas que su trabajo lo basa en el bienestar de su familia, como padre, desea educar a sus hijos y hacer de ellos hombres de bien, gracias a su actividad como agricultor puede  brindarles lo necesario para desarrollarse, un claro reflejo de ello es que el mayor se encuentra estudiando en la capital, gracias al trabajo y apoyo de su padre.  Se ha dado cuenta que la producción de sus campos ha disminuido y desea en lo posible incursionar en el negocio de venta de abarrotes, instalar una bodega en su casa, y así tener un apoyo e ingreso extra para hogar, ya que nota que la agricultura esta en crisis.  Es esta la razón, hace presente su necesidad con el fin de obtener apoyo mediante un préstamo, para iniciar su negocio de venta de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Maximo is the kind of person who bases his work on the well-being of his family. As a father, he wants to educate his children and make them good men. Thanks to his work as a farmer, he can give them what is necessary to develop. A clear reflection of this is that the oldest is studying in the capital, thanks to the work and support of his father. He has realized that the production of his fields has decreased and when possible he wants to enter into a grocery business, to set up a store in his house, and with this have extra support and income for his household, as he notes that agriculture is in crisis. This is the reason to present his need with the objective of obtaining support in the form of a loan to start up his grocery business.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To set up a store in his house since his farming income has decreased considerably

loans.name: Sindiya (Cordialité) Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre (4) femmes du groupe Sindiya toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et 04 enfants, vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier Médine de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Ces femmes ont comme principales activités l’achat et de vente de pomme de terre, d’orange et du bois de chauffe. Dans la recherche de ressources financières complémentaires, ce groupe a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel il est à son premier prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe). 
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter, 1 chargement de camion benne en bois de chauffe, 1 chargement de charette en orange et 5 caisses de pomme de terre dans les villages environnants de Sikasso auprès de producteurs. Les ventes se font au marché où elles ont chacune une place, en détail, au comptant et à crédit avec une clientèle composée généralement des femmes et surtout des forains.     
Avec ce premier prêt, elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 20.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The four women of the Sindiya group are all married with an average age of 31 and, on average, 4 children. They live in big extended traditional families in the Médine neighborhood of the town of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

As principal businesses, these women buy and sell potatoes, oranges, and firewood. As they were searching for additional financial resources, the group decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their first solidarity loan (group loan).

With this loan they intend to by 1 pick-up truckload of firewood, 1 wagonload of oranges, and 5 crates of potatoes in the villages surrounding Sikasso from the farmers. They sell in the market where each of them has a stall, retail, for cash or on credit, to a clientele generally composed of women and especially of merchants who come on market days from the big towns to buy goods for re-sale.

With this first loan they each hope to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 F CFA which will be used to make repayments on the loan and to help support their families.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy various articles: pototoes, oranges and firewood for re-sale

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa B. is a 32-year-old entrepreneur who keeps calves and sells milk in a small southern village of Azerbaijan. He also works as a builder, but in his village construction is rare and thus not a stable source of income. Musa started his current business in 2002 when he borrowed money from a friend to purchase calves which he raised and then sold for a profit. He is now quite experienced in this business, having learned how to vaccinate and raise his calves to healthy adulthood.

Musa have only one problem - meeting the financial needs of his family which consists of his elderly father, mother and younger sisters. To improve this difficult financial situation he is requesting a loan of $1200 to expand his business and thereby increase his profit. With this money he will purchase one milking cow, two baby calves and fodder.

loans.use: To purchase a milking cow, two baby calves and fodder.

loans.name: Thou

texts.en: Mr. Thou C. is a farmer in Samraong Village in Takeo Province. He is 34 years old and the father of two children who are  attending the local school. His wife, Mrs. Khuon Sarim, is a Khmer cake seller in the local village. Although they work hard, they still do not earn enough income to support the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Thou C. decided to ask for a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike. He will become a motorbike taxi driver. With this new loan, he hopes to increase his income and improve the family's living conditions . His wife is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to enable him to be a motorbike taxi driver.

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en: Nuon K., 24, is a professional tailor who lives in Battambang province. She typically makes US$3 per day. She is single and lives with her parents and two siblings. Nuon K. would like to request a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her family's transportation needs.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 36 years old and married with three children. She has a store where she sells medicine. Beatrice has applied for a loan in the amount of N100,000 which would enable her to purchase more medicines for her shop. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Lilian Escolástica

texts.es: Lilian Escolástica A. D. A. resiD. en Tamalique, vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como mecánico y un hijo D. 19 años D. edad el cuál estudia bachillerato. Ella posee un pequeño negocio D. venta D. ropa, zapatos y prendas D. oro para mujer. Se destaca por ser una mujer muy trabajadora la cuál se esfuerza por contribuir junto a su esposo en todo lo necesario para su hogar. Es por esto que Lilian desea obtener un préstamo a través del cual pueda incrementar la mercadería D. su negocio D. manera que logre ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes y así mismo obtener nuevos clientes, D. manera que pueda obtener mayores ganancias a través D. las cuales contribuya junto a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y también poder brindarle estudios superiores a su hijo.
texts.en:
Lilian Escolástica A. D. A. resides in Tamalique. She lives with her husband who works as a mechanic and her 19 year old son who is studying for his university entrance exams. She owns a small business selling clothing, shoes and gold jewelery for women. She is a hardworking woman who, alongsiD. her husband, strives to proviD. everything her home needs. As such, she wishes to get a loan so that she can expand the merchandise available at her shop and offer more variety to her customers. This will help her attract new customers and earn greater profits, enabling her to contribute to the household expenses with her husband and proviD. her son access to higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Nicoll, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: María Esperanza tiene la edad de 44 años, su estado civil es soltera, la actividad económica de Doña María es la venta de refrescos naturales, venta de hielo y venta de gaseosas. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda. Doña María tiene mas de 5 años de dedicarse a este negocio, por lo que inicio con capital propio pero con el paso del tiempo decidió vender gaseosa, hielo y bolsitas. Los propósitos de Doña María son de seguir aumentando la producción de refrescos naturales ya que así dará satisfacción a la demanda de sus clientes. Es por eso que Doña María recurre al financiamiento con la ayuda de Fundación León 2000 para invertirlo en capital de trabajo como frutas, bolsas plásticas, azúcar y la compra de gaseosas. Los deseos de Doña María son de proporcionar estabilidad con su negocio por lo que la situación del país es cada vez más difícil. Es por eso que solicita la cantidad de C$ 3.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Maria Esperanza is 44 years old and single. She sells juices, ice and soft drinks out of her home. Maria has been doing this for more than 5 years. She began with her own capital and with the passing of time began selling soft drinks, ice and bags. Maria plans on increasing her production of natural juices to satisfy the demand for this product. It is for this reason that Maria is seeking a loan through Fundacion Leon 2000, that she will invest in working capital like fruit, plastic bags, sugar and soft drinks. Maria hopes to gain stabaility through her business because the situation in her country is becoming more and more difficult. She is asking for C$3,000 cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fruit, soft drinks

loans.name: Bosede

texts.en: Bosede is 29 years old and married with 2 children. She sells foodstuffs and provisions. She is a LAPO client. She hopes a loan in the amount of NGN50,000 (US$ 350) to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mr. Sophoin N. is 47 years old and his wife Mrs. Nhor San is 48 years old. They live on long national road number one, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1982 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family house. Two of their children assist their parents in farming and two attend school.

Sophoin has been growing rice for thirty years. His wife has been selling vegetables for twelve years. She buys the vegetables from villagers to sell in the market in Phnom Penh. Sophoin is applying for his first loan of $1,000. He will use the loan to purchase a water pumping machine, fertilizers, and pesticides to use for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Benita Juana

texts.es:
La señora Benita Juana Ramírez D. H., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras D. Catac”, vive en la Av. 31 D. Mayo S/N, Distrito D. Catac - Provincia D. Recuay, Departamento D. Ancash. Está casada y tiene 6 hijos, sólo 1 depenD. económicamente D. ella.  Tiene 49 años D. edad y es una mujer muy alegre, entusiasta y emprendedora.
Con el primer crédito D. S/. 300.00  siendo socia del Banco Comunal “Villa Turística D. Ctac” compró lana D. Alpaca para tejer chompas y venderlas.
En la actualidad, tiene un negocio D. abarrotes, paralelamente se dedica a la venta D. productos D. artesanía (tejidos D. chompas), en un puesto alquilado en el mercado en la Av. 31 D. Mayo.
Con este préstamo D. S/.  800.00 comprará fideos, quaker, aceite, leche, gaseosas, papel higiénico y una parte lo invertirá en la compra D. un camión, con el cual podrá llevar carga (servicio) a la ciudad D. Lima.
Marina, se siente muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos por haberle facilitado su primer crédito porque es allí donD. empezó a trabajar porque su esposo por motivos D. viaje no les podía mandar dinero para su gasto diario.
texts.en:
Ms. Benita Juana Ramírez D. H. is a member of the Las Triunfadoras D. Catac Microfinance Institute. She is a married mother with 6 children, only one of whom depends on her financially. She is a 49-year-old woman who is very cheerfull, enthusiastic, and enterprising. As a member of the Villa Turística D. Ctac Microfinance Institute, she obtained her first 300.00 PEN loan and purchased Alpaca wool to knit sweaters and sell them. She currently owns a general store. Moreover, she sells handicrafts (traditional handwoven sweaters) in a rented stand in the market on 31 D. Mayo Avenue.

With this 800.00 PEN loan, she will purchase noodles, oatmeal, cooking oil, milk, soft drink, bathroom tissue. She will use part of the loan to purchase a truck so that she can transport cargo to the city of Lima.

Marina is very grateful that Manuela Ramos has given her her first loan because that is how she started working when her husband was unable to send her money for her daily expenses due to travel reasons.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase noodles, cooking oil, milk, soft drinks, and other goods

loans.name: Aybaniz

texts.en:
Aybaniz B. is 52. Currently, she, together with her husband, dedicates herself to her livestock business, a popular enterprise that is characteristic of the region. She is the mother of eight children who she cares for and has the responsibility of educating.

It’s important to note that Aybaniz is very conscious of her duty to support her family financially. It’s for this reason that she turned to AqroInvest Credit Union to obtain a $1,200 loan to purchase cattle to help her increase her income. With your help, she will be able to make her business succeed and support her family.

loans.use: To purchase two cattle

loans.name: La Solución Group

texts.en:
Carmen G. (second from right) is a member of La Solución--a group of entrepreneurs from the city of Samaná, Dominican Republic. She has two children who are 9 years old and 2 years old. The two year old is pictured here with her. This is Carmen’s very first loan and she is excited about beginning a business selling clothing and shoes to those in her neighborhood.

Carmen hopes that with time her business will grow and the profits will help her make a better life for her family. She currently lives in a rented house with her husband, who is a construction worker. The two of them hope that the additional income from Carmen’s business will allow them to move into a house of their own. Carmen’s husband is supporting her endeavor and they are both excited about the opportunities that the profits from Carmen’s business will bring to their family. Carmen and her family are thankful for any help you can offer!

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Võ Thị

texts.en:
S. Võ Thị (1830071569) is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has two adult children.

S. owns and operates a business running a food stall, primarily selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month.

In 2007, S. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

S. is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 3rd from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Servio

texts.es: Servio C. Rodríguez tiene la edad de 40 años. Es un hombre casado. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. El es un hombre muy trabajador pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar duro para sacar a su familia adelante, por lo que comenzó a vender bolsitas y refrescos naturales por lo que sus clientes le solicitaban más productos y así decide incursionar en este negocio. Y así empieza con este humilde negocio. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, jugos, gaseosas, pan, galletas y un poco de granos básicos. Uno de los mayores desafíos que enfrento fue satisfacer a sus clientes. Sus sueños son de establecer otro negocio como una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Servio C. Rodríguez is 40 years old. He is a married man and he has two children in his care. His work is a grocery store. He has dedicated more than 6 years to this business. He is a very hardworking man, as he has always liked working hard in order to improve his family’s lives. For this reason he began to sell snacks and natural drinks, until his clients ask him for more products and he decided to begin this business. And so he began with this humble business. The loan that he is asking for is for the purchase of sweets, juices, soft drinks, bread, cookies, and a few basic grains. One of the greatest challenges that he faced was to satisfy his clients. His dreams are to establish another business, as a distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Funds

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group 4

texts.en:
Rina is the leader of the group Mujeres Solidarias. This group has taken out four loans together and has faithfully repaid them all on time. Now they are looking to take out another loan to further grow their businesses and support their families.

Rina started selling clothing three years ago. She sells both from her house and by walking around in the street with a few pieces of her inventory to show her friends. She has slowly grown her business through microloans by expanding her inventory to provide more variety for her clients. She is now seeking another loan to buy more blouses and pants to grow her business even more.

Her goal is to grow her business enough to be able to provide all of her children (ages 15 years, 13 years, 8 years, and 10 months) with a college education. She said it is her dream to someday see her children become professionals and not have to work in back-breaking labor like many other people in her town.

You can help Rina and all the members of Mujeres Solidarias achieve their dreams by funding this loan!

loans.use: To buy blouses and pants to sell

loans.name: Luga

texts.en: Luga S. (0) is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Gataivai. She is married and has three school-aged children. Luga owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting taamu (a large root vegetable like taro) for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 400 WST a month. In 2009, Luga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Zoila Carmensa

texts.es: Zoila Carmensa S. S. ella es una persona muy activa que disfruta mucho de su trabajo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Por lo que tiene 6 hijos de los cuales ninguno depende de ella ya que todos trabajan de manera independiente, la ubicación de su negocio es en su misma casa de habitación, por lo que ha modificado ciertas partes de su vivienda para que sus clientes puedan apreciar sus productos, por lo que ha obtenido clientes por su gran carisma. Actualmente recurre a Fundación León 2000 para invertir en la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, ropa interior, cremas y calzado que es muy solicitado por sus clientes que son hombres. Su deseo es seguir adelante con este negocio.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Roeung

texts.en: Roeung T., 44, lives in the capital of Phnom Pen, Cambodia where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows variety kinds of crops, which she plants twice a year. She is a good mother of four teenage children; two of whom are internal sewing staff for a garment industry. While her husband is a local fish catcher. This family has been facing very difficulties with sanitation for along time, because their house doesn't have a toilet for a hygiene. To help provide the healthy family, Roeung T. would like a loan of US$500 to buy material and to hire a constructional builder in order to build a new toilet.

loans.use: To buy material and to hire a constructional builder in order to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Jella

texts.en:
Jella O. is from the city of Gingoog City. She is 50 years old. Jella is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Jella owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling peanut butter in the local community. She also runs a pig farm. Jella has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 1200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Jella is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional working capital for making peanut butter, as well as two piglets. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family and purchase additional feed for her pigs. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario es una socia dinámica y optimista, vive en la ciudad de Yarinacocha región de Ucayali, tiene 36 años, es madre de seis hijos. Rosario se dedica a la venta de plátano de esta región en el mercado de Yarinacocha,  trabaja junto a su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Nuevo Edén” desde hace un año y cinco meses. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue utilizado en la compra de  plátanos, ahora Rosario necesita un crédito de 1500 que será utilizado en la compra de un motocar de segundo uso, el mismo que utilizará para el traslado de sus productos. La meta de Rosario es llegar a tener un motocar nuevo y seguir apoyando a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Rosario is a dynamic and optimistic member. She lives in the city of Yarinacocha in the Ucayali region. She is 36 and has six children. Rosario works with her husband selling bananas from the region in the Yarinacocha market. She has been part of the Nuevo Edén communal bank for one year and five months. The first loan that she received was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy bananas. Rosario now needs a loan for 1,500 PEN, which she will use to buy a second hand “motocarro” (a three wheeled motorized vehicle). She will use it to carry her products. Rosario’s goal is to have a new motocarro and to keep helping her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a second hand motocarro

loans.name: Beyly

texts.es:
La señora Beyly, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Pachacutec II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 25 años y no tiene hijos.

Beyly, es una mujer joven trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 05 paquetes de gaseosas, para probar como le va, vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus gaseosas, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas.

En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Beyly, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente muy motivada, así poder hacer realidad  sus sueños y lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Beyly, 25, is a member of the “Pachacutec II” commual bank which is located in the Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is single and has no children. Beyly is a hard-working, determined woman. She decided to set up a soft-drink sales business in her home. She administers her sales herself with no boss or schedule. She tells us that she began with a 300 sol investment with which she bought 5 cases of soft-drinks to see how things would go for her. She saw that she did well and that she didn't have enough supply to meet demand, so she invested a bit more. Now, she is well known in her work by her neighbors, family members and friends. With this 1700 sol loan she will buy more stock consisting of a variety of beverges in various sizes, flavors and brands as well as mineral water, both still and sparkling. Beyly very much wants to get ahead in life and is very motivated to see her dreams and goals come to fruition. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her when she most needed help. She is responsible with her repayments and plans to continue to be.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cases of soft-drinks.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda C. is currently in the business of selling food in a little restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock beer and soft drinks like sodas, packed juice, water, etc. to sell. Rhoda is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up another bigger restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock beer and soft drinks like sodas, packed juice, water, etc.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona G. is from the village of Nicdao, Baungon Bukidnon. She is 26 years old and single. To make a living, Chona owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling mainly food and daily use products in the local community.  Chona has been engaged in business for over two years.  She earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Chona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase additional products to sell.  Chona is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to expand her business. This loan will be her second from HSPFI.
------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Expand the business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is forty-two years old. She is married and has three children who are all still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is trading.

Mary works very hard to support her husband to be able to provide for the family. She runs a provision store by the roadside in her community, procuring her goods from Accra. She also deals in foodstuffs.

Mary has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy provisions in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es:
Marvin Z. L., tiene la edad de 34 años, es casado, y tiene 3 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 9,8, y un año respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra ganado para su finca.El desea aumentar el numero de animales para mejorar la calidad de las razas. Tiene una área de 2.5 hectáras de potrero para el desarrollo del ganado. No es la primera vez que don Marvin se financia con  FUDECOSUR, el manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho a que su proyecto crezca, además que está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron.
El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Marvin Zuniga L. is 34, married, and has 3 children-they are his main priority. His children are 9, 8 and one year respectively. The loan he is asking for is to buy cattle for his ranch. He wishes to increase the number of animals to improve the quality in the breeding. He has 2.5 hectares of pasture for the development of the cattle. This is not the first time that Marvin has financed with FUDECOSUR. He tells us that the credit committee has helped him greatly with his expansion project, and he is very happy with the terms that he has been given. He hopes that in the future he can offer his family a better quality of life and greater economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 29 years old. She is married and has no children. Her husband is a businessman who supports their home. She sells underwear at retail prices to make a living. Before she got assistance from LAPO, she was a newspaper vendor. She used her LAPO loan as capital to start her business. 

Patience is hoping for a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more underwear to sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more underwear to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana, de 46 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Demetrio (44) que es agricultor y de su pequeña hija, Heidi de un año.

Desde joven ayudaba a sus padres en la agricultura y aprendió que la cosecha es productiva si se trabaja duro y con mucha dedicación. Cuando se casó se dio cuenta que la vida le daba la oportunidad de seguir trabajando la tierra y desde entonces, junto a su esposo, siembra maíz, lo que le genera buenas ganancias económicas, ya que aseguran muy bien la tierra antes de la siembra y venden toda su cosecha. Desde hace 4 años, también se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno, según dice; esta actividad también es rentable, pues comercializa una vez al mes los animales en las ferias de la zona, así buscan que salir adelante y ganarse la vida a base de mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Para el futuro, Ana tiene planeado comprar mayor cantidad de ganado vacuno y también ovino para continuar en la comercialización.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito que le permitirá seguir progresando. Además, está muy contenta con el trabajo de su banco comunal, ya que todos los integrantes han demostrado ser muy puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas y solidarios. Ana invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes y abono para sus tierras, además de dos cabezas de ganado.
texts.en:
Ana is 46 years old. Sh lives in her own house with her husband Demetrio (44), who is a farmer, and her little daughter, Heidi, a one year old. From the time she was young, she helped her parents with the farming and she learned that the harvest is productive if you work hard and with a lot of dedication. When she got married, she realized that life was giving her a chance to keep working the land. Since then, with her husband, she plants corn, which generates good income for them. They always secure the land before planting and they sell all of their harvest. For four years she has also been raising and selling cattle. According to her, this activity is profitable as well, since she brings the animals to market once a month in the area fairs. In this way, they seek to get ahead and make a living based on alot of effort and work. For the future, Ana plans to buy a larger quantity of cattle and also to continue bringing them to market. This is the second loan she has had with MFP and she is very grateful to all of the people who make it possible for her to access credit that will allow her to keep progressing. In addition, she is very content with the work of her communal bank, since all of the members have demonstrated that they are very punctual with payments and supportive. Ana will invest the requested money in the purchase of chemical and organic fertilizers for her land, as well as two heads of cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chemical and organic fertilizers

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
La Señora  LORENA vive en la localidad de el TORNO (UBICACIÓN : El Torno es la cuarta sección municipal de la provincia Santi Ivañez, del Departamento de Santa Cruz. Está dividida en cuatro cantones con 65 comunidades campesinas. De acuerdo al último censo realizado el año 2002, la población de El Torno alcanza a 40.000 habitantes.

Es una población joven, constituida por emigrantes venidos del interior del país: del occidente, quechuas, aymaras y de los valles del oriente, así como de las personas autóctonas.
Como característica de Santa Cruz, existen grandes diferencias sociales que conviven en un mismo espacio. Junto a grandes "quintas", propiedad de terratenientes y personas de mayor poder adquisitivo en Santa Cruz, conviven los propios habitantes de la zona, con construcciones mayormente sencillas (adobe y techo de motacú). Existe una diferencia entre las poblaciones de Santa Rita y Santa Marta 1 y Santa Marta 2, que se encuentran al borde de la carretera antigua a Cochabamba, donde se encuentran viviendas de ladrillo y teja junto a las más sencillas, y las poblaciones campesinas que se encuentran hacia el interior de la montaña, que son puramente de adobe y motacú, con condiciones mucho más sencillas, donde no llegan el agua y la luz.
Estas poblaciones se encuentran a una distancia de entre 5 y 20 kilómetros hacia el interior (en la zona pastoral que deben atender los voluntarios). Dicha zona pastoral está compuesta de 9 comunidades, a las que se accede por caminos de tierra por los que a veces pasan vagonetas para poder acceder a ellas.

La economía de la población se basa en la producción agropecuaria y frutícola, así como el trabajo de extracción de piedra, ripio y arena del río Piraí que circunda a todo el municipio. También existe una gran actividad de comercio, especialmente en la población de El Torno, donde se instala el mercado en que se venden los productos del trabajo campesino.
La Sra. Lorena esta casada y tiene un hijo pequeño, su esposo es empleado publico, lo cual no le alcanza para mantenr a su familia, por lo tanto ella tiene que trabajar para ayudarle en la economia del hogar, y asi salir adelante, y poder llegar a tener su propia casa.
