Con el dinero del credito comprara productos de belleza que se encuentran en promocion para despues venderlos al precio original, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Lorena lives in the town of El Torno (population 40,000), the fourth municipal division of Santi Ivañez province, in the Department of Santa Cruz. The economy of the region is based on farming and fruit production, as well as the extraction of stone, gravel and sand from the Piraí River. There is also significant business activity, especially in the town of El Torno, where a market has been installed offering products from the surrounding countryside. Lorena is married and has a young son. Her husband is a public employee, but his earnings are not sufficient to support the family; Lorena has to work in order to help with the household expenses and also to make progress toward acquiring their own home. With the funds from the loan, she will buy beauty products which are currently on sale, so that she can sell them at their original price. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their confidence in providing her this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Tolfi

texts.en:
Tolfi L. is 42 and married with 2 children (ages 8 and 12).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.  Tolfi has 5 years of experience in this business.  Tolfi needs a loan of WST $1250 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Tolfi joined SPBD.    This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Tolfi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Bonifacia Teodolinda

texts.es: Doña Bonifacia R., tiene 39 años de edad, es casada tiene 4 hijos,  2 de ellos estudian y dos trabajan, desde muy pequeña  ella aprendió el oficio de criar animales y lleva 24 años de vender productos lácteos leche y queso, en la aldea donde vive que se llama chixoles.  Su esposo es el que reparte los productos en su bicicleta, también se dedican a la venta de ganado. Ella se caracteriza e identifica con sus clientes por ser una persona amable,  y empieza a trabajar des muy temprano para llegar a tiempo a repartir sus productos,    ella dice que gracias a Dios ya es muy conocida y cada vez màs ha aumentado su clientela  por eso solicita un crédito para comprar una vaca lechera ya que la vaca que tiene ya no se da abasto para cubrir sus pedidos.  Ella ha demostrado ser una mujer muy responsable  y  esta complacida de ayudar a sus hijos a que sigan estudiando para que tengan una mejor oportunidad que la que ella ha tenido, dice que está contenta porque junto a su esposo luchan diariamente para mejorar su vida familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bonifacia R. is 39 years old, married, and has 4 children: 2 of whom study and the other 2 work. Ever since she was a young girl she learned how to raise animals. She has worked for 24 years selling dairy products and cheese in Chixoles, the village where she lives. Her husband delivers the products on his bicycle. They also work selling livestock. She is known by her customers and identifies with them as she is a kind person. She begins work very early to arrive on time to distribute her products. She thanks God that she is already well-known and her clientele keeps increasing. For this reason she is asking for a loan to buy a milk cow since her current cow does not produce enough to fill the orders. She has proven herself to be a very responsible woman and she is pleased to help her children keep studying so that they have better opportunities than she has had. She says she is happy because she and her husband strive each day to improve the life of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha Z. is a housewife from Gaza City in the Gaza Strip. She is the mother of one daughter and one son. Her husband works in the Palestinian National Authority.

The family has a general store where they sell items like food, sweets, and juice. Having a general store in Gaza is the best business to support a family, because the current situation there makes it harder to do other type of projects.

Rasha and her husband, Muhammad, opened the store three years ago because it's the only one on the street where they live. They wanted to expand it and buy more goods to sell in the store, so Rasha came to FATEN asking for a $1500 loan which will help them to attract a larger number of customers.

In the picture, Rasha's husband, Muhammad, is shown in their store.

loans.use: Purchase goods to sell

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa F. est une femme de 56 ans, elle mariée et mère de 7 enfants en charge. Elle et membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 25 juin 2002 et a reçu 15 fois de suite de crédit et n’a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle est un agent de santé communautaire et matrone à la fois, son crédit lui permettra d’acheter des médicaments et de dispenser des soins primaires, sous le contrôle de l'infirmier de la zone, dans le village. Cette activité lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent de soutenir son mari dans les différentes tâches familiales.
texts.en:
Awa F., 56, is married and raising seven children. She has been a member of her "Banc Villageois" (borrowing group) since June 25, 2002 and has received 15 consecutive loans and never experienced any difficulty repaying them. She is both a community health agent and a midwife and her loan will allow her to buy medicines and provide primary health care, watched over by the area nurse, in the village. This work will bring in income that will allow her to help her husband support their family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: grow her capacity for self-financing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Install a phone booth inside of a store

loans.name: Sman

texts.en:
Mrs. N. divorced her husband when her kids were young. She now has six children; one is already married and lives independently, and the remaining children are single. Four of her children are working at different occupations. To earn a living, N. owns and operates her own small business braiding nets and traps. She has two kids who assist her in making tools. N. either sells her item in bulk to middlemen or retails to people who use the tool to fish along the river.

N. says that she is running her business well but that she faces difficulty with transportation. She has dreamed for a long time of having her own vehicle for the purpose of traveling, but she doesn’t have the money to buy one. So, N. will be used this loan to purchase a secondhand motorcycle to provide transportation for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motorcycle to provide transportation for her family.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred A. is from the village of Binuangan, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old. Mildred is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Mildred owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Mildred has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mildred joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mildred has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Mildred is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mildred from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Help The Poor Group

texts.en:
Lorpu W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Help The Poor. She is 59 years old, single and has three children aged from 32 to 42. She was only able to attend school through 8th grade due to lack of financial support. Lorpu cares for one sibling.
For the past three years, Lorpu has been operating a mini restaurant on Lynch Street, Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more rice, meat, fish, cooking oil, beans etc. Lorpu describes herself as hardworking. Her goal is to improve her business and continue to support her family so that they can have a better future.
In the photo that accompanies this profile, Deddeh is inset lower right because she was absent during the loan disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more rice, meat, fish, cooking oil, beans etc.

loans.name: Keji

texts.en: Keji L. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and firewood at her home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Keji is 40 years old and is married to a peasant. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a charcoal store at the market.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia. Desde que era niño, estuvo ligado a las tareas agrícolas, que es ahora parte de su herencia que le dejaron sus padres. Actualmente trabaja de manera independiente en el cultivo de sus terrenos  que con la ayuda de su esposa e hijo, siembra papa, maíz, arveja y cebada. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo  es que  puede disponer de los productos que cosecha, además que el campo le ofrece la tranquilidad que necesita, pues este trabajo es tan sacrificado y agotador. En adelante desea tener más extensiones de terreno y comprar más animales. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para la siguiente campaña.
texts.en:
Manuel is 49 year old and lives with his wife and son in their own home. He has been strapped to farming since he was a boy and it has become part of the inheritance that his parents left him. He works independently on his own land, and with his wife’s help raises potatoes, corn, peas, and barley. What he enjoys most about his work is that he is able to use the products that he harvests. Aside from that, the fields provide a tranquility that he needs because this work is exhausting and requires a lot of sacrifice. In the future he wants to have more extensions to his land and buy more animals. This will be his first loan through MFP and he’s very happy to know that he has financial backing. He is also glad to be part of a communal bank, because its members are very united and responsible. He appreciates the people who manage this loan and it has been very helpful to the progress of his business. He will use the money from this loan to buy sacs of fertilizer for his next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima is a resident of Lahore, the second-largest city in Pakistan. She lives in a three-room house with her family. She is 50 years old and married to M. F. H., a mechanic. She has 4 sons and 2 daughters. Ghulam and her husband worked very hard all through their lives to provide an education to their children. Her eldest son has earned his masters degree and is seeking work. Her second son has recently completed his bachelor degree, and her third son, age 22, works in the automotive workshop of his father. He didn’t have any interest in education and is therefore illiterate. Her three younger children still attend school.

She has applied for a loan from Asasah to buy better tools for her husband’s auto shop. Ghulam Fatima knows that her husband has a lot of experience in his business and she is confident that he will be able to get positive results by investing money in his business.  She is a regular client of Asasah and this is her 4th loan. She has repaid her past loans on time and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy tools for auto repair.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia G., from the village of Kahayagan West, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur, is 43 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Herminia has been planting and harvesting flowers for sale for over four years, earning approximately 4,300 PHP a month.

In 2007, Herminia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise, she is now requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be Herminia's fifth loan from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Balyewunya Mixed Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Succeeding in life is something that comes with a lot of hard work and after taking stock of one's surroundings. With a tenacious work ethic in operating her 8-year-old pub business, 46-year-old Sarah N. has made sure that all bets are off in her march towards better prospects in her business and her life. Previously, Sarah operated a bread-making enterprise. Typically, she earns 60,000 shillings per week.

Sarah is now requesting a loan as part of the group loan to purchase more crates of high-flavor beverages for her pub. She belongs to Balyewunya Mixed group-Mukono.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional beverages

loans.name: Esth

texts.en: Esth H. is currently in the business of selling beans, maize, and rice and is requesting a loan to stock more current goods to sell. Esth is 25 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. She has 2 children and 1 child goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: To stock more current goods to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 43 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquila junto a su esposo Eugenio de 50 años y su querida hija Steffanny de 13 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La bodega de María es la primera en abrirse en la ciudad de San Francisco, desde las 5 de la mañana sus puertas ya están listas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega, no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 8 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, anhela poner un restaurante, con el cual mejore la economía de su familia. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y espera poder pagar a tiempo sus cuotas, ya que no quiere causarles problemas a las compañeras de su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará una refrigeradora, para brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en: María, 43 years old, is a happy and hardworking woman.She lives in a rented house with her 50-year old husband Eugenio and their beloved 13-year old daughter Steffanny. She wants to provide her family with a better quality of life. Maria's grocery store opens earlier than any other store in San Francisco. From 5 o'clock on her doors are open for the early birds who know that she has a lot of variety in her store and kind find all that they need. The thing she likes the most about her job is talking with her customers. She has been in this business for eight years and the hardest thing about her work is staying in the store all day without being able to go outside. With time she hopes to start a restaurant which could help her parents improve her family's economic situation. This is her fourth laon with MFP and she hopes to make her payments on time because she does not want to cause problems for her associates in her communal bank. She is well-respected in the group because she keeps them organized. With the 1,500 new soles from the loan she will purchase a refrigerator which will help her provide a better service to her customers.

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator to offer better service to her clients.

loans.name: Maria Bartolome

texts.es:
María es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Salvador”, ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, provincia de Puno, Departamento dePuno, tiene 71 años de edad, de estado civil viuda, con siete hijos y con grado de instrucción analfabeta.
Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace siete años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/.300. 00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitió  incrementar la mercadería de su negocio de venta de abarrotes y gaseosas.
La señora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar el capital de su negocio. 
Su sueño  es ampliar la mercadería de su negocio.
Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es la ganancia generada por el ahorro.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “San Salvador” community bank which is located in Capachica district, in Puno province, Puno department.  María is 71 years old.  She is a widow and has seven children.  She is illiterate.

María has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for seven years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles.  She used this money to increase the merchandise of her business buying and selling groceries and soda.

She is requesting a new loan for 2,000 nuevos soles which she will use to increase her business capital.

Her dream is to expand her business' merchandise.

What she most likes about her community bank is the interest which she makes on her savings.

loans.use: To increase her business capital

loans.name: Edgar Mentor

texts.es:
Edgar Mentor B. L. tiene 31 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Edgar se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es dar la mejor educación a los hijos.

Le gusta salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Edgar Mentor B. L. is 31 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He has two children.

The 'Luz y Progreso' (Light and Progress) solidarity group is located 20 minutes from the Chillanes office, in Chillanes canton.  This group is engaged in farming and other professional tasks.  The group has 17 members.

Edgar is a farmer and he grows corn, beans, peas and 'chocho' (a type of bean native to the region).  He buys his products in Chillanes and sells them in Chillanes market and district.

Edgar is requesting this loan to buy corn, bean, pea and 'chocho' seeds.  The support of this loan will help him financially to cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to provide his children with the best education possible.

Edgar likes going out for walks with his family.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Phoebe Mbatha

texts.en:
Phoebe operates a general store where she sells food items as well as some charcoal for fuel. She is a married woman, age 38, and the mother of two children, who are 17 and 12 years old. They live in Makueni town which is a relatively busy center serving several villages. She has been in her business for the last five years.

Phoebe got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member, and she has never borrowed from other financial institutions. She has applied for a loan which she plans to use to buy some more wheat flour for 7,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), sugar for 3,000 KES and charcoal for 10,000 KES to sell. From the profits, Phoebe plans to pay for her children's school fees and add more stock to her shop. She dreams of one day owning a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy charcoal, sugar and wheat flour

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBA”; Este banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Efrain; El socio tiene 31 años de edad, el socio es conviviente; el socio tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 14 años de edad; el socio trabaja en su carpintería, el es carpintero y tiene también su moto taxi  de vez en cuando el maneja su transporte, el socio trabaja con su hermano y el hermano del socio es el que maneja su moto taxi y él se dedica  a la carpintería, es como si le rentara el vehículo, el socio ahora solicita el préstamo porque desea invertir en la compra de madera para su carpintería el socio tiene unos pedidos y requiere la madera para empezar a trabajar. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar madera para su carpintería.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Efraín, 31, is a member of the “NUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBA” (Urubamba’s New Dawn) communal bank located in Urubamba province, Cusco department.

He lives with his spouse and two children who are 3 and 14 years old.  He works in his carpentry shop.  He is the carpenter but he also has his mototaxi which he himself drives sometimes to provide transportation.  He works with his brother and his brother is the usual mototaxi driver whereas Efraín works as a carpenter; it’s as if he rented his vehicle to his brother.

He now needs a loan because he wants to invest in lumber for his carpentry shop; he has a few pending orders and he needs lumber in order to start on the jobs.  He is asking for the loan to buy lumber for his carpentry shop.

He is happy with the granted loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy lumber for his carpentry shop.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa, resiD. en San Miguel, tiene 47 años D. edad, administra una tienda y venta D. pupusas, ella vive con sus dos hijos D. 17 y 24 años.
El negocio lo inicio su madre hace 30 años, en ese tiempo María Teresa era muy joven pero aprendió perfectamente el proceso D. la preparación para hacer las pupusas, también aprendió a administrar la tienda, estos negocios actualmente son su fuente D. ingreso ya que hoy ella es la encargada. 
Por el momento tiene una nueva iniciativa con un negocio y es comprar un molino D. nixtamal (maíz para hacer tortillas y pupusas), brindando un nuevo servicio a los clientes, para llevar a cabo esta inversión solicita un préstamo del cual desea con una parte adquirir el molino con otra mínima parte comprar mercadería para  la tienda. Con la inversión antes mencionada se estará enriqueciendo D. clientes por el nuevo servicio que estará disponible. 
Las aspiraciones con respecto al préstamo es realizar una buena inversión, que los planes en el negocio le funcionen bien y pueda mantenerse por un largo tiempo recibiendo abundantes ganancias para ayudar a sus hijos y puedan ser profesionales D. éxito.
texts.en:
María Teresa, 47, lives in San Miguel. She runs a grocery store and sells pupusas (typical Salvadoran fast-food).  She lives with her two children who are 17 and 24 years of age.

Her mother started the business 30 years ago.  At that time, María Teresa was very young but she learned the pupusa making procedure perfectly.  She also learned how to run the store.  These businesses are now her source of income since she now is in charge of them.

At the moment she has a new initiative which is to buy a nixtamal (corn to make tortillas and pupusas) mill thus providing a new service to her customers.  To carry out this investment she is asking for a loan to use partly to buy the mill and partly to buy stock items for the store.  The above mentioned investment will allow her to acquire more customers through the new service she will proviD..

Her wishes with respect to the loan are to make a good investment, that her business plans work out well and that she will be able to stay in business for a long time earning abundant profits to help her children become successful professionals.

loans.use: To buy a corn mill.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
"Carmela is a married woman who lives in Naga, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  tailoring and food vending businesses.  Her husband Sofronio, who is 64 years old, works as a barangay employee to earn his living.  They have six children who are 16 to 34 years old. 

Carmela joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 8 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Carmela has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 9th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000, which she intends to buy materials and parts for her sewing machine and maintenance for their comfort room so that she could continue to save up for future education and expansion of business. Carmela is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: purchase a raw materials for the sewing machine

loans.name: Tawfeeq

texts.en: Tawfeeq is a young man who runs an ornamental fish and bird shop. Tawfeeq requested a loan from FATEN to purchase a larger number of birds and fish to sell and increase the variety in his store. He is not married and wants to secure a better future for his future family by expanding his business. Tawfeeq appears in the photo in his store.

loans.use: To purchase birds and ornamental fish to sell

loans.name: Jovany

texts.en:
After working for years for larger janitorial companies, Claudia and Jovany realized that they had the experience, expertise, and determination they needed to go into business for themselves. What’s more, by starting their own small business, they would have the power to make their own decisions about the type of work they do and would be able to keep more of their earnings each month. 
 
Over the last three years Claudia and Jovany’s business has steadily grown to take on more cleaning contracts, thanks to their hard work and dedication to customer satisfaction. To take their business to the next level, the couple needed new equipment – but the upfront investment was more than they can afford on their own. 
 
A $5,000 microloan, the couple’s first from Opportunity Fund, will enable Claudia and Jovany to purchase a new power cleaner.  “This machine will do three jobs at once!” explained Jovany. By automating part of the cleaning process that Claudia and Jovany currently do by hand, this machine will dramatically increase their efficiency and improve the services they can offer to their clients.

loans.use: New equipment for his cleaning business

loans.name: Prudencio

texts.es: El señor Prudencio, es carpintero y tiene un pequeño taller en su misma casa, el crédito lo necesita para adquirir una maquina ceplilladora de madera el mismo hará que le facilite su trabajo y termine los muebles con un acabado de obra fina. Vive  en anticretico  ubicada en la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz, es Viudo y  tiene cuatro hijos. Es la primera vez que el señor trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Prudencio is a carpenter, and he runs a small workshop in his house. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a wood planer machine that will make his work easier and that will allow him to give the finishing touch to his furniture items. He lives in a house under anticrético* arrangements in Tacagua, a neighborhood of the town of La Paz. He is a widow and has four children. This is his first cycle with IMPRO and KIVA.

<cite>*Anticrético: a special type of arrangement in which property is pawned to the tenant in exchange for an upfront rental payment, and the rent is returned to the tenant at end of the rental period.</cite>

loans.use: To buy a wood planer machine to improve the quality of his products.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, D. 65 años, es una mujer directa, sincera y muy buena. Vive en su casa propia, junto a su  esposo Hildebrand que tiene 64 años y sus 2 hijos D. los 3 que tiene en total. Hace más D. 20 años, prepara y venD. tamales y en temporada D. invierno, caldo D. gallina y picarones, alimentos que son expendidos en una esquina un poco más lejos D. su casa, y desD. entonces le va bien. D. esta manera María se genera sus ingresos adicionales, y con estas ganancias mas tu ayuda,  podrá comprarse un televisor a colores para que sus clientes puedan distraerse mientras consumen los platillos que venD.. Asimismo compró una  refrigeradora y hasta el momento lo esta pagando en cuotas. Con mucha alegría realiza su negocio y se siente muy feliz por sus logros. Ahora se ha propuesto comprarse una lavadora, y está convencida, que con este crédito hará realidad su sueño. En adelante lo que mas desea es techar su casa D. material noble y, D. ese modo continuar construyendo otras habitaciones. Ingresa a su décimo crédito con MFP, y se compromete seguir siendo puntual en sus pagos, en agradecimiento D. tantas ayudas que ustedes le dieron. D. obtener el crédito que solicita, va comprarse su lavadora, para mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
María is 65 years old.  She is a very direct, sincere and good woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 64 year-old Hildebrand, and two of her three children.

For more than 20 years, Maria has been making and selling tamales.  In the winter she also makes chicken soup and 'picarones' (a type of doughnut) which are sold on a street corner not far from her home.  Her business has done well.  This is how Maria makes her additional income and with her profits, plus your help, she will be able to buy a color television set so that her customers can enjoy themselves while they are eating the dishes that she sells.  Maria also bought a refrigerator which she is paying for in installments.

Maria carries out her business with a lot of joy and she feels very happy with what she has accomplished.  She is now planning to buy a washing machine and she is convinced that, with this loan, she will see her dream fulfilled.  What she most wishes for in the future is to roof her house with good-quality construction materials and to continue building other rooms.

This is Maria's tenth loan from MFP and she pledges to continue making her loan repayments on time in recognition of the great help that you have given her in the past.  She will use her loan to buy herself a washing machine which will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine

loans.name: Martiniano

texts.es: El Sr. Martiniano Vive en el municipio de la Guardia, localidad de Basilio, tiene un punto internet, donde brinda servicio, también arregla radios, hace un año que a puesto su punto, su esposa le ayuda en el negocio, el destino del crédito es para comprar equipo de  computadoras para ampliar su negocio, es nacido en el departamento de Cochabamba, hace unos 30 años que llego a la ciudad, donde formo su familia, por crisis económica  su primera esposa se fue a trabajar a España, donde formo otra vida, el quedo con sus hijos pequeño lo cual el los crio, ahora ya son independientes y por lo tanto el convive recién con su nueva esposa; se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo económico brindado.
texts.en: Martiniano lives in the La Guardia neighborhood of the town of Basilio. He offers Internet services and he also repairs radios. He has been running his Internet café for one year, and his wife helps him in the shop. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy more computers to expand his activity. He was born in the Cochabamba department and some 30 years ago he came to La Guardia, where he started his family. Due to the economic crisis, his first wife went working in Spain, where she started a new life. He was left with his young children and he raised them: they are now economically independent, and so he has recently stated living with his new wife. He is thankful to the institution for the economic support provided.

loans.use: To buy more computers.

loans.name: Aomalotasi

texts.en:
Aomalotasi is 39 years of age, married and has seven children. Aomalotasi owns & operates a business planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  She has 1 year of experience in this business. Aomalotasi needs a loan of WST $1000 to invest in expanding her business. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2011, Aomalotasi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Aomalotasi's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Née en 1971 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, Rose est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Roger et a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Depuis huit ans, Rose vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Rose  n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Rose vend de façon ambulante, de la bouillie de maïs et de la bouillie de tapioca, accompagnée d’arachide grillée. Rose s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Rose sollicite auprès de ALIDé un troisième prêt. Les deux premiers crédits ont été tous bien remboursés.
texts.en: Rose was born in 1971 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to a mechanic called Roger and has three children in her care, all of whom attend school. Rose has lived with her husband and children for eight years, and the couple see to the family's needs together. Rose did not go to school. In order to meet the family's needs, Rose sells corn and 'tapioca' (cassava) broth, with grilled peanuts. She sources her goods from Dantokpa, Benin's international market. In order to boost her business and to better meet her customers' needs she is seeking a third loan from ALIDé. She successfully repaid her first two loans.

loans.use: To purchase corn, 'tapioca' and peanuts

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with 2 boys, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a food stall business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also operates real estate houses which contributes as her other source of income. Halima faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. 

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of vegetables, potatoes and tomatoes and to repair her vegetable stall. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of vegetables, potatoes and tomatoes and to repair her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Yesid José

texts.es: Yesid vive con su conyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 2 a 9 años, en el barrio Villa del Carmen del municipio de Soledad, lugar muy cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla; Hace un años su vecina decidió cerrar su negocio de cafè internet y lo ofreciò a yesid para que lo pagara por cuotas todos los equipos, él muy conciente de esta oportunidad, consiguió un local bien ubicado en su comunidad y emprendió su aventura,  llamada “Cafè Internet YESITEL” que como el dice “le ha ido muy bien gracias a Dios” y en 6 meses ya ha canelado a su vecina el valor de sus equipos. En la actualiad se acercò a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para aplicar a su credikiva, que es el priemer financiamiento que hace a esta organizaciòn, porque quiere continuar creciendo, para generar mayores ingresos y aumentar el bienestar familiar y ofrecer oportunidades de estudio a sus hijos, para que en un futuro sean exitosos. Con su credikiva comprará un computador, una impresora, telefonos inalambricos para fortalecer su negocio e iniciar la puesta en marcha de su sueño de crecimiento.
texts.en:
Yesid lives with his wife and three children who are aged between 2 and 9.  They live in Villa del Carmen neighborhood, in the town of Soledad, which is very near the city of Barranquilla.

Some years ago, Yesid's neighbor decided to close her Internet cafe business and offered it to Yesid, allowing him to pay her in instalments for all the equipment.  Yesid took on this opportunity very responsibly.  He acquired well-located business premises in his community and started his business venture which he called "Café Internet YESITEL".  He says "Thanks to God, it has done very well".  In six months he managed to repay his neighbor for the equipment.

Yesid approached Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to apply for a Kiva loan, which is his first loan with our organization, because he would like to continue growing so that he can make more income, improve his family's well-being and provide his children with educational opportunities so that they can be successful in the future.

Yesid will use his Kiva loan to buy a computer, a printer and wireless phones to strengthen his business and start working towards his dream of growing his business.

loans.use: to buy a computer, a printer and wireless phones

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Josephine has a retail shop that sells snacks, canned goods & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more snacks, beverages & canned goods to sell.

Josephine is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy snacks, beverages & canned goods

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline, 29, lives in Paynesville and is single with no children. She is a high school graduate. Pauline runs a small shop where she cooks food and she sells a wide range of goods including drinks, rice, cooking oil, bread and batteries. The biggest problem in her business is insufficient customers. She is happy when she sells things as it enables her to ensure that she has enough to get by.

Pauline is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal and drinks at wholesale prices. She would like to continue her education and enlarge her business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and drinks at wholesale prices for resale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma, 22, is married with one child and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living, which she has been doing for two years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her vegetable garden. Norma has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Yacquelyn Esmeralda

texts.es:
Yacquelyn, vive con su esposo y un hijo, administra un negocio de mariscos, pupusas y comida, este negocio surgió por su propia iniciativa y con la ayuda de su esposo, trabaja a tiempo completo no tiene horario fijo para atender a sus clientes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mariscos, materia prima para las pupusas y la venta de cenas, los produstos son aceite, chicharron, pollo, condimentos, maiz;  esta compra le permitirá ampliar su menú para darle mejor atención a sus clientes.
Su mayor sueño es mejorar su negocio y sus ingresos para el bienestar de su familia y ser una buena clienta con pagos puntuales.
texts.en:
Yacquelyn lives with her husband and one son. She runs a business selling seafood, pupusas [filled tortillas] and main dishes. This business arose from her own initiative and with the help of her husband. She works full-time and does not have a fixed schedule for serving her customers. 

She is requesting a loan to buy seafood as well as ingredients for the pupusas and the dinners. The products she will buy are oil, ground pork, chicken, condiments, and corn. This purchase will allow her to expand her menu and provide better service to her customers. 

Her greatest dream is to improve her business and raise her income for the well-being of her family, and to be a good client who is punctual with her payments.

loans.use: to buy seafood, oil, pork rinds, chicken, condiments and corn to prepare the food she sells.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
The photo on this page is Gemma. She is 39 years old, married. Her residence is located in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, the capital city of the province. She has been rearing four school-aged dependents. Her spouse works as a fisherman. To increase the income for the family, she runs a retail store at home. The store operations commenced one year ago and it has shown noticeable potential for good earnings. The family is able to generate PHP 10,000 a month.

Last year 2010, Gemma became part of the GDMPC family. She is an official member joining that year. The previous loan made was successfully paid back. For the 2nd time, she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 which was granted without hesitation. Her purpose for the money is to obtain a large volume of soft drinks to sell for a profit which she believes best suits the place of business. The expected revenue will be allotted for business expansion and spent for fishing boat maintenance to sustain their other source of livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase a large volume of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Reyna tiene 35 años de edad esta casada con el señor Tomas desde hace 16 años, del cual dicho matrimonio nacieron 4 hijos todos aun estudian por lo tanto aun son dependientes de sus padres.
Ella nos comenta que tiene un negocio edonde realizan laminas de carton.
Solicita el préstamo para papel, carton, periodico, este material lo compra para realizar laminas de carton, la elaboracion es apartir de una pulpa de carton, se obtiene moliendo todo el papel recolectado, para posteriormente ponerlo a secar al sol y asi obtener la lamina de carton. 

Uno de los desafios que presenta en su actividad es cuando no se seca, poque quizas llueve y no  sale el sol, pero esto no es motivo para que decaiga el animo por lo cual su actividad lleva ya 11 años funcionando, las ezperanzas que tiene la señora Reyna es que su negocio se fortalesca, y ya no tenga que pedir el prestamo. Sin embargo el esta muy agradecida con el prestamo que le otorgan para que su negocio siga creciendo ya que tiene existos haciendoce de mas cliente
texts.en:
35-year-old Reyna has been married to Tomas for 16 years.  The couple have four children who are all still in school and therefore still dependent on their parents.

Reyna tells us that she has a business making sheets of cardboard.  She is requesting this loan to buy paper, card and newspaper.  She buys this material to make cardboard.  She makes her product from cardboard pulp which she obtains by soaking the paper and then putting it out to dry in the sun.  This is how she makes sheets of cardboard.

One of the challenges that Reyna faces in her business is when her product does not dry because perhaps it rains or the sun doesn't come out.  However, this doesn't make her lose heart.  She has been in this business for 11 years.

Reyna's hopes that her business will become stronger and that she will no longer have to request loans.  However, she is very grateful for the loan that she is being given as it will allow her business to continue growing and allow her to continue gaining more customers.

loans.use: to buy paper, card and newspaper

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri is from the village of Tskhratskaro. He is 39 years old and lives in the village with his family: his wife Nestan, his two sons (13 and 11 years old), and his mother. His children are in school, and his wife is a teacher in a local school. 

Badri is leading the agricultural business of the family. They own two cows and one calf. Badri and Nestan sell dairy products at the local open market. Also they own 0.8 hectares of land with a hundred wine trees. Grapes are sold seasonally. Along with this, the family has a small poultry farm with fifty hens. Eggs are sold on the local open market as well. The total average monthly income for the family is 800 Georgian laris, including Nestan's monthly salary. 

With the requested credit, Badri plans to cultivate an unused part of the family's land and plant additional vine-trees. In the future, he will harvest more grapes and earn more from sales. He will use the increase in income to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and plant vine-trees.

loans.name: Abdou Khadre

texts.fr: commerçant dans une ville qui se trouve au sénégal, ce prêt a pour but de payer les frais d'hospitalisation de sa femme qui doit accouché. Ayant une bénéfice qui ne peut pas comblé toutes les frais médicaux, il sollicite un prêt qui n'est pas a but commerçiale. Depuis plus de 10 ans il fait du commerce avec le financement de la banque avec un activité fructueux la banque lui accorde des prêts pour mener a bien son activité.
texts.en:
Abdou Khadre is a merchant in a town in Senegal. This loan will go to pay the medical bills for his wife who is pregnant.   His income is not sufficient to pay all the medical costs and therefore he is requesting a loan that is not for business purposes.  For over ten years he has been doing business with financing from the bank.  Since his work is profitable, the bank grants him loans so that he can conduct his business.


commerçant dans une ville qui se trouve au sénégal, ce prêt a pour but de payer les frais d'hospitalisation de sa femme qui doit accouché. Ayant une bénéfice qui ne peut pas comblé toutes les frais médicaux, il sollicite un prêt qui n'est pas a but commerçiale. Depuis plus de 10 ans il fait du commerce avec le financement de la banque avec un activité fructueux la banque lui accorde des prêts pour mener a bien son activité.

loans.use: to  pay his wife's medical bills.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom (pictured above) is 28 years old and her husband Phat is 31 years old. They live in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. The couple has been married since 1999 and has two young daughters. 

Mom sells fish and vegetables in Phnom Penh market, while her husband Phat is a driver for a company.  Mom wants to buy her own space at the market, but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she is asking for her first loan of $1,200.

loans.use: to purchase a space for a shop to sell fish.

loans.name: Isabel Catalina

texts.es: La socia Isabel está solicitando otro préstamo para incrementar el capital del negocio de venta de ropa, ella desea comprar ropa como por ejemplo pantalones, zapatos, blusas y otras cosas más pues se está acercando la epoca de campaña navideña. El anterior crédito a la socia Isabel le ayudo en el pequeño negocio y obtuvo buenas ganancias de la cuales lo invirtió en el gasto familiar. La socia Isabel está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en: Isabel is asking for another loan to increase the capital in her clothing business.  She wants to buy clothes like pants, shoes, blouses and other things because the Christmas season is approaching.  The previous loan helped Isabel’s small business and she earned good profits that she invested in family expenses.  Isabel is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as pants, etc.

loans.name: Hanatou

texts.fr:
Hanatou est une femme âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée.  
Hanatou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1999. Elle vend des épices à toutes personnes, dans un quartier de la ville de Lomé. Elle s’approvisionne au Ghana ou à Lagos(NIGERIA). Elle travaille seule. 
Hanatou a requis son premier crédit de  WAGES afin d’acheter des épices destinés à la vente. Elle veut avec les profits supplémentaires étendre son marché.    
Dans les prochaines années, Hanatou voudrait plus développer son commerce. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit s’assurer une autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Hanatou is 41 and married. She has worked as a small-scale retailer since 1999. She sells spices to all comers in  Lomé. She buys her merchandise in Ghana or in Lagos (Nigeria). She works alone. 
 
Hanatou has requested her first loan from  WAGES to buy spices for resale. She wants to use the supplementary profit to expand her market. 

In the coming years,  Hanatou would like to develop her business further. She says that with the profit, she expects to be financially independent.

loans.use: to buy spices.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a widow with five children. 

Evelyn has a shop that sells vegetables like string beans, bitter melon and cabbage. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy vegetables to sell.

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Neak

texts.en: Mrs. Neak is 42 years old. She is a widow, living with 2 single children in Reussey Keo commune, Phnom Penh city. Mrs. Neak earns a living by selling used and new clothes in mobile places. Through her business, she is able to earn an income of $5.00 per day. Since she divorced her husband, she has tried very hard to raise her two children. Presently her stock has run out, so she decided to look for some funds from Kiva’s lenders to purchase a stock of clothes for a constant sale. For the future plan, she hopes to have her own store for selling her clothes.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothes for a sale.

loans.name: Ventura

texts.en:
Ventura is 39 years old, married, and has four children.  He is in the business of growing and selling Irish potatoes. His weekly income is 30,000 Uganda shillings.

Irish potatoes are fast becoming a favorite food in most households in Uganda, principally due to the fact that there are inexpensive and easy to cook. Restaurants provide a good market for Irish potatoes and Ventura mostly sells to entrepreneurs owning these businesses.

Ventura is requesting a loan, which he will use to  purchase germinating Irish potato seeds to plant. He believes that he will be able to earn additional income once he plants more Irish potatoes. His hope is that his family will benefit from a better standard of living once his business sales trajectory substantially goes up. He also anticipates the expansion of his business.

loans.use: to purchase germinating Irish potato seeds to plant.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling wholesale to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to install water pipes in her house. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to install water pipes in her house.

loans.name: Janeth Magaly

texts.es:
Janet Margaly   tiene 40 años vive en Unión Libre, y vive con su cónyuge  y sus hijos de 2, 1 año de edad. Vive en el Recinto San Vicente las Lomas  en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla el recreo  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente las Lomas, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz, fréjol y soya, papas criar gallinas.

Janeth  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, papas a criar gallinas. Desde hace seis años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de insumos, fertilizantes  para la siembra del maíz, así también para la compra de la comida apropiada para criar sus gallinas, también le sirve para pagar a sus trabajadores. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia. Su sueño   es poder  tener mayores ingresos  para su familia.

En los tiempos libres me gusta pasar  con toda mi familia.
texts.en:
Janeth Margaly, 40, lives with her partner and their children--1- and 2-years old, respectively, in San Vicente Las Lomas, a small town in the Ecuadorean canton of Ventanas.

The members of the El Recreo community bank make their livings from farming.  They grow maize, rice, beans, soy and potatoes.  Many raise chickens, as well.

Janeth, too, is a farmer.  She grows maize, beans and potatoes.  She also raises chickens.  She has owned the business for six years.  She buys and sells what she needs to buy and sell in Ventanas.  

She will use part of this loan to buy fertilizers and other supplies for her next maize crop and the rest to buy feed for her poultry business.  She also has to pay the workers who help her on the farm.  The loan will help her to support her family.  Her goal is to provide a larger income for her family.

In her spare time, Janeth likes to spend time with her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming businesses.

loans.name: Pheoby

texts.en:
Phoebe is thirty five years old and married to Tom. They have 3 children. Phoebe has been operating a second-hand clothes business in Homabay town for the last 11 years. 

Phoebe is requesting for her first loan, with KADET Ltd., of KES 20,000. She will use the funds to buy stock of clothes for resale. With the anticipated profits, she will pay back the loan and educate her children.

Her dream is to buy a piece of land and to build a house for the family.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothing to sale.

loans.name: Khamisi

texts.en:
Khamisi is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and has two children. Khamisi owns a cosmetics shop. He learnt of Milango from his friends and is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to construct more shelves and purchase additional stock of cosmetics.

Khamisi looks forward to opening more shops at different locations in the country despite the challenges of price fluctuations and inflation.

loans.use: To construct more shelves and purchase additional stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Naeema

texts.en:
Naeema is a conservative woman who is unwilling to upload her photo on internet. Therefore, her son appears in the Kiva profile photo.

Naeema is a 56-year-old married woman from Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan. She supports four family members.

Naeema sells clothes and blankets. She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to purchase more quantities of blankets and clothes for trading purposes.

Naeema is looking to establish her shop and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase blankets and clothes for trading purposes.

loans.name: Yeny Roxana

texts.es:
Yeny es una mujer de 26 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su pareja y sus 2 pequeños hijos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo estudiar la carrera de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pollo Frito para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Yeny puso marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ella cuenta con una pequeña carreta donde vende desayunos y almuerzos, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su buen sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes. 
Yeny se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de insumos para su negocio, tales como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, papas, entre otros y todo por sacos; adicionalmente también realizará la refacción de su pequeña carreta para transportar sus alimentos; de esta manera Yeny tendrá su negocio en mejores condiciones para poder seguir brindando sus servicios, así ella espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que poco a poco pueda ir construyendo su vivienda, y que su gran sueño es poder tener su casa propia donde sus pequeños puedan vivir condiciones adecuadas para su mejor desarrollo.

loans.use: Para la compra de insumos para su negocio y refacción de su carreta.

loans.name: Usmon

texts.en: Usmon many years ago began his own business with animal husbandry. Since childhood he has dreamed to be a successful businessman. Usmon realized his childhood dream. Usmon runs animal husbandry business for 16 years. He feeds 3 sheep and 3 cows now. He has a cowshed in his house. Usmon also grows rice in a 2 ha land. He is married and brings up 3 children. Her wife Bahry is a housewife. Usmon is going to repair his house as his house is in bad condition. He is asking for a loan of 6500 Somoni to buy building materials as cement, wood, paints and etc. for repairing house. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials as cement, wood, paints and etc. for repairing house

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 20 years old single man who lives in Tafileh a city southern Jordan his father is retired form army and he has ‎one sister who is working as teacher and one brother who is working in army, Ibrahim was enrolled to one of the public ‎universities southern Jordan. He used his previous loan to pay for his second year fees. He is now in his third year ‎majoring in class teacher and is looking forward to find a job in his field of study after graduation. Ibrahim is applying for a ‎loan to pay for his next semester fees, and achieve his dreams.‎

loans.use: to pay for his next semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farming inputs

loans.name: Zahid

texts.en: Zahid N. (employee pictured) owns a successful auto repair shop in the small town of Khachmaz, which is located on the Northeast coast of Azerbaijan. Zahid is looking for funding so that he can purchase items for his shop so that he can remain competitive. He would like to purchase auto paint, auto parts and tools.

loans.use: To purchase auto paint, auto parts and toold for his shop.

loans.name: Rosa Antonia

texts.en:
My name is Rosa V., and I sell men and women's clothing such as shirts, blouses, pants and shoes. I have had my business for 3 years, and my clients are great. I sell my products in public and private offices, my goal is to increase my inventory to increase my sales. With higher profits, I hope to be able to support my family.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer

Mi nombre es Rosa V. me dedico a la venta de ropa para dama y caballero como ser blusas, camisas, carteras, tenis, tengo mi negocio hace unjos 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos porque mi producto lo vendo en oficinas publicas y privadas, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase blouses, shirts, socks, shoes and wallets.

loans.name: Moses Nji

texts.en:
Born in 1958, Moses Nji is a polygamist married to two wives and is a father of eight children. With a heavy responsibility of having to provide for his wives and his eight children, and given the fact that he is unemployed, he decided to become a member of GHAPE in 1998, where he was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline.

Since then, he has successfully invested and repaid all of his loans with which he raised money to pay school fees for his children, buy a second hand motor bike and buy food for his family.

Given a loan of $1000, he plans to operate a motor bike taxi business. This business is lucrative in this area because it is faster and more convenient on the very poor roads. With this, he can raise money to continue paying his children’s school fees and to provide a capital for his wives.

He plans to pay his loan in 24 months. First loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Purchase a motor bike, documents, fuel

loans.name: Anak Agung Ayu Sudar

texts.id:
With a very simple stall, bamboo walls and woven coconut leaves roof, Agung nicknamed after Anak Agung Ayu Sudaryati started her pig farming business after she got married to I Gusti Putu Tinda . Up to now she is active in the business, since with pig farming, this family of 5 could fulfill daily needs. Her husband's income as a tenant farmer is not sufficient to cover schooling expenses for her 3 children: Agung Ayu Damayanti, Agung Lanang Putra dan Ayu Cempaka Dewi. However wih her additional efforts of pig farming, her children are now in Highschool, Middle school, and Grade school. Before Dinari's loan she only has a capital of Rp300,000 (about US$33) to buy 2 local piglets, that she raised the traditional way, by feeding them banana tree trunk, and talas leaves which grows around her home. With that limited capital she often has to sell her pigs before harvest, because of urgent family needs or to buy food for the family. With additional loan of Rp1,500,000 (about $165), Agung could buy 3 more piglets, and the rest to buy few sacks of wheat and rice shell clippings to feed her animals. Hence the growth would be enhanced, and income would increase to Rp3,000,000 ($330) per 6 months.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan kandang yang sangat sederhana , dinding bambu dan atap daun kelapa yang di anyam. Agung begitu panggilan akrab dari Anak Agung Ayu Sudaryati yang telah memulai usaha beternak babi sejak menikah dengan I Gusti Putu Tinda . Sampai saat ini Agung masih tetap menekuni usaha itu karena dengan beternak babi keluarga yang beranggotakan 5 orang ini dapat memenuhi kebutuhan hidup sehari hari . Hasil suami yang hanya sebagai buruh tani tidak cukup untuk membiayai pendidikan tiga orang anaknya Yakni : Agung Ayu Damayanti, Agung Lanang Putra dan Ayu Cempaka Dewi. Namun berkat ketekunan Agung dalam memelihara babi, kini anak-anaknya telah duduk di bangku sekolah SMA, SMP dan SD .Sebelum mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari, Agung hanya mengandalkan modal Rp 300.000.- untuk membeli 2 ekor bibit babi lokal yang di pelihara secara tradisional yaitu dengan makanan batang pisang dan daun talas yang tumbuh di sekitar rumahnya . Dengan modal yang sangat terbatas itu sering kali Agung harus menjual ternaknya sebelum waktu panen karena kebutuhan keluarga yang mendesak atau tak sanggup membeli pakan. Kini Agung telah mendapatkan tambahan modal dari Dinari sebesar Rp 1.500.000.- Dengan tambahan modal itu Agung mulai membeli bibit baru lagi sebanyak 3 ekor dan sisanya di belikan beberapa sak dedak gandum dan dedak padi untuk pakan ternaknya Pertumbuhan babinya cukup baik dan hasil yang di perolehpun sangat lumayan yaitu Rp. 3.000.000.- / 6 bulannya.

loans.use:
To buy feedstock & pig food

Membeli bibit babi dan pakan

loans.name: Teleasau

texts.en: Teleasau’s family plantation has been the main source of food supply and income for her family for quite some time. With the help of SPBD (the lender), she is now able to make her dream come true, and that is utilizing her plantation as an opportunity for a business to facilitate a more stable supply of food for her family and future generations to come. With this money, she will buy some plantation tools and some more crops. She aims to be selling some crops at the market come Christmas and New Year's holidays, as there will be visitors flooding the town to be with families and friends during the Christmas festivities. She is happy with this help as it has allowed people like herself to access some financial support given the strict criteria set by the banks and financial institutions these days.

loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment for her plantation

loans.name: Mona Seumalu

texts.en: Mona has been doing her canteen business for almost six months. She is 33 years of age, married with 3 children. She was doing sewing as part of her routine life, but she doesn't get enough money from it. What she earned from her canteen is not really enough, so she decided to sell varieties of food at her canteen. She joined SPBD so she would be able to improve her businesses. She is very happy and very thankful for this great opportunity to improve her family living.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her sewing business and her canteen business

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en:
Bakhtiyar S. is 58 years old, married and has five children. He lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. Bakhtiyar sells fruits and vegetables in the Beylagan city bazaar. He started his business ten years ago.

Bakhtiyar applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan of $400 to buy a wider variety of goods to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina R. D. R. lives in Tarapoto, San Martin.  She rents a spot in the major market of Tarapoto where she sells fresh chicken.  She started the business 22 years ago with the help of her husband.  Over the years she has acquired many loyal customers.
Marina is a 58 year old widow and has 1 child.  She has no support so her business is everything for her.  She works hard and has saved carefully to send her child to school.  Now she is building a small disco in her home where her neighbors can come and enjoy a night out.  Marina is very social and popular.
A member of the community bank Nuestra Sra D. La Paz, Marina is requesting a loan of s/3000 to repay over 6 months.  With this loan she would like to buy more chicken to sell at the market.

loans.use: With this loan she would like to buy more chicken to sell at the market.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Mr. Kan S. and his wife, Rum Mol, have been married since 2002. They have three sons. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Kan has been fishing for six years. He fishes in the lake near his village and then sells the fish at Prek Pnao Market. His wife has been selling vegetables for twenty years. She buys them from farmers in the village for resale at Prek Pnao Market.

Mr. Kan is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $700 to purchase a boat motor and fishing net for his fishing business.

loans.use: For purchasing a boat motor and fishing net

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet D. is a 38-year old manufacturer who bakes bread. She is a wife and mother of six children. She bakes and supplies her bread to retail shops and canteen operators. Lots of customers enjoy her bread because of its good quality and taste. Her family is happy because the loan have improved their lives. She will use her next loan to buy more bags of flour and sugar to increase her production and serve additional clients for increased income. Janet belongs to a community group called Eagle Trust group.

loans.use: To buy more flour and sugar to expand production

loans.name: Gloria Martha

texts.es:
Gloria belongs to the Las Brisas Communal Bank, and her business is located at Jr. Coronel Portillo 1049, in Calleria region of Ucayali state. She is 54 years old, mother of 6 children, her husband is a teacher, but their income isn’t enough to meet their family’s needs, so Gloria with her first loan from Manuela Ramos for S/.300 decided to invest it in an Internet café business.

Today she has her Internet café business, for which she gets up at 7 am to prepare breakfast for her children and her husband, and then opens her business so her clients may begin to arrive.

with this loan for S/.700 which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy a modem for her Internet café.

Gloria is very happy and content to work for her family’s benefit as she can unconditionally support her family, and she feels fortunate to be able to count on Manuela Ramos’s support.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Gloria pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Brisas, ubicado en el Jr. Coronel Portillo 1049, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 54 años, es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo es profesor, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no le alcanzan para el sustento familiar, es así que Gloria con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en el negocio de cabinas de Internet.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de cabinas de internet, para ello se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, de alli abre su local para que sus clientes comiencen a llegar.

Con este préstamo de S/. 700 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 1 modem para sus cabinas de Internet.

Gloria esta muy feliz y tranquila de trabajar en beneficio de su familia puesto que ahora puede apoyarlos incondicionalmente, se siente afortunada de contar con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase a modem for her internet cafe

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dương Thị Hảo, joining the TYM Fund in 1996, has 3 school aged children. She has had all kinds of loans from the Fund. The funds from those early loans were used in those activities involving pottering. It did not do very well, she then switched to raising livestock. With this she has better luck and then start to expand her business. Currently her farm includes 500 egg laying ducks and a fish pond with an income of 5,000,000 VND a month. She is applying for a loan of 15,000,000 VND to expand her farm and facility.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1996 trải qua 12 năm vay vốn, chị Dương Thị Hảo đã sử dụng nhiều loại vốn của Quỹ, ở những năm đầu gia đình chị chỉ vay vốn về đầu tư vào dự án thủ công nghệ gốm, nhưng qua 1 chu kỳ dự án gia đình chị nhận thấy rằng với việc đầu tư dự án này là đem lại thu nhập không cao. Bước sang các vòng vốn sau gia đình chị chuyển hướng đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và vịt đẻ chứng, việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị thuận lợi và có thu nhập cao, dần dần mô hình chăn nuôi của gia đình chị đuợc quy mô hơn với hình thức trang trại, gia đình chị đã đầu thầu ruộng để thả cá và nuôi vịt, hiện nay gia đình chị đang có 500 con vịt đẻ, 300. Các con chị 3 chau đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ đầu tư vào trang trại. Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Raising ducks

loans.name: Shyam Kumari

texts.en:
Shyam Kumari T. M. lives in a joint family with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, husband and two sons. Her father-in-law is a retired officer. Her husband works in his own mobile repairing shop. Her sons are studying in grade 7 and 4 respectively. Shyam Kumari  opened her beauty parlor four years ago to help her husband to improve the living standard of her family in SainbuBhaishapati. Before opening her own business she took a year training course from beauty parlor training institute for beauty parlor work. Her service is only for ladies. Now Shyam Kumari is requesting a loan of $450 to buy various types of cosmetics goods for her shop.

Shyam Kumari wants to save her income to provide a good education for her sons because the cost of education is very high in Nepal.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic goods

loans.name: Thi My

texts.vi:
Mrs L. Thi My, 48 years old, is a caretaker in a kindergarten. Her monthly salary is 2,000,000VND (about 133USD), thus her family's finance is quite stabL.. Before joining the TYM Fund, her children were still going to school, so the family's expenditure relied mainly on her salary and that of her husband. In 2004, she joined the TYM Fund to invest in raising livestock to increase her family's income. With this, she was abL. to send her children to university and her family's financial situation improved. Now, her children are already graduated and have stabL. jobs, but she wants to continue raising livestock in a larger scaL. so she would like to borrow 9,000,000VND (550USD) this time. Her average monthly income is 6,000,000VND (about 400USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chi Lê Thi Mỵ 48 tuôi hiện chị đang là giáo viên mần non lương tháng 2.000.000đ kinh tế gia đình ổn định. Những năm về trước các con chị đang trong độ tuổi ăn học nên việc chi tiêu trong gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào đồng lương của 2 vợ chồng chị. Năm 2004 chị đã tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Với việc kết hợp chăn nuôi nên chị đã có điều kiện về kinh tế để đầu tư cho các con chị học đại học. Hiện nay các con chị đã ra trường và có công ăn việc làm ổn định, nguyện vọng của gia đình chị đầu tư chăn nuôi lớn hơn nên vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ. Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising livestock

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 26 years old and she is single. She has been running her own shop since 2003. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Fatma is now looking for a loan to buy more commodities for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for the expansion of her business

loans.name: Srun

texts.en:
Srun S., 27 years old, is married and lives with her two young children and her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 2007, she has had a battery recharging business that earns her a living of about US$2 per day. 

People live in the countryside and mostly depend on the battery to power their lighting. Her husband is a construction foreman and makes US$2 per day. Srun S. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to purchase more construction tools for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase more construction tools for her husband's business.

loans.name: Danaya (La Confiance) Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre (4) femmes du groupe Danaya (toutes mariées) avec une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans et 02 enfants vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies à Médine un des quartiers de la ville Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens d’amitié et de voisinage.  Leurs principales activités sont entre autres l’achat et la vente des pommes de terre, des pagnes wax et fancy(imprimés sur place au Mali par la Comatex) et la restauration.
Ce groupe travaille avec l’institution Soro Yiriwaso depuis  maintenant 4 et est à son sixième prêt solidaire. Elles comptent utiltiser ce prêt pour acheter, 10 sacs de pomme de terre, 34 pièces de pagnes, 2 sacs de riz et 2 bidons d’huile d’arachide. Elles s’approvisionnent (en matières premières pour la restauration)  au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso. Quant aux pagnes elles s’y ravitaillent sur commande auprès de grossistes de Bamako(capitale de la republique du Mali).
Les ventes sont effectués au marché, à domicile et de façon ambulante en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée généralement des femmes et des jeunes gens.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Danaya are all married and average 49 years of age and two children. They live in traditional extended familes in Médine, one of the districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of friendship and community. Their principal work includes catering and commerce in potatoes and 'wax' and 'fancy' grades of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) that are printed locally in Mali by Comatex.

For four years now, this group has been working with the institution Soro Yiriwaso and is on its sixth solidarity loan. The group intends to utilize this loan to buy: 10 sacks of potatoes, 34 lengths of pagnes, 2 sacks of rice, and 2 drums of peanut oil.

The members of the group get their supplies (of raw ingredients for catering) at the grand marketplace in the city of Sikasso. As for the pagnes, they are restocked by custom order from the wholesalers of Bamako (capital of Mali).

The sales are made at the marketplace, out of homes, and door-to-door at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed generally of women and youngsters.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
