loans.use: To buy different goods:  pagnes, rice peanut oil, and potatoes

loans.name: Janina Irma

texts.es:
Janina forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras de Nicrupampa”, del distrito de Independencia, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 33 años de edad y es madre soltera de una niña. Comenta que aún cuando ha tenido que trabajar desde muy joven para apoyar a sus padres, considera haber tenido éxito en su vida personal, debido a que ha logrado establecer una librería en el pasaje Las Dalias Mz.20 Lt.08 en Nicrupampa. Gracias a la ayuda de un tío que la apoyó para establecer este negocio y que poco a poco ha diversificado con la venta de útiles, también de juguetes y de productos de belleza. Estos productos los trae desde la ciudad de Lima y le llegan a pedido.
 
Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará útiles complementarios como lapiceros, plumones y cajas de colores.
 
A Janina le es importante seguir creciendo económicamente.
texts.en:
Janina is 33-years-old and a single mother with one daughter. She tells us that although she has had to work very hard since she was very young to support her parents, she considers herself successful because she has established a bookshop in Nicrupampa, thanks to the help of an uncle who supported her while she was starting her business. She has gradually diversified her business to include school supplies, games, and beauty products. She brings these products in from Lima. With this loan of $325, which she will repay in four installments, she will purchase items such as mechanical pencils, felt tipped pens, and boxes of crayons. It is very important to Janina and her daughter to continue to improve her financial position.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Molloy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase items such as mechanical pencils, felt tipped pens, and boxes of crayons

loans.name: Hasadia

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania and SELFINA!  This is 47 year old Hasadia J S.. She is married woman with five children between the ages of 14 and 26. She has owned a vitenge and tailoring business since 2007.

Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile - the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people. Women use these colorful and boldly printed fabrics to make traditional Tanzania outfits which usually consist of long fitted skirts and conservative boat necked tops.  As such, Hasadia is a smart entrepreneur and does not simply sell vitenge, but also offers her services as a seamstress.  Thus, customers can select the cloth and the style of outfit they would like as well as have their measurements taken. It’s really a one stop shop for women!

Currently her business is able to generate a monthly profit of about USD200 and she is requestring a loan in order to  purchase additional vitenge. In future she hopes to further increase the quantity and range of the stock. She thanks you for your support in advance!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional vitenge (printed fabric).

loans.name: Farzana M. Ramzan Group

texts.en:
'My name is Farzana and I’m 29 years old. I was born in a mid-size city called Arifwala, Pakistan. I am married to a man whose name is M. R., and he is a mason by trade. He knows that he can only get income from this business when someone calls him to help construct a building. So he does another job which is driving a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) to help his family survive. I am the mother of two girls who are not yet of school-going age. I prepare embroidered dresses on order and use the earnings to invest in a 'committee'. I’m planning to use the collective amount, when it is my turn to receive it, to pay all the education expenses of my daughters. I am applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for my husband so that he will be able to earn more income and get the real reward of his struggle.' Farzana is the group leader for several more women from her locality. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy biscuits and chips to re-sell. Ruqaiya baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture-making business. Kosar baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
La señora Nimia es socia del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Blanca”, Santa Rosa,  centro poblado de Chijichaya, distrito de Ilave, Provincia Del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 01 hijos a su cargo y posee estudios de secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 06 meses, su negocio es la elaboración de tunta (chuño blanco) y compra y venta de quinua; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir papas para procesar en chuño blanco. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 900.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 03 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir productos de la zona (papa, chuño blanco, quinua, etc.) para verlos en Arequipa, asimismo desea comprarse un par de animales menores (chanchos) para engordalos y venderlo en la época de carnavales; con las ganancias ella desea ahorrar y juntar capital a fin de ampliar su negocio; asimismo se preocupa por la educación y sustento de su hijo.
texts.en:
Nimia is a member of the community bank “Ciudad Blanca” in the Collao province of Puno. She is 25 years old, married with one child and has completed her secondary education.

She has worked with Manueal Ramos (a Kiva partner) for 6 months. Nimia makes tunta (a product derived from dried white potatoes) and buys and sells quinoa. Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian Soles, which she used to buy potatoes to make the dried potato product.

With this new loan of 900 Peruvian Soles, which she hopes to repay in 3 monthly installments, she will buy local products (potatoes and dried potatoes, quinoa, etc.) to sell in Arequipa. She would also like to buy some small animals (pigs) to fatten them up and sell them during the carnival season.

With these earnings, she would like to save up to grow her business as well as take care of the education and support of her son.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy local products like potatoes and quinoa and to purchase pigs

loans.name: Arelis

texts.es:
En el municipio El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega, Arelis R. con gran esfuerzo se dedica a su actividad de agricultura ya que al ser padre de familia y responsable en el mantenimiento de su hogar debe proporcionar las condiciones necesarias para su familia.

La razón por la que el señor Arelis ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para la compra de insumos como lo son los herbicidas para la siembra de maíz y frijoles. Es por este motivo que espera muy confiadamente en que Ceprodel le otorgará el crédito y así saldrá adelante en su actividad.
texts.en:
In the municipality of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega, Arelis R. works hard in agriculture. As he is the father of a family and responsible for the maintenance of his home he must provide the necessities for his family. The reason that Arelis has pursued Ceprodel's help is to purchase materials such as herbicides to plant corn and beans. It is for this reason that he confidently hopes that Ceprodel will grant him the loan and in this way he will get ahead in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural materials

loans.name: Mujeres Comprometidas (Committed Women) Group

texts.es:
El comité se había formado mediante otro comité de la misma Zona a la cual pertenece este, (San Antonio). Todas son vecinas del Asentamiento San Roque; Todas poseen actividades individuales y productivas. Poseen buen relacionamiento entre todas.  

Ramona López Santander	Vta de Pollos
María Estela S.	Vta Lencería
Elsa Romelia A.	Vta Comestibles
Mónica E. E.	Vta Carbón
Juana I.	Mercería
Francisca O.	Vta de Bebidas
Marcelina Florentín	Vta de Golosinas
Filipina G.	Comerciante
Carolina O.	Empleada
Coinda C.	Costurera
María S.	Repostera
Romina S.	Vta de Maní
Lucila Brítez	Vta de Bebidas
Juana Pabla Díaz	Vta de Maní
Blanca F.	Vta de Carteras
Lidia R.	Copetín
María E.	Vta  de Frutas
Cynthia Benítez	Vta de Ajos
Silvia E.	Merceria
texts.en:
This group was formed through a different group from the same area (San Antonio). The group is made up of neighbors from the San Roque Settlement; They all work in different and productive jobs and have good relationships with each other. Ramona López Santander sells chicken. María Estela S. sells lingerie. Elsa Romelia A. sells groceries. Mónica E. E. sells coal. Juana I. has a general store Francisca O. sells drinks. Marcelina Florentín sells candies and sweets. Filipina G. is a vendor. Carolina O. is an employee. Coinda C. is a tailor. María S. is a pastry chef. Romina S. sells peanuts. Lucila Brítez sells drinks. Juana Pabla Díaz sells peanuts. Blanca F. sells wallets. Lidia R. sells drinks. María E. sells fruit. Cynthia Benítez sells garlic. Silvia E. has a general store.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various products that the women use or sell

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith O. is a tailor and she also sells sarongs. She is 36 years old and married without any children. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Chhoy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhoy K., 64, and her husband, Mr. Sroing Sang, 67, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1964 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Their three sons are married and live outside the family home. One daughter weaves at home and the other two are garment factory workers.

Chhoy and her husband are farmers. They grow bananas and cucumbers. The couple is in the process of building a new house, but they lack some money to finish it.

Chhoy is requesting a loan of US$800 to finish the house and to purchase silk materials for her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.use: To finish her house and to purchase silk materials for her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La señora Roxana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas” ubicado  del  distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; ella tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos.  tiene estudios superiores (profesora de educación primaria).

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años,  inicio su trabajo con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con dicho dinero compró telas para la confección de ropa de deportes (buzos).

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos soles, comprará materia prima (telas) y poder confeccionar ropa de deportes Buzos, polos  y gorros.
Su sueño es poder poner un taller de confección para distribuir al por mayor en todos los mercados de la región.
 
A ella le gustan  las facilidades con las cuales se les da el préstamo, también le gustan las reuniones de su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Roxana belongs to the Village Bank “Micaela Bastidas” located in the Ilave District, El Collao Province, Puno Department. She is 38 years old, of cohabitant marital status, and is a single mother with 2 children. She has studied higher education (primary education teacher).

She has worked the Manuela Ramos movement for 2 years, she began her work with an initial loan of 300.00 New Soles, with which she bought cloth for sport clothing (diving).

With this loan of 1,000.00 New Soles, she will buy raw materials (cloth) to manufacture sport clothing for divers, polos and hats. Her dream is to have a workshop to distribute to wholesalers in all markets in the region.

She likes the facilities with which they give loans, and she also likes the Village Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw material for the manufacture of diving and polo sport clothing.

loans.name: Thierno

texts.fr: thierno T. est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis 2007.il habite dans le quartier de yoff mbenguenne.il evolue dans le domaine du commerce et mene une activite orientee vers la vente de vaisselle et d'ustensiles de cuisine divers.ce credit de 250 000 lui permettra d'augmenter son fond de roulement pour renforcer le stock de son magasin.
texts.en:
Thierno T. has been a member of the Yoff credit union since 2007. He lives in the Yoff Mbenguenne neighborhood. He is a budding entrepreneur and has a business oriented towards selling dishes and various kitchen utensils. This loan of 250,000 will allow him to increase his working capital to bolster the inventory of his little store.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to his inventory

loans.name: Udor

texts.en: T. sells cooking oil. She is requesting a loan of N140,000 to purchase more drums of oil to sell. She promises to pay back the loan in eight equal installments. T. is 43 years old, has three children and is a widow. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drums of oil to sell

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Thủy Nguyễn Thị (1816071350) is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has 2 young children. To make a living, Thủy owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing repair services to local community members. Thủy has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,200,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, Thủy joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thủy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide the service. Thủy is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Thủy plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Elvia Maria

texts.es:
La señora Elvia es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas, un grupo grande de mujeres que se reúne cada dos semanas en la oficina de Espoir en Jipijapa, una pequeña ciudad en la costa ecuatoriana. Ella tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, de los cuales uno es mayor de edad y tres son menores todavía. Ella trabaja como vendedora en la farmacia de su hermana, un trabajo que viene realizando desde hace 5 años. Antes, trabajaba cosiendo con una señora. 
La señora está pidiendo un préstamo para invertir en el negocio de su esposo, que es de venta de artículos del hogar, principalmente plásticos y loza como vasos, vajillas, etc. Él vende a crédito y también al contado, entrega sus productos a domicilio, y viaja a Puerto Lopez y otros lugares para vender sus productos. Comprará un poco de todo con este préstamo para tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer a sus clientes. Como ya lleva 10 años con este negocio, tiene su clientela fija y la gente ya le conoce. 
Elvia dice que su meta para el futuro es agrandar el negocio de su esposo y poner un local para vender los productos.
texts.en:
Elvia is a member of the Mujeres Unidas Village Bank, a large group of women who meet every two weeks in the office of Espoir en Jipijapa, a small city on the Ecuadorian coast. She is a 40-year-old married mother of four children, of whom one is grown and three who are still young. For the past five years she has worked as a salesperson at her sister’s pharmacy. Before this she worked sewing with another woman.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her husband’s business selling housewares such as plastics, cups of china, dishes, etc. He sells these items on credit and also for cash, gets his products delivered to his house, and travels to Puerto Lopez and other places to sell them. He will buy a little bit of everything with this loan in order to have an assortment of merchandise to offer his customers. Since he’s worked for 10 years on this business he has a fixed clientele and people know him. Elvia says that her goal for the future is to expand her husband’s business and install a building to sell the products.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise, including plastics, cups, dishes, etc.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is thirty-one years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two children: a son and a daughter. Both of her children are still in school. As a single parent, she says she works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central Region of Ghana.

Dorcas is a trader. She trades in vegetables such as onions, tomatoes, and other food items. She buys her goods from Kumasi and sells on a table at the market square. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk to expand her business

loans.name: Neli

texts.es: La señora Neli, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajando II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 56 años y 06 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza, muy a parte en sus ratos libres, también se dedica a la confección de tejidos, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes que ya saben de la actividad que realiza.Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Neli, se siente con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando y muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Señora Neli belongs to the “Working Women II” communal bank in the District of Tarapoto, San Martin Province, in the Department of San Martin. She is married, is 56 years old and has 6 children, all of them already independent. Her character and her yearning to carry out her dreams motivated her to launch her own business, to sell groceries with whose profit would contribute to her household income.

From the date of her beginning, she has gained customers. Nowadays, she has regular customers who come to buy from her grocery store daily because her shop has all the products a housekeeper needs and she serves with the personal charisma that characterizes her. She also devotes much of her free time to the making of woven goods; she works with the requests of her customers that already know of her activity.

With this loan of $275, she will buy rice and sugar in sacks; cookies, pasta and salt in packets, milk, boxes of canned fish in a variety of brands, eggs, and articles of personal hygiene in order to continue giving the best service to her customers.

Neli strongly desires to continue working and is very grateful for the Manuela Ramus Movement that helps women like her to have opportunities for self-development in the areas where they operate.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick Clarke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy groceries to increase her stock

loans.name: Shirley Esperanza

texts.es:
La socia se llama Shirley, pertenece al banco comunal, líderes del tercer milenio, nuestro socio es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 33 años de edad, la socia tiene 1 hijo y es madre soltera, ella alterna sus diferentes actividades con el comercio minorista, ella vende carteras sombreros con esta dinero y a mucho esfuerzo nuestra socia saca adelante a sus hijo y es padre y madre para el, la socia también logró tener un  carro y lo puso a trabajar como servicio de taxi, nuestra socia es una mujer muy luchadora y sumamente trabajadora, por lo que cada idea de negocio que ella pone en su mente le es fructífera. La socia desea el préstamo para reinvertir y comprar mercadería y para uso personal.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado comprometiéndose a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado en el contrato.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Pich H., 59, has a business selling banana ice-cream. Living in Takeo, he is able to make US$21 in revenue each day. His wife, Keo ChH., 59, is a rice farmer and also raising pigs. On average, she makes US$1 each day. This couple has five children; four of them are in school. Pich H. is requesting a loan of US$1000 purchasing pigs and the feed for them.

loans.use: Raise pigs.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora T. is from the village of  Santiago, Iligan  City. She is 25 years old. Nora is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Nora owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling scrap metal & other used-products in the local community. Nora has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Nora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Gladys Suzana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal  Damas responsables está conformado por un grupo de mujeres  capaces y luchadoras que tienen como prioridad sacar adelante a su familia a  pesar de los obstáculos que día a día deben surfear, además han formado un excelente ambiente y equipo de trabajo velando siempre el bienestar de todas sus integrantes, este banco está ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca al sur del país en la región sierra centro.

Gladys Pérez es socia del banco comunal Damas Responsable, vive en Visorey en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 39 años de edad  felizmente casada fruto de su unión matrimonial  concibió dos hijos de 14 y 12 años respectivamente que en la actualidad estudian en el Colegio Técnico Chiquintad; su esposo tiene como profesión tapicero y con el trabajo de los dos lograron construir su casa propia.

 Gladys  y su esposo tienen un local de tapicería propio, nuestra socia trabaja junto a su esposo trabaja desde hace diez años y demás distribuye su tiempo entre la tapicería los quehaceres del hogar, su horario de atención es de 7 a.m. a 9 p.m. de lunes  a sábado hasta el medio día.

Gladys lleva cinco años trabajando en su banco comunal y los créditos obtenidos le han permitido ir comprando las herramientas para su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue  va a comprar materia prima como esponja, tornillos, cuerina, hilos,  telas, etc. para incrementar su taller y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es ayudar a sus hijos para que puedan culminar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
The Responsible Ladies Communal Bank is comprised of a group of capable and strong-willed women who make supporting their families a high priority. Despite the obstacles that surface on a daily basis, they have been able to form an excellent working team that looks out for the welfare of its members. The Communal Bank is located in the city of Cuenca, which lies in a mountainous region of southern Ecuador.

Gladys Pérez is a member of the Responsible Ladies Communal Bank. She lives in the neighborhood of Visorey in central Cuenca. Gladys is 39 years old and happily married. Her two children, ages 14 and 12 respectively, are currently students at Chiquintad Technical High School. Her husband is an upholsterer by profession and the couple’s hard work has enabled them to build their own home.

Gladys and her husband have operated a local upholstery shop for the past 10 years. She divides her time between managing the shop and performing her household chores. Their business is open from 7am to 9pm, Monday through Saturday.

For five years, Gladys has been a member of her Communal Bank. The loans she has obtained have enabled her to purchase tools for her business. With this new loan from Fundación ESPOIR, she will buy materials such as sponges, screws, synthetic leather, thread, and fabrics so that she can grow her business and provide better service to her customers. Her greatest dream is to help her children with the completion of their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & supplies for her upholstery business

loans.name: Jenith

texts.en:
Jenith P. is from the village of Bolinsong Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Jenith is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jenith owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Jenith has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jenith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Jenith is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and to pay for the daily needs of the family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita O. is from the town of Rizaluna Cordon. She is 37 years old. Emerita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Emerita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community.

In 2009, Emerita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emerita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Emerita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean P. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 38 years old. Jean is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Jean owns & operates a business selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Jean is just starting this business.

In 2009, Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jean is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jean from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Afua is a 39-year-old married mother of five children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a predominately commercial community. Afua works hard to support her husband in providing for the family. 

Afua is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey (fermented corn and cassava dough, wrapped in corn or banana leaves) with fried fish. Afua sells by the roadside in her community. She procures bags of maize and other ingredients from nearby communities. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure maize in bulk.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: G.s Jehova Es Mi Fortaleza Group

texts.es: El grupo Solidario Jehová Es Mi Fortaleza está conformado por Thelma y Josefa ambas se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas. Thelma se dedica a la una pulpería, hace mas de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que ella es una persona muy alegre a pesar de tener 63 años de edad, la experiencia que su trabajo le ha enseñado ha sido la mejor pues es así que ha logrado darse cuenta lo que sus clientes solicitan el financiamiento es para la compra de capital de trabajo como golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan galletas entre otros productos y junto con su amiga deciden realizar estos financiamiento que son de gran ayuda. Josefa se dedica a la venta de tortillas hace mas de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es una mujer muy trabajadora. Ellas sueñan mantener este negocio, por lo que es muy importante para las dos.
texts.en:
The group Jehová Es Mi Fortaleza (Jehova is My Strength) is made up of Thelma and Josefa, who have different businesses. Thelma has had a general store for over 9 years, which is why she is so happy despite being 63 years old. The best experience that her work has provided her is that she has realized what her customers want. The loan is to purchase inventory such as candy, juices, crackers and other products. Together, she and her friend have decided to take out this loan, which is very helpful. Josefa has been selling tortillas for over 9 years. She is a very hard working woman. They dream of continuing their business, which is very important to them both.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: inventory

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle A. is from the city of Tagoloan in Misamis Oriental. She is 25 years old. Michelle is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Michelle sells personal products, such as cosmetics, in the local community. Michelle has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Michelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. Michelle is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Michelle's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Mr. T. Van, 33 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Sony Chan, 28 years old, were married in 2005 and just have a young daughter. Besides his daughter, he also has his mother living with him. The family lives in a small village on National Road Number Two about 20 km south of Phnom Penh City. T. is not in the photo; his wife, who is a garment factory worker, was available instead. 

T. has just started a business selling Cha Khvai cakes three months ago (Cha Khvai is a kind of cake made of flour that swells up when fried). He cooks Cha Khvai at his house and distributes it to sell in Takhmao market, approximately 8 kilometers from his home.  
T. hopes to expand his business so he is able to earn extra income as well. Therefore, he is asking for a loan to help his capital.

loans.use: To expand his business.

loans.name: Sara Amparo

texts.es:
La señora Sara Amparo M. se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas en el Mercado Mayoreo donde desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana inicia sus ventas de las frutas ofreciéndolas a todos los clientes que visitan el mercado.
Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de las frutas como el tamarindo y otras frutas para surtir sus canastos y de esa manera continuar vendiendo en su localidad para obtener los ingresos para llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Sara Amparo sells vegetables and fruits in the Mayoreo Market. She starts selling very early in the morning. She sells her fruits to all of the customers who visit the market. She is currently requesting a loan to invest in buying fruits like tamarinds and other fruits to stock her baskets. This way she will continue selling in her location and get income in order to support her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando es un padre de familia de 44 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el caserío Laguna Chica, una zona rural del distrito de Olmos, en la provincia Lambayeque, ubicado a dos horas y quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta informal de gasolina, el posee galones de gasolina en su vivenda y los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos que los necesitan para alimentar los motores con los que extraen agua de pozos para irrigar sus cultivos, este negocio es una fuente importante de ingreso económico para su familia, ya que su actividad principal es la agricultura pero esta no le provee de ingresos económicos permanentes.

El negocio goza de mucha acogida ya que los caseríos del distrito de Olmos quedan alejados entre si y alejados de la ciudad, por lo que no tienen acceso facil a un grifo que les brinde el combustible que necesitan. Armando se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la ampliación de negocio con la compra de más gasolina.

Su sueño es poder ampliar su negocio para poder abastacer a la zona en donde vive y a los caseríos cercanos. El es un padre responsable y honrado. En su comunidad es muy respetado, actualmente tiene el cargo de Teniente Gobernador de lugar, un cargo representativo ante las autoridades del distrito. Por otro lado el ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Armando is a 44 year old father who lives with his wife and three children in the village of Laguna Chica, a rural area in the District of Olmos, Lambayeque Province. This community is located two hours and fifteen minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Armando has been selling gasoline informally for several years. He stores gallons of gasoline at his home and offers it for sale to his neighbors who need to refuel their motors used for drawing well water to irrigate their crops. This business is an important source of income for his family. His main business activity is farming, but it does not provide a steady source of income.

This business has been well-received in the villages of the District of Olmos that are located far from the city and do not have easy access to tap water. He provides the fuel that is needed. Armando is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN to invest in the expansion of his business by purchasing more gasoline.

His dream is to increase his business buy supplying the area where he lives and the nearby villages. Armando is a responsible and honest father. He is well-respected in his community because he currently serves as the local Lieutenant Governor, a position that reports to the district authorities. Armando has worked previously worked our Institution and has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality when completing his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gasoline

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 55 años, casada y madre D. 2 hijos; y juntos viven en su casa propia. DesD. hace 6 años, venD. jugos en un puesto D. ventas que posee, y del que se encuentra ubicado en un pequeño mercado cerca D. su casa, esa comodidad con que cuenta le permite  trabajar con toda tranquilidad y distribuir su tiempo en las diversas tareas que tiene en su hogar.  Una D. sus hijas la ayuda en la atención hacia sus clientes, preparando los jugos que le piden, este negocio le es muy rentable, por ser un servicio que tiene mucha demanda, es por ello que mas adelante, desea renovar sus artefactos, herramientas que le facilitaran en la preparación D. sus jugos. Este es su treceavo crédito con MFP y asegura ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que le será  muy útil este aporte para el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. frutas para poder preparar más jugos, asimismo desea comprar materiales D. construcción para mejorar la infraestructura D. su casa y poder adecuar un espacio para su despensa.
texts.en:
Lucia is 55 years old. She is married, has two children, and [the family members] live in their own home. She's been selling juices from a stall for the past six years. The stall is located in a small market near her home. This allows her to work in a relaxed manner and spread her time across various activities in her home. One of her daughters helps her attend to customers by preparing the juices that they request. This is a very profitable business, as the services are in great demand. This is why, in the future, she wants to refresh the tools of her traD., tools that allow her to prepare her juices. This will be her third loan through MFP and she promises to be on time with her payments. She also feels that this contribution will be very useful to her business. She will use the money from this loan to invest in fruit to be able to make more juice. She also wants to buy building materials to make improvements to her home which will allow her to set asiD. some space for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials and supplies

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Having six children is not easy, Delia H. says, and she doesn’t know anymore how will she budget their small income. Her husband works as a farmer and she is helping her husband maintain the rice field.

Delia is currently preparing her farm for planting and that is why she needs all the help to be able improve their harvest. She would like to obtain a loan of Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina tiene 5 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, pues con mucho esfuerzo ha salido adelante, pues también la buena administración de su negocio es muy importante. Hace más de 32 años que se dedica a este negocio pues siempre se ha dedicado a obtener ingresos para su familia. Ella es muy tranquila con sus clientes y sus clientes asisten a su negocio porque Justina es muy cariñosa. Su deseo es invertir en una gran variedad de productos y convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora. El financiamiento es para la compra de productos.
texts.en:
Justina has five children all of whom are employed independently. She has a grocery store that has succeeded thanks to the great effort she puts into it and the good management she gives it. She has been in this business for over 32 years; she has always worked toward earning family income. She is very calm with her customers and they come to her store because she is so affectionate. Her wish is to invest in a large variety of products and turn her grocery store into a distributorship. She will use the funds to buy stock merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
La Sra. María Remache forma parte hace 2 ciclos del banco comunal Santa Ana, siendo invitada por su vecina Laura a formar parte del grupo, vive en la parroquia Santa Ana, la gente en esta parroquia se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, muchos de su habitantes sale a la ciudad para realizar varias actividades, su iglesia es el principal centro turístico de la parroquia.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido 3 hijos de 14, 12, 11 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos cursan el colegio y su último hijo la escuela, su esposo es empleado privado, con el sacrifico conyugal han logrado comprar su casa pero desean hacer unos arreglos.

Doña María se dedica a realizar manualidades para todo compromiso social, actividad que la realiza hace 14 años sin tener un horario fijo de trabajo ya que es su propio jefe, y su crédito lo va a invertir para comprar tarjetas, peluches y mas productos de bisutería, su meta es de llegar a tener un negocio mas grande y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Remache has been part of the Santa Ana community bank for two cycles, having been invited by her neighbor Laura to be part of the group. She lives in the parish of Santa Ana; the people in this parish work in agriculture and in the raising of livestock. Many of the residents leave for the city to do various jobs. The church is the principal tourist center of the parish. María is 34 years old and married; she has three children, aged 14, 12, and 11. The eldest two children are in high school, and the youngest is in primary school. Her husband is privately employed, and with hard sacrifice they have been able to purchase a home, but they hope to do some renovations. Mrs. María creates handicrafts for all types of special events; she has been doing this work for 14 years without having a fixed work schedule, as she is her own boss. She will invest her loan in the purchase of cards, plush toys, and more jewelry products. Her goal is to expand her enterprise and to do some home improvement projects.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cards, gifts, plush toys, earrings, and bracelets

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario S. is from the village of Biniray, Katipunan, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is a 29-year-old married woman with three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosario owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosario has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Rosario joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosario is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory for her sari-sari (general) store. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosario from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita E. is from the village of Malibago, Dapitan City. She is 53 years old. Anita is married. Anita owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Anita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2007, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500 PHP from PMPC. Anita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Anita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De Peligro 6 Group

texts.en:
Susana is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Unidas de Peligro 6 (United Dangerous Women). She began with Kiva partner, Esperanza, because she needed to for her business. She now loves the program and her loan partners. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity. Susana makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and one child.
Susana is excited to be taking her ninth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has run her business for almost seven years, and started out by selling small amounts of fruits from a bag as she walked along the street. She plans to use this loan to invest in her fruit stand by buying papaya, watermelon, mangoes, salad and other items such as cosmetics and clothes. She will use the profits to buy a television and school supplies. Susana wants to improve her business so that she can save to build her house. She says that her most difficult challenge is to build her house. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying being with her family.

loans.use: To buy papaya, avocado, watermelon, cucumber, fabrics and cosmetics

loans.name: Claudia Gabriela

texts.es: La Señora Gabriela  se dedica al servicio D. fotocopias desD. hace mas D. un año durante este periodo la señora indica que le fue bien en el negocio pero uno D. los costos mas elevados que tiene es el pago del alquiler del ambiente por esta razón  solicita  crédito para poder pagar un anticrético y desD. modo tener menos gastos, tiene una niña D. cinco años,  su esposo se encuentra en España quien regularmente le envía dinero para sus gastos, la señora anteriormente estuvo en España pero volvió por el tema D. salud D. su madre y decidió quedarse en el País pese a dejar un buen trabajo allá en España, pero no se arrepiente ya que su familia y la salud D. su Madre son  lo primero.
texts.en:
Gabriela has maD. a living providing photocopier services for more than year, during which time she says the business has gone well. However, one of her biggest expenses is paying to rent out her workspace, so she is requesting the loan so she can pay for the rental property and in this way have fewer expenses. She has a 5-year-old daughter, and her husband is working in Spain and regularly sends money to help her cover expenses. Gabriela previously was in Spain, but she returned because of her mother's health and decided to stay despite leaving a good job behind in Spain. But she has no regrets because her family and her mother's health are her first priority.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her rental space

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
Yovana es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo pequeño de 1 año, de profesión trabajadora social, Yovana junto a su esposo que es Ingeniero Civil de profesión tienen un empresa de proyectos y capacitación, servicios que brindar a diferentes instituciones.
Yovana es socia del Banco Comunal Delfín y necesita un préstamo de 900 soles para realizar parte de pago de una impresora.
Los sueños de Yovana son que su familia se realice, su hijo tenga una buena formación y su empresa sea reconocida a nivel regional.
texts.en:
Yovana is in a common-law marriage with a one year old child and works as a social worker. Along with her husband who is a civil engineer, she has a company that provides project management and training to various institutions. Yovana is a partner in the Delfin community bank and needs a loan of 900 soles to help pay for a printer. Yovana's dreams are to see her family thrive, her son properly educated, and her company regionally recognized.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Partial payment for a printer

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda S. lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood, in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (relatives).

Sauda has a business of a  hair salon. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Sauda sells her products from home, by means of retail. Sauda has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cosmetic, cream hair relaxers and braids. The main business challenge(s) for Sauda include seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to expand her current business and to own a bridal salon. Sauda lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cosmetics, cream hair relaxers and braids.

loans.name: Debbie

texts.en:
Debbie Y., age 51, is from the village of Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga. She and her husband have two adult-aged children. To make a living, Debbie owns and operates a grocery store, where she sells household items such as canned goods and other daily basic needs in the local community. Debbie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Debbie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Debbie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Debbie is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used toward the expansion of the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Debbie from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the expansion of the store

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Djiguisseme ont une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 4  enfants. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage et  mènent différentes activités : vente de tissus et de bijoux. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Chien Kamakan   dans l’ex-arrondissement de Yangasso  préfecture  de SAN (Région de Ségou, République du Mali). 
Les femmes du groupe sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, le groupe a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année. Il est à son premier prêt. 
NANA T., compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  3 pièces de pagnes wax et une douzaine de boucles d’oreille au marché de Bla en vu de  les revendre à la foire hebdomadaire du village et environs. 
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel  de 17.500 FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
Les autres membres comptent sur un bénéfice de 7000 FCFA par mois  somme qui leur permettra de rembourser le prêt et de subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
The ten women of the Djiguisseme group are, on average, 29 years old, married and the mothers of at least 4 children.  They know one another through parental and neighborly ties and run different businesses: the sale of cloth and jewelry.  They live in large traditional families in the outer-neighborhood of the Yangasso prefecture of SAN (in the Ségou region of the Republic of Mali).  The women of the group are very sought-after in their business.  With the goal of satisfying the growing needs of their customer base, the group has decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program this year.  They are on their first loan.

Nane T. expects to use her first loan to buy three pieces of wax loincloths and a dozen pairs of earrings at the Bla market, with the goal of reselling them at the weekly fair of her village and the surrounding areas.  She hopes to make a monthly profit of 17,500 FCFA which will allow her to pay back her loan and to reinvest in her business.  The other members of the group expect a profit of 7000 FCFA per month which will permit them to repay the loan and to support their families' needs.

loans.use: To buy various items

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna has been a hardworking farmer for the past 20 years.  She has specialized in cattle breeding and growing vegetables. Susanna is from the village of Marmashen in the Shirak region of Armenia.  Susanna enjoys living in her birthplace of Marmashen, which has a spectacular tenth-century monastery complex from the Pahlavuni Dynasty. She is married with three children – two sons (25 and 30 years old) and a daughter (31 years old).  She dreams of finishing the construction and remodeling of the family home.  Susanna is looking for a loan to purchase additional livestock.  She expects her family income to increase by 25 percent with this investment.  Susanna is pleased with microfinance services and the opportunity they allow for her 
to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Ninfa Seferina

texts.es:
Ninfa es socia del  Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años de edad, de estado civil viuda, con dos hijos y grado de instrucción de secundaria incompleta.
Ninfa realiza venta de ropas lo cual es llevado desde Tacna hasta la ciudad de Cusco. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace seis años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/.300. 00 nuevos soles, el cual le permitió incrementar la mercadería de su negocio.
La señora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar la mercadería de su negocio. 
Su sueño  es seguir adelante con su negocio y tener una tienda de abarrotes.
Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal  son las charlas.
texts.en:
Ninfa is a member of the Micaela Bastidas Communal Bank.  It is in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department.  She is 44 year old widow, and she has two children.  She went to high school, but she did not finish.

Ninfa sells clothes that she gets in Tacna and takes to the city of Cusco.  She has been working with the Movimineto Manuela Ramos for six years.  The first loan that she requested was for 300 soles.  This allowed her to increase the merchandise in her business.

She is requesting a new loan for 2,000 soles.  The loan will allow her to increase the merchandise in her business.

Her dream is to get ahead with her business and to have a grocery store.

What she likes best about her communal bank are the talks.

loans.use: Increase the merchandise in her business

loans.name: Hilda María

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 39 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres en el distrito de Pacasmayo, una zona comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia del mismo nombre, en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en un ambiente del domicilio donde reside, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes productos de consumo diario brindándoles un buen trato, por este motivo en el corto tiempo que tiene en el negocio (un año) se ha hecho conocida y cuenta con una clientela fiel.

Ella desea adquirir más productos para poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y aumentar sus ventas, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
 
Hilda es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Ella se esfuerza a diario en su negocio y las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Hilda is 39 years old.  She is single and lives together with her parents in Pacasmayo district which is a commercial district located in the province of Pacasmayo, in La Libertad region, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Hilda sells convenience store items and groceries in a small grocery store located in her home.  There she offers her customers products for daily consumption, providing them with good service.  For this reason, in the short time which she has had her business (one year) she has become well known and has a loyal customer base.

She would like to acquire more products to satisfy her customers' demands and increase her sales.  For this reason, she has decided to request a loan for 1,500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her achieve her goal.

Hilda is a woman who has a great desire to get ahead in life.  She works hard every day in her business and the people who know her consider her to be responsible and trustworthy.

loans.use: To buy convenience store items and groceries to expand her grocery store

loans.name: Nelson Jesus

texts.es:
Nelson Jesus T. V. tiene 22 años. Es soltero, vive con el papa, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. No Tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Nelson se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es crecer en el negocio.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Nelson Jesus T. V. is 22 years old.  He is single and lives with his father in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar province.  He has no children.

The members of the rural communal bank "Luz y Progreso" live 20 minutes from the Chillanes office, in the canton of Chillanes.  The 17 members of this communal bank work as farmers and professionals.

Nelson is a farmer who cultivates corn, beans, peas and chayote squash.  He buys his products in Chillanes and sells his crops in the Chillanes market and in the surrounding district.

He requests a loan to buy corn, bean, pea and chayote seeds.  The support of this loan will help him financially to buy the supplies he needs.  Farmers in this area face challenges such as pests, diseases and climatic changes.  His dream is to grow his business.

In his free time he enjoys participating in sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Reginah

texts.en:
Reginah N. M. is forty-five years old. She is widowed and has two children, aged fifteen and eight. Her business is located at Kinanie Trading Centre and is known by the name Jaribu shop. She is served by the Kitengela Branch. 

Reginah has a retail shop in which she sells general items.  This is a business she has been running for the last three years. She serves the local people and has one employee. She says that this business is profitable.  The major challenge she has is that there are so many people in the area doing the same kind of business, that customers are not loyal because they have many choices. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 60,000 to buy more general items to expand her business. She hopes to own her own supermarket in the future. She describes herself as very visionary.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Lucynia Yesica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “URPI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucynia Yesica; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de empleada d seguridad y también se dedica a la venta de chocolates, la socia vende los chocolates en forma ambulatoria llevando a diferentes tiendas que venden chocolates, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de chocolates. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chocolates al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Lucynia Yesica is a member of the "URPI" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Lucynia Yesica is 30 years old, married and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her work as a security guard.  She also sells chocolates.  She sells chocolates in an itinerant manner, delivering her products to different stores that sell chocolates.  She would like to expand her business.

Lucynia Yesica is requesting this loan to buy chocolates wholesale.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy chocolates wholesale

loans.name: Emigdio

texts.es:
El señor Emigdio Velásquez Orellana ha nacido el 5 de Agosto de 1959, en la localidad de Tiraque de la Provincia de Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba. 

La actividad que se dedica el señor Emigdio es la agricultura que siembra tubérculos, en la actividad trabajan toda la familia en algunos casos con ayuda de los vecinos según  sus usos y costumbres, las tierras que siembra se encuentran  en la parte alta de Tiraque las siembras que realizan son estacionales ósea que cosechan una vez al año.

La vivienda del señor es la construcción de puro barro con techo de teja, que está ubicado en la calle palmar salida a Millu Mayu. Vive con su familia que tiene dos hijos de vive con ellos y está casada con Basilia Pizo de Velásquez

El Crédito que ha solicitado es para comprar insumos agrícolas Obono de gallinaza y semilla de para ya para sembrar este año.
texts.en:
Mr. Emigdio Velásquez Orellana was born on the 5th of August 1959 in the locality of Tiraque in the province of Tiraque in the Cochabama department.

Mr. Emigdio works in agriculture planting tubers. His entire family works in this activity and in some cases has help from neighbours according to his habits and customs. The fields that he plants are located in the high part of Tiraque. The planting he does is seasonal, which is to say they harvest once a year.

Mr. Emigdio's home is constructed from pure mud and a tile roof. It is located on Palmar street exiting to Millu Maya. He lives with his family and has two children who live with them. He is married to Basilia Pizo de Velásquez.
  
The loan he has requested is to buy agricultural fertilizers, chicken manure, and seeds to plant this year.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for agricultural activity

loans.name: Ser-Od

texts.en:
Ser-Od is 49 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and one of his three sons in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own. Ser-Od's two younger sons attend college in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.
Ser-Od operates a carpentry business and a taxi service. He began his carpentry business in 2000, and he takes orders to make wooden furniture. He made all the furniture in his own house himself. In addition to his woodcraft business, he also operates a taxi service between towns using his Russian jeep. Ser-Od is a hardworking and active person who is trying hard to make a better life. He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more wood and materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more wood and materials

loans.name: Ourn

texts.en:
Ourn Y., 38, is widowed and resides with her two children in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Y. is a farmer and raises animals at home, earning an income of approximately $25 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $25 on food and $40 on the other necessary expenses. 

Y. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more cows to raise and sell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner. Y. appears in the photograph with her mother and kid.

loans.use: buy more cows to raise and sell

loans.name: Mujeres De Chilcatotoras (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres de Chilcatotoras esta conformado por 12 mujeres que en su mayoría se dedican al trabajo en el campo como la agricultura y ganadería, trabajos que les permiten estar cerca de sus hijos para cuidarlos y también aportan a la economía de sus hogares. Viven por la comunidad de Chilcatotoras que  pertenece a la parroquia de Tarqui, parroquia es de clima frió y se caracteriza por ser una zona ganadera y agrícola, su gente es muy amable y carismática. 

La Señora. Carmen Rocío L. vive por la comunidad de Chilcatotoras, se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue  invitada por una amiga.
Tiene 20 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 2 hijos de 2 y 1 año de edad. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de su mamá compartiendo los gastos.
La Señora. Carmen Rocío se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos que aun están pequeños, a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la cría de animales como: borregos y cuyes a los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes para continuar con este negocio. Su meta es tener su casa propia para vivir con su familia.

La Señora. Susana Angelica G. vive por la comunidad de Chilcatotoras, tiene 27 de años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la comunidad. Su esposo labora como albañil y con el trabajo conyugal han construido su casa propia.
Doña Susana Angelica se encuentra en su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga. Se dedica a la cría de animales como: gallinas, chanchos y ganado, la leche que obtiene de sus vacas vende a los carros lecheros que hay por el sector, esta actividad la desempeña hace 4 años.
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para fertilizar sus potreros. Su meta es terminar  su casa ya que aun le faltan algunos arreglos.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres de Chilcatotoras' (Women of Chilcatotoras) community bank is made up of 12 women who mainly work in agriculture and livestock raising.  These jobs allow them to be near their children, in order to look after them and contribute to their family finances.  They live in the community of Chilcatotoras, in the parish of Taqui.  This parish has a cold climate and is known as an area that is dedicated to agriculture and livestock raising.  The people are kind and charismatic.

Carmen Rocío L. lives in the community of Chilcatotoras.  This is the third loan that she has accessed through her community bank.  She was invited to join the community bank by her friend.

Carmen is 20 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 2 children aged 2 and 1.  Her husband works in the construction industry as a bricklayer.  They don't own their own home but live in her mom's house, sharing expenses.

Carmen Rocío looks after her children who are still young.  She also takes care of her household chores and raises animals such as lambs and guinea pigs.  She sells these animals when she has a financial need to do so.

Carmen Rocío will invest her loan money in buying guinea pigs in order to continue in her business.  Her goal is to own her own home to live in together with her family.

Susana Angelica G. lives in the community of Chilcatotoras.  She is 27 years old, married, and has 2 children aged 6 and 4.  Her eldest child attends the local elementary school.  Her husband works as a construction worker and together they have managed to build their own home.  

Susana Angelica is taking her first loan through her community bank.  She was invited to join by a friend.  Her business is raising animals such as hens, pigs and cattle.  She sells the milk that she obtains from her cows to milk floats in the area.  She has been in this business for 4 years.  She will invest her loan money in buying manure to fertilize her pastures.  Her goal is to finish building her home since she still has some work to carry out.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy baking material such as pans

loans.name: Vitaliano Teofilo

texts.es:
El sr. Vitaliano Teofilo Z., tiene 43 años de edad, les apoya a sus dos padres que viven con el, viven en la comunidad de san pedro del municipio de mizque del departamento de Cochabamba 

Trabaja en la agricultura, produce cebolla y  zanahoria, que los vende en el mismo lugar.
Vitaliano, es una persona responzable en su comunidad, por la dedicacion a su trabajo y por la atencion de sus queridos padres que viven con el ya muy viejitos.

El credito que ha solicitado los va invertir en la compra de mas semillas e insumos,   aumentar sus superficies de cultivos y aumentar su produccion y de esa forma tener mas ingresos y mejorar la condicion de vida de el y la de sus padres.
texts.en:
Mr. Vitaliano Teofilo Z., 43, supports his two parents who live with him in the community of San Pedro in Mizque municipality, Cochabamba Department.

He works farming onions and carrots which he sells there as well.  Vitalino is a responsible person in his community because of his dedication to his work and the care he provides his parents who live with him and are quite elderly.

He will use the requested loan to buy more seed and supplies, to increase his planted surface area and to increase production in order to have more income and improve the living conditions of himself and his parents.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia M. is from the village of Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Delia is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a beauty product direct selling business. She has been engaged in this business for five years and makes approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Delia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Delia is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used for purchasing new beauty products for her direct selling business. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for her direct selling

loans.name: Folorita

texts.en:
Folorita is 37 years of age and married with three children. She has owned and operated a business selling dairy products in the local community for 3 years. Folorita needs a loan of WST 1500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 260 talas or US $108 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2010, Folorita joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Folorita's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional dairy products to sell

loans.name: Diana Yaneth

texts.es:
A sus 24 años de edad, Diana es una joven emprendedora que se desempeña como madre comunitaria del Instituto de Bienestar Familiar, oficio que desempeña desde su casa pero que no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y hacerse cargo de su madre. 

Debido a la necesidad de incrementar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida, Diana empezó desde hace algunos días con la venta de productos por catálogo con el propósito de mejorar su calidad de vida, pues en el futuro espera estudiar para convertirse en profesional. 

Actualmente, Diana necesita de un préstamo para comprar surtido propio de la revista que en oportunidades viene en promoción y así lograr incrementar sus ganancias, así mismo requiere de algunos videos y material demostrativo con el que mostrará los beneficios de dichos productos y así llegar cada vez a más clientes y acreditar su negocio.
texts.en:
At the age of 24, Diana is a young and enterprising woman who works as a day care worker at the Instituto de Bienestar Familiar. She carries out her activities from her house but the wages are not enough to cover her household expenses and to support her mother.
