Given her need to increase her income and to improve the quality of her life, Diana started to sell products through a catalogue a few days a go. Her goal is to improve the quality of her life and in the future to go to school to earn a career.

Currently, Diana needs a loan to purchase a variety of products from the catalogue when they come up for sale to increase her profits. She also requires a few videos and samples to display the benefits of the products and to earn more clients and to establish a reputation for her business.

loans.use: to purchase products from a catalogue and samples to display.

loans.name: G.s. En Nombre De Jesus Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario En Nombre De Jesús está conformado por Johana Maria y Margarita Esperanza. Johana se dedica a la venta de quesillos, tiene más de 4 años de tener este negocio inicio desde muy joven ya que su mama, se dedicaba a este tipo de actividad y fue más adelante que Johana decide encargarse del negocio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de cuajada, cebolla, vinagre, bolsas plásticas y otros productos. Sueña con establecer un kiosco en la escuela donde ofrece sus productos.
texts.en:
The support group "En Nombre de Jesús" is comprised of Johana María and Margarita Esperanza.  Johana has been selling cheese for over four years.  She got involved in the activity when she was young because her mother did the same thing for a living, and later Johana decided to take over the business.

The loan is to buy curd, onion, vinegar, plastic bags and other products.  Her dream is to set up a kiosk at the school so she can offer her products there.

loans.use: To buy curd, onion, vinegar, plastic bags and other products.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Las Fresitas del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.
Se dedica a la venta de remedios vegetales, cortezas medicinales y macerados, que los vende en la ciudad de Lima, generalmente lleva pedidos, por ahora. Los envases son botellas de gaseosas, mas adelante comprará sus francos para envasarlo adecuadamente.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 25 litros de aguardiente, 3 kilos de corteza de chuchuazi, 1 kilo de kion, 5 kilos de uña de gato, 1 kilo de jergón sacha, 2 kilos de huito, 3 Litros de miel.
Este trabajo lo realiza junto a su esposo, ninguno de sus hijos vive con ellos y tienen que trabajar para poder sustentarse sus gastos básicos y alimentación.
"Gracias a Manuela Ramos por brindar esta ayuda a las mujeres que de verdad lo necesitan".
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of “Las Fresitas del Distrito de Yarinacocha” Communal Bank in the department of Ucayali. She is 53 years old, married and has three children.
She sells herbal remedies, medicinal bark, and macerations that she sells in the city of Lima.  She usually takes orders, for now.  She uses soda bottles for the containers. In the future she will buy jars to package it adequately. 
With her new loan of 2,000 new Peruvian soles, she will buy 25 liters of alcohol, 3 kilos of chuchuazi bark, 1 kilo of ginger, 5 kilos of cat’s claw, 1 kilo of Jergon Sacha, 2 kilos of Huito and 3 liters of honey. 
She undertakes this work with her husband. None of their children live with them, and they have to work in order to cover their basic expenses and food. “Thanks to Manuela Ramos for providing help to these women that really need it.”

loans.use: to buy bark and alcohol.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: As everyone knows, fish is the main vital fresh food for everybody, in particular families who depend on fishing and fish-selling. Mr. Meas, one among those people, currently depends on selling fish at the local busy market. He and his wife sell fish that they buy from their wholesale supplier. They are humble parents who have been blessed with six children. One has already married and five are single, of which one works as a domestic construction worker in the Siem Reap Province. Mr. Meas has requested a loan to purchase more fresh fish for selling. Mr. Meas hopes he can increase his net income by using a Kiva loan as an advance.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish for selling.

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.es:
Leocadia nos cuenta que nació en la comunidad del Yungaqui (provincia de Anta, departamento Cusco, Perú), tiene 32 años de edad y tiene su pareja y juntos tienen dos hijos. Actualmente, Leocadia vive en la comunidad de Tambo Real (Anta, Cusco) y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Leocadia se dedica a la ganadería y también se dedica a la vende leche. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar ganado mejorado o ganado bien alimentado pues necesita cambiar de ganado para mejorar su productividad de leche.

Leocadia es una persona trabajadora y responsable que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Solidaridad de Tambo Real” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: Leonarda tells us she was born in the community of Yungaqui (province of Anta, department of Cusco, Peru). She is 32 years old, married and has two children. Currently, Leonarda lives and works in the community of Tambo Real (Anta, Cusco). She makes a living in livestock and also sells milk. She has had this business for a number of years and it is going very well thanks to the hard work she puts into her job. At this time she is requesting the loan to purchase better or well-nourished livestock since she needs to make changes to her herd to improve its milk production. Leonarda is a hard-working and responsible person, which is why she was invited by the other members to join the "Solidaridad de Tambo Real" community bank with Kiva partner Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to purchase better livestock.

loans.name: Net

texts.en: Net is a 45-year-old farmer. Her husband is a security guard and their income is $4 per day. Net has five children, two of whom are studying while the other three are working in a factory for $3 per day each. Every month, Net has to spend $88 on food, $10 on electricity, $25 on school fees, and $21 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy stuff for using in the house. She has a strong commitment to send her children to study at university when they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy stuff for using in the house.

loans.name: Paola Cecilia

texts.es:
Paola tiene 28 años vive con su esposo en Machachi cerca de Latacunga, no tienen hijos, se describe como una persona trabajadora, responsable, humilde que lucha ante las adversidades y cumple con sus objetivos.

Trabaja en corte y confección de calentadoes,pezcadores, etc; puso su taller hace tres años gracias a FODEMI, solicitó el crédito para la compra de materia prima (rollos de tela lycra) el cual le proporciona más mercadería y le generaría mas ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y poder crear fuentes de trabajo para mujeres necesitadas, también su anhelo es poder construir su propia casa y dejar de pagar arriendo.
texts.en:
Paola is 28 years old and she lives with her husband in Machachi, near Latacunga. They do not have children. She describes herself as a hardworking, responsible, and humble person who struggles in the face of adversities and who attains her objectives. 

She makes sweaters and jackets, etc. She set up her shop three years ago thanks to FODEMI (Kiva Field Partner). She requested a loan to purchase materials (rolls of Lycra brand fabric). This will allow her to make more products and it will generate for her more income to improve her quality of life. 

Her dream is to see her business grow and to be able to create jobs for women in need. Her goal is also to build a house of her own and to stop having to rent.

loans.use: to purchase rolls of Lycra brand fabric.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
This is Jesus, 64 years old and a resident of Malibay, a section of Pasay City in the Philippines. He is married to Cristifa, an overseas contract worker and mother to their four children, all of whom have already married and have their own families. Jesus manages his household while operating his business. At this time he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Jesus rents out nine rooms inside his apartment to local students and employees who rent on a monthly basis. He earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP per room rented.

To help him continue operations, Jesus is requesting a 27,000 PHP loan from CCT. He will be using the loan to repair and maintain his rental units. He expects a boost in his income as he expands his business. He hopes to finish his renovations soon.

All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups comprised of fifteen to thirty members that meet on a weekly basis. Jesus faithfully meets with his co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans. Jesus draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his rental units.

loans.name: Gnakana

texts.fr: Madame Gnakana est  une veuve de 67 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Elle s’active depuis plus de 10 ans dans le commerce de pagnes et d’arachides. Elle a choisi son activité par nécessité  pour subvenir a ses besoins vitaux. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus c’est l’aspect lucratif de l’activité. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis février 2011. Elle a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur . elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de pagnes a revendre pour la fête  de la korité. Elle souhaite développer  son activité de commerce, accroitre  ses bénéfices et améliorer sa situation sociale.
texts.en: Ms. Gnakana is a 67-year-old widow who lives in Senegal. She has been active for over ten years in the commerce of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and in peanuts. She chose this work out of necessity to meet her vital needs. What is the most interesting thing to her about this work is the lucrative aspect. She has been a member of a branch of the micro-finance institution U-IMCEC since February 2011. She has already repaid a previous loan. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 for buying pagne cloth to resell for the Korité holiday. She would like to develop her business, to grow her profits, and to improve her social situation.

loans.use: to buy traditional cloth to resell

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Madame  Astou habite au Sénégal. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée  et  évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 20 ans.  Elle s’adonne à la vente de tissus  et déodorants pour femmes. Elle a choisi son activité dans le but de ne pas rester oisive.  La période la plus favorable pour ses activités c’est les moments de fête. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 14 mois. Elle a déjà soldé un prêt antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus et d’autres articles de femmes   en vue des préparatifs  des  fêtes  de korité. Ces produits sont destinés à la vente.  Ce financement lui permettra d’augmenter et de diversifier les produits  qu’elle propose a sa clientèle. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui donne l’opportunité de  participer a la gestion de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en: Astou is 40 years old, married and lives in Senegal. She became a retailer because she wanted to keep busy, and has been active in the retail sector for over 20 years. She sells fabrics and deodorants for women and her business peaks during periods of festivity. She has been a member of a UIMCEC branch for 14 months and has already fully repaid a previous loan. She is requesting a new loan of 300 000 francs in order to buy fabrics and other products for her female clientele to buy for the festival of Korité (the celebration that marks the end of Ramadan). This loan will allow her to increase her stock and diversify the range of products she can offer to her customers. The increase in her profits will allow her to contribute to her daily expenses.

loans.use: to restock with various products for resale.

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is a 25-year-old, hardworking man living in a family house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to see his siblings complete university. He is a company driver and has been in service for two years. His challenge is the meager salary earned, and his dream is to set up a business. 

Collins needs the loan to pay school fees for his siblings.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his siblings.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is an entrepreneur and has been running her fish selling business for almost 10 years. She is widowed and has three children. Since the demand for fish has been steadily increasing, Gemma would like to take out a loan amounting to P7,000 to purchase more fish wholesale which will enable her to increase her profit and attract more custumers to buy her products. She hopes that through her business, she can be a successful entrepreneur someday. Gemma would be thankful if her requested loan is approved, so that she can support her family.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing more fish to sell within the community.

loans.name: Yessica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yessica, administra una tienda donde ofrecen productos de primera necesidad, vive con su esposo y un hijo, este negocio lo tiene en el centro de la ciudad y aprovecha a vender más que todos los días de comercio.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo  para la compra de frijol, arroz, aceite, pastas, papel higiénico, esta compra es muy necesaria para que el negocio este fortalecido y pueda atender la demanda.
La aspiración de Yessica es que con estos préstamos pueda crecer en calidad de comerciante, recibiendo más clientela y generando mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Yessica administers a store where she offers groceries and necessities.  She lives with her husband and son.  She has her business in the center of the city and she takes advantage of the location to sell more than others.  At present she requests a loan for the purchase of beans, rice, oil, pastas, nd toilet paper.  This purchase is very necessary so that the business is well supplied and she can attend to the demand.  Yessica's aspiration is that she grow merchant with this loan, receiving more clientele and generating greater profits.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, oil, pasta and toilet paper.

loans.name: Nazima

texts.ru: Nazima zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Ona yavlyayetysa IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas proojivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoim mujem i detmi. Ona uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey mami. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Nazima is married and has two children.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives with her husband and children in the Fuzuli region.  She has been involved in animal husbandry and breeding cattle for seven years.  Nazima learned this business from her mother.  She currently needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle in order to increase livestock quantity available for sale.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to increase livestock quantity available for sale

loans.name: Khaledieh

texts.en:
Khaledieh is a 41-years-old divorced woman from Madaba, Jordan.

Khaledieh does embroidery and she is working from her home and is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase a sewing machine so that she can improve her business.

Khaledieh is looking to improve her financiA. conditions since she is divorced.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a soft drink retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more cases of soft drinks to sell.

Leonila has been in this business for five years. Leonila earns more income from selling firewood and ready-to-wear clothing.

Leonila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more cases of soft drinks

loans.name: Lilliam

texts.es: La señora Liliam, es casada, desde hace 10 años trabaja como comerciante en su propio negocio donde vende productos como ropa, cosméticos,zapatos y otras cositas que su clientela le encargue. Está solicitando su primer crèdito para construir la cocina de su casa de habitaciòn, la cual esta en malas condiciones; cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que labora como mecanico y asume los gastos del hogar. El mayor deseo de Lilliam es poder ver bonita su casa con una cocina amplia y bien acondicionada, para que su familia se sienta a gusto en la casita que con tanto amor han hecho para ellos.
texts.en: Lilliam is married.  She’s been working as a merchant in her own business for ten years selling clothes, cosmetics, shoes and other things that her customers request.  She is asking for her first loan to build a kitchen in her home which is in poor condition.  She can count on support from her husband who works as a mechanic and takes on all the household expenses.  Lilliam’s greatest wish is to see her house pretty and with a spacious, well-furnished kitchen so that her family can feel comfortable at home which she’s formed for them with so much love.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to rebuild her kitchen.

loans.name: Marylyne

texts.en:
Marylyne is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in the business. She dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier in the future.

With the KES 60,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Agua Llamaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AGUA LLAMAYA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Patacamaya, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Celia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: productor de frutas, transporte, venta de fruta, tienda de barrio.

La señora Celia  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de productor y comerciante de frutas que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de sus padres.

El préstamo que sacará es para el alquiler de una huerta para cultivo de frutas en su comunidad y posteriormente a la cosecha lo comercializará en las ferias de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.
texts.en:
The “Agua Llamaya” communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya focal center.  It has ten members led by a governing board headed by Celia.  The communal bank members are engaged in a variety of businesses such as: fruit grower, transport, fruit sales and neighborhood store.

Celia indicates that this is the first time she’s worked with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution thanks to an invitation from a promoter.  She currently grows and sells fruit, something she’s been doing for years having learned it from her parents.

The loan she’ll take out is to pay the lease on an orchard to grow fruit in her community and later on when it’s harvested she’ll sell it in various street markets in El Alto.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family since she’s married and has five children.

loans.use: to pay rent on the orchard.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es: La socia Saturnina,  continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores y venta de hortalizas, verduras, ganadería y agricultura, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de 15 pares de cuyes, 30 pares de gallinas; La socia solicita el credito para comprar 15 pares de cuyes y 30 pares de gallinas.
texts.en: Saturnina is continuing with her business raising small animals, selling vegetables and livestock, and farming.  At this time, she wants to invest a loan in the purchase of 15 pairs of guinea pigs and 30 pairs of chickens.  She requests a loan to buy 15 pairs of guinea pigs and 30 pairs of chickens.

loans.use: to buy 5 pairs of guinea pigs and 30 pairs of chickens

loans.name: Emigdia

texts.es:
Ña Emigdia tiene 50 años, está casada con Juan quien tiene una zapatería propia con lo cual ayuda en los gastos de la casa, viven en su casa de la ciudad de Carapeguá, tienen 2 hijos. Emigdia tiene una pequeña despensa bien surtida con la cual abastece a su barrio.
Comenta que su negocio está ubicado en un lugar muy bien ubicado, lo cual la ayuda en las ventas y también en atraer a más clientes.  Ella cuenta que se dedica a esto hace 15 años, y dice que le gustaría poder seguir trabajando en su pequeña despensa y así seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de bebidas, azúcar, arroz, frutas, verduras y demás artículos de primera necesidad, con lo cual abastecerá su negocio y podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en:
Emigdia is 50 years old.  She is married to Juan, who has his own shoe store with which he helps to pay household expenses.  They live in their house in the city of Carapeguá.  They have 2 children.  Emigdia has a well stocked, small store with which she supplies her neighborhood.
She says that her business is located in a very good place, which helps her sales and also to attract more customers.  She says that she has been doing this for 15 years.  She also says that she would like to be able to continue working in her small store, and therefore continue helping her family.
She is asking for the loan in order to buy drinks, sugar, rice, fruits, vegetables, and other basic necessities.  With the loan, she will establish her business and will be able to fulfill the demand of her customers.  She thanks the foundation and Kiva for the opportunity that they are giving to her.

loans.use: buy drinks, sugar, rice, fruits, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Florencio Javier

texts.es:
Florencio vive en el distrito de Parcona, distrito caracterizado por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo sus pobladores son personas muy amables y muy alegres. Florencio es muy trabajador, pero cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, asimismo le encanta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo Ceviche. Floreció es padre de 3 hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad,  por quienes ha trabajado muy duro pada hacerlos personas de bien y sobre todo mejores que él, ya que debido a sus pocos recursos económicos él solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Florencio trabaja en su negocio como chofer de taxi, el labora alrededor de 12 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes al día; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque es muy responsable cuando conduce.

Florencio esta muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo y compra de repuestos, con lo cual el tendrá un vehículo más seguro para transportar a sus clientes y de esta manera el podrá seguir luchando y trabajando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.

loans.use: Para manteniemiento y compra de repuestos

loans.name: Jitahidi Youth Group

texts.en:
Jitahidi Youth Group was formed when a group of young people who were in the business of garbage collection decided to come together to provide socio-economic support to each other. As a result, the group established a merry-go round where they would provide micro loans and emergency loans to its members.

Joseph on the far right is a single father raising a child with the help of his parents. He has successfully completed training on life skills and he hopes to use the loan in starting poultry business. The Group was identified by Junior Achievement and they are currently undergoing an entrepreneurship program with the objective of building their capacity to grow and expand their businesses. The group through market research has seen the opportunity of selling eggs and chicken in the community and have already constructed a brooder for their venture.

Through mentorship from Junior Achievement the group will be able to embark on poultry business and be successful given the need for the product and the newly acquired business skills that the members of the group have.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy the chicks and the feed for the chicks to start an extended poulty business.

loans.name: Eva Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Eva Mercedes, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de los cuales 1 está a su cargo,  se dedica al comercio desde hace 14 años, donde su negocio actual es la venta de bisuterías en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, ella inicia a ofertar el producto a su clientela desde las 04:00 am  y finalizándolas a las 06:00 pm con el mismo horario de lunes a sábado, realiza esta labor para la mantención de su hogar y su hijo.   

Doña Eva, solicito a Ceprodel un crédito el que utilizó para la compra de productos tales como: cosméticos en general, caramelos, productos diana, chocolates, chicles, aretes, collares, shampoo, entre otros productos, así lograr mayores ventas incrementando su inventario con productos de mayor calidad lo cual le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos al igual que un mejor nivel de vida junto a su familia.

loans.use: Compra de cosméticos en general, caramelos, productos diana, chocolates, chicles, aretes, collares, shampoo, entre otros productos.

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en: Raeda is now in her third year at the university majoring in raising children. She used her previous loan to pay for her ‎second year semesters fees, now she is applying to another loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees. Raeda is eager ‎to work in her study field after getting her Bachelors.‎

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Ms N. is a single mother of 4 children. The eldest daughter is marries while the other 3 are still in school. She deals in new clothes moving from one market to another over the week.  She has been doing this kind of business for over 20 years. Hence she is well experienced in it. This is the first time she has taken a loan to boost her business. The loan of US$528/450 will be used to boost her stock which has been eroded with the payments of school fees in the month of January. She will also be able to sustain her stock longer as she is now forced to keep on traveling to the city to restock.  Ms N. is supporting the local economy  through her business.

loans.use: Buy Clothing Stock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with four children. She lives in Kijichi area in Dar es Salaam. The area has no reliable water supply. By the help of her husband and her own savings she managed to buy a water tank and an electric pump. The demand for water is very high due to house construction going on in the area. Apart from construction, water is also highly needed for normal domestic uses by people in her neighborhood.

She is in need of USD 1000 to buy another tank to act as a treatment point and reservoir for water.

loans.use: Purchase of water tank

loans.name: Ana Argentina

texts.en:
My name is Ana A., and I have dedicated myself to making and selling fried corn for the past two years. My customers are good ones; they really enjoy the taste of my product and purchase quite a bit. My goal is to increase my sales, and with the earnings I'll be able to provide for my family and get another burner so I can make more fried corn.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Mi nombre es Ana A. me dedico a la produccion y venta de fritas de maiz, tengo mi negocio hace unos 2 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que les gusta mucho el sabor de mis fritas y me compran bastante, mi meta es incrementar mis ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y hacer otro fogon para producir mas fritas.

loans.use: Purchase corn meal, oil, lard, salt, firewood, matches and sugar.

loans.name: Hom

texts.en: Mrs. Hom T. is 25 years old and works as a  farmer growing crops on a plantation and she earns $4 a day from this activity. She would like to use a loan to purchase two cows for her rice paddy. Hom T. has a husband who works as an electrician and earns $2.5 every day.

loans.use: To purchase two cows for her rice paddy.

loans.name: Shahina

texts.en: Shahina is 44 years old and the mother of 2 children. She lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. Shas started her business 15 years ago and now has her own orchard.  She is looking for a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides so that she can improve her harvest.

loans.use: to buy pesticides

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en: Nargiza is one of the active clients of Microinvest. Her starting capital was about $100. She started her business one year ago in the Ovchikalacha food market, in one of the districts of Khujand. She sold cookies from a local bakery. Step by step, she increased her working capital and started to buy other food products from the wholesale market in Istaravshan, Khujand. Today she has a stable profit from a wide assortment of goods. Her future loan she wants to spend to further develop her business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Sanitoa

texts.en: Sanitoa is a widowed mother of five who is 53 years old. Her husband was a carpenter for over 10 years. When her husband passed away two years ago she had hard times in supporting her children, especially in sending them to school. Sanitoa's mother was a tailor herself, and through her mother she learned how to cut and sew clothes. She heard of SPBD through her family relatives, and she is very happy and excited for such a rare opportunity where she can receive a loan of money to assist in buying the things she needs for her business.

loans.use: Sanitoa would like to buy supplies and materials for her sewing business.

loans.name: Mukarram

texts.en: A. Mukarram lives in the Nausky region and  is married with 3 children. Mrs. Ataevahas has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2004 and is recommended as a reliable client. The stability of her business and increase in income has helped her to make timely payments on her prior loans. She started the business from scratch and through time she opened her own shop that sells children's clothing. She is very polite and the prices of her goods are lower than the bazaar prices which is why she has loyal repeat clients. Mrs. A. requests a loan of 4100 STJ for the existing business development and to purchase new goods.

loans.use: Existing business development and purchasing new goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a wide range of products to replenish a grocery store

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is an energetic and enterprising mother of 4 children and owns a corner store that sells various household items, including plastic chairs, plastic containers, and ropes.

Her first son is currently attending nursing school, and her second son is eager to attend university. She hopes this loan will allow her to generate more income to support her son's dream of attending university.

She is a member of the trust group called With God. The trust group works under the principle of peer pressure, where each member of the group guarantees for each other in case of default.

Stella stands in front of her store on the right side of her loan officer, Dorothy, and Joshua, the Kiva coordinator for Sinapi.

loans.use: To expand her inventory to raise her income

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
In the Somotiillo area of Chinandega city, Mrs. Ana Rios has been selling flowers for two years, and has her own business selling flowers from her home.

It is necessary to note that she is a widow who upon losing her husband began selling these products to support her household. Today thanks to the support that she has received from Ceprodel, she has been able to improve her economic condition and has acquired great quantities of flowers to sell.

Today she approached Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will enable her to acquire flowers from growers to sell them and thereby continue her business in her home with your support.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Ana Rios se dedica desde hace doce años al negocio de venta de flores teniendo su propio establecimiento en su casa de habitación donde las comercializa.

Es necesario destacar que ella es una dama viuda que al haber perdido a su esposo inició con la labor de la venta de estos productos para el sostén de su hogar. Hoy en día gracias al apoyo que le ha proporcionado Ceprodel, ha logrado mejorar su condición económica y ha adquirido mayores cantidades de flores para la venta.

Hoy en día una vez más acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita adquirir las flores de los proveedores para comercializarlas y así continuar con su sustento en su localidad de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase flowers

loans.name: Jeanne D'arc

texts.fr:
Jeanne D’Arc N., age 51, divorced, is a member of the village bank of Sinthiang Houlata. She wants to bolster her business, which consists of buying pigs, fattening them up in a pen, and re-selling them. Her income enables her to improve her living standard and her business. Jeanne is applying for a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months. Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Jeanne D’Arc N. 51 ans, divorcée est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Houlata Elle veut renforcer son activité qui consiste à acheter des porcs, les engraisser dans un enclos et revendre. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer son cadre de vie et d’activité. Jeanne sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy pigs, feed, and an enclosed pen
